video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:00:44.181 --> 00:00:46.430
To adjust the gap setting,
press the up and
00:00:46.430 --> 00:00:49.590
down arrows on your steering
wheel control switch.
00:00:49.590 --> 00:00:52.240
Pressing it up decreases your
follow distance setting and
00:00:52.240 --> 00:00:54.330
allows your car to follow
at a closer distance.
00:00:55.530 --> 00:00:58.530
And pressing it down, increases
your follow distance setting, and
00:00:58.530 --> 00:01:01.460
expands the distance between you and
a car in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg4.mp4
question: What does increasing your "follow distance" do?

video_name: Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.947
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.947 --> 00:00:09.731
Your Mustang has a feature that allows you
to do a burn out to heat up your tires for
00:00:09.731 --> 00:00:12.040
an improved track experience.
00:00:12.040 --> 00:00:15.430
It's called Line Lock and
it's part of the Track Apps feature.
00:00:15.430 --> 00:00:19.830
When turned on, the front brakes are
locked so the rear wheels can spin freely.
00:00:19.830 --> 00:00:23.690
This is helpful when doing a burnout to
heat up the tires for better traction.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo_seg1.mp4
question: What is Line Lock in Mustang?

video_name: Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc
video_trans:
00:00:46.150 --> 00:00:46.960
Keep in mind,
00:00:46.960 --> 00:00:51.150
your daytime running lamps will only work
when you're in the autolamp position and
00:00:51.150 --> 00:00:54.250
if you've set them to come on under
preferences in the information display.
00:00:55.380 --> 00:00:59.475
If your daytime running lamps are set
to off in the information display,
00:00:59.475 --> 00:01:01.099
they will not turn on at all.

Scroll to Advanced Settings >

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:02:31.040 --> 00:02:34.300
You can also input preset channels for
quick selection.
00:02:34.300 --> 00:02:37.362
To do so, tune to the channel
you wish to save, then touch and
00:02:37.362 --> 00:02:39.360
hold one of the memory preset buttons.
00:02:39.360 --> 00:02:44.420
The sound will mute for a brief moment
before resuming when the channel is saved.
00:02:44.420 --> 00:02:48.730
To add or view additional preset channels,
just touch the preset button.
00:02:48.730 --> 00:02:53.960
You can save up to 18 Sirius XM channels
with the three sets of presets.

There's also a tow haul mode feature,
00:01:19.220 --> 00:01:23.410
which enhances control when hauling

00:01:23.410 --> 00:01:25.960
augments transmission operation

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:44.190 --> 00:00:46.160
Now, let me show you how it works.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:50.420
The LATCH system consists of three
anchor points to secure your child seat.
00:00:50.420 --> 00:00:54.850
The two lower anchors in the seat bite,
where the back and the seat cushion meet.
00:00:54.850 --> 00:00:58.860
And the top tether anchor on the back
of or behind the vehicle seat, here.
00:01:00.520 --> 00:01:04.110
Attach the metal connectors on
the bottom of your child seat, remember,
00:01:04.110 --> 00:01:08.320
the ones that are either rigid or
on a strap, to the anchors,
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:11.350
which may be marked with
a child seat symbol, here.
00:01:11.350 --> 00:01:12.870
If your seat has straps,
00:01:12.870 --> 00:01:16.060
tighten them by pulling up until
the seat is secure and doesn't move.
00:01:16.060 --> 00:01:19.780
If your clips are on a rigid attachment,
push your seat back and
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:23.270
forth after you've attached it,
to make sure it doesn't move.
00:01:23.270 --> 00:01:27.190
Once you've installed your child seat with
the lower anchors of the latch system,
00:01:27.190 --> 00:01:31.910
attach the top tether strap under the head
rest, or over the top of the head
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:36.010
restraint, if it's not adjustable or
removable, and tighten the strap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA_seg4.mp4
question: What secures the child seat in the back?

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:00:22.890 --> 00:00:25.210
To activate the park assist feature,
00:00:25.210 --> 00:00:28.670
press the active park assist button
on the center console, here.
00:00:28.670 --> 00:00:31.400
Then signal to indicate which side
you'd like the vehicle to search.
00:00:32.520 --> 00:00:35.450
An information screen will
appear on your center display.
00:00:35.450 --> 00:00:39.120
And the system will begin to scan for
available parking spots.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.160
Once an appropriate spot is found,
youâ€™ll hear a chime and
00:00:42.160 --> 00:00:44.910
see a spot found message on your screen.
00:00:44.910 --> 00:00:48.180
Follow the prompts on your screen,
accelerating, shifting and
00:00:48.180 --> 00:00:50.070
braking as needed.
00:00:50.070 --> 00:00:52.180
And be sure to watch your mirrors and
your surroundings for
00:00:52.180 --> 00:00:54.660
any objects which you may
be getting too close to.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU_seg2.mp4
question: How do you activate the park assist feature?

video_name: 8' Productivity Screen _ Ford How-To _ Ford-apfpV4zPyrc
video_trans:
00:00:29.470 --> 00:00:33.870
When you do, you'll notice the oil
pressure, engine temperature, fuel and
00:00:33.870 --> 00:00:37.630
transmission temperature gauges, are
always displayed at the top of the screen.
00:00:37.630 --> 00:00:40.590
Keep in mind, you can switch
the transmission temperature gauge,
00:00:40.590 --> 00:00:42.200
to display a turbo boost gauge.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/8' Productivity Screen _ Ford How-To _ Ford-apfpV4zPyrc_seg3.mp4
question: What can you see on the MyView screen?

video_name: Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo
video_trans:
00:00:23.690 --> 00:00:29.339
To use line lock, using the five-way
switch scroll down to Track Apps.
00:00:29.339 --> 00:00:31.210
And select Line Lock from the menu.
00:00:31.210 --> 00:00:33.860
There are two steps to using Line Lock.
00:00:33.860 --> 00:00:36.660
This step verifies the driver and
car are ready.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:38.670
Simply follow the prompts on the screen.
00:00:38.670 --> 00:00:41.130
If you're unable to select Line Lock,
00:00:41.130 --> 00:00:43.570
check to be sure you're driving
under 25 miles an hour,
00:00:43.570 --> 00:00:49.060
the vehicle is on a level surface, and
you're not in another driving mode.
00:00:49.060 --> 00:00:54.370
To engage, firmly press and hold the
brakes, press OK on the steering wheel,
00:00:54.370 --> 00:00:57.980
remove your foot from the brake pedal,
and hit the accelerator.
00:00:57.980 --> 00:01:02.422
A 15 second countdown timer will
show the remaining time left before
00:01:02.422 --> 00:01:03.785
Line Lock shuts off.
00:01:03.785 --> 00:01:06.480
[MUSIC]
00:01:06.480 --> 00:01:10.670
You can always manually cancel it
by pressing the OK button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo_seg2.mp4
question: How do you turn line lock off?

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:01:34.500 --> 00:01:38.570
Trailer sway control works in conjunction
with the roll stability control system
00:01:38.570 --> 00:01:42.170
to determine if your trailer is swaying
and gradually applies your brakes.
00:01:42.170 --> 00:01:44.110
And if necessary,
reduces your engine power.
00:01:45.260 --> 00:01:47.780
Trailer tow mirrors are also
available to help improve
00:01:47.780 --> 00:01:49.850
rear visibility when
towing large trailers.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg8.mp4
question: How does the trailer sway control work?

video_name: Remote Power Tailgate Release _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pboOC6DrJAg
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.070
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.070 --> 00:00:07.360
Did you know that you can open your
tailgate without using your hands?
00:00:07.360 --> 00:00:08.700
Let me explain.
00:00:08.700 --> 00:00:11.340
Push the tailgate release button
on your remote two times.
00:00:12.500 --> 00:00:16.220
The tailgate is dampened, which reduces
the speed that the tailgate lowers.
00:00:16.220 --> 00:00:20.280
So don't worry, it'll gradually come down
to a flat position without slamming.
00:00:20.280 --> 00:00:22.620
To close the tailgate,
push it up with both hands.
00:00:23.640 --> 00:00:24.610
You can also lock and
00:00:24.610 --> 00:00:27.740
unlock the tailgate using the lock or
unlock buttons on your remote.
00:00:28.980 --> 00:00:31.496
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:31.496 --> 00:00:41.496
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Power Tailgate Release _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pboOC6DrJAg_seg1.mp4
question: How do you close your vehicle's tail gate?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:02:29.841 --> 00:02:34.098
First, measure the horizontal distance
from the license plate to the center of
00:02:34.098 --> 00:02:35.889
the hitch ball and write it down.
00:02:35.889 --> 00:02:40.242
Next, measure the horizontal distance from
the center of the hitch ball to the center
00:02:40.242 --> 00:02:41.148
of the sticker and
00:02:41.148 --> 00:02:44.731
the distance from the rear-view
camera to the center of the sticker.
00:02:44.731 --> 00:02:49.037
Keep in mind, the location is not
dependent on a straight or A frame type,
00:02:49.037 --> 00:02:53.211
but based on where a surface is
available that meets the requirements.
00:02:53.211 --> 00:02:57.236
And finally, the horizontal distance from
the tailgate to the center of the trailer
00:02:57.236 --> 00:02:59.000
axle if it's a single axle trailer.
00:03:00.080 --> 00:03:01.280
If the trailer has two or
00:03:01.280 --> 00:03:05.000
more axles, measure to the center
point between both axles, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg5.mp4
question: Where do I measure if my trailer has two axles?

video_name: SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw
video_trans:
00:01:45.930 --> 00:01:50.082
To set valet mode, which locks out the
SYNC 3 screen to the valet attendant while
00:01:50.082 --> 00:01:52.920
driving your car, press the Valet tile.
00:01:52.920 --> 00:01:56.440
You get a message asking you to enter
a personal identification number of your
00:01:56.440 --> 00:01:58.750
choice and if you want to continue.
00:01:58.750 --> 00:02:00.580
If so, press Yes.
00:02:00.580 --> 00:02:02.867
Then type in your PIN and press Done.
00:02:02.867 --> 00:02:05.810
Re-enter the PIN to complete the process.
00:02:05.810 --> 00:02:07.980
Once you get your key back from the valet,
00:02:07.980 --> 00:02:11.890
you need to enter the PIN again to turn
Valet Mode off and unlock the screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw_seg7.mp4
question: How do you enter Valet Mode pin to unlock?

video_name: F-150 Box Side Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dcsLsT9KpiU
video_trans:
00:00:14.850 --> 00:00:17.220
To extend the step from
its stowed position,
00:00:17.220 --> 00:00:19.820
simply press down on the release
with your foot here.
00:00:20.840 --> 00:00:24.100
To help avoid injury,
the box step has a slow release
00:00:24.100 --> 00:00:27.220
that prevents the step from
springing out too quickly.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Box Side Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dcsLsT9KpiU_seg2.mp4

video_name: 60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.348 --> 00:00:05.553
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.553 --> 00:00:07.440
Can these seat backs be folded down?
00:00:09.560 --> 00:00:11.150
>> Can I fold down just one side?
00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:15.320
>> Did you know that you
can fold down one or
00:00:15.320 --> 00:00:17.780
both of the rear seat
backs in your vehicle?
00:00:17.780 --> 00:00:21.680
And that's helpful when carrying
longer items like skis or golf bags.
00:00:21.680 --> 00:00:23.740
Here's how to do it.
00:00:23.740 --> 00:00:27.110
Find the release on top of the seat
back you want to fold down.
00:00:27.110 --> 00:00:31.715
Then, just push or pull up to release
the seat back and fold it down.
00:00:31.715 --> 00:00:35.235
Do the same thing on the other side
if you want to fold them both down.
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:38.175
You'll get a full pass through
from the trunk that way.
00:00:38.175 --> 00:00:42.601
And for your convenience, the 2013 Fusion
Hybrid battery has been moved to the floor
00:00:42.601 --> 00:00:45.349
of the trunk, so
it won't block the pass through.
00:00:45.349 --> 00:00:47.900
And there's a clip that holds
your safety belts in place, so
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.305
they won't get caught behind
when folding your seat back.
00:00:51.305 --> 00:00:52.395
Any questions?
00:00:52.395 --> 00:00:53.862
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:53.862 --> 00:00:54.529
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4_seg1.mp4
question: Can these seat backs be folded down?

See my view, which automatically shows

video_name: Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc
video_trans:
00:00:28.130 --> 00:00:31.080
To raise or lower the seat,
pull up on the lever located on
00:00:31.080 --> 00:00:35.190
the side of the seat closest to the door
to raise it and press down to lower it.
00:00:36.770 --> 00:00:39.680
You can also change the angle
of the seatback by pulling up on
00:00:39.680 --> 00:00:41.980
the adjustment lever on
the side of the seatback.
00:00:41.980 --> 00:00:45.490
Leaning backward or forward to the desired
position and then releasing the lever.

To wash the windshield,

video_trans:
00:01:57.030 --> 00:01:59.800
To lift the seat out of
the stowed position, squeeze and
00:01:59.800 --> 00:02:01.960
pull up on the handle as you lift.
00:02:01.960 --> 00:02:05.000
The seat will lift out of
the floor in a folded position.
00:02:05.000 --> 00:02:08.310
So just push it back to lock

position by pulling strap number 1 and

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:13.850 --> 00:01:18.030
You can adjust your follow distance using
the gap control on your steering wheel.
00:01:18.030 --> 00:01:20.950
Pressing it up decreases your
follow distance setting and
00:01:20.950 --> 00:01:23.910
allows your car to follow
at a closer distance.
00:01:23.910 --> 00:01:26.589
And pressing it down increases
your follow distance and
00:01:26.589 --> 00:01:30.320
expands the distance between you and
a car in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg6.mp4

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:01:10.090 --> 00:01:10.830
When braking or
00:01:10.830 --> 00:01:14.970
coasting, you'll see power flow back from
the drive train to charge the battery.
00:01:14.970 --> 00:01:17.890
This represents active
regenerative braking.
00:01:17.890 --> 00:01:21.030
When more power is needed,
the gasoline engine will turn on.
00:01:21.030 --> 00:01:24.650
For instance, when driving on a highway,
under heavy acceleration,
00:01:24.650 --> 00:01:28.670
driving in low gear, or
while the battery is in charge mode
00:01:28.670 --> 00:01:32.180
you'll see a gray power flow cap
when it's switched to hybrid power.
00:01:32.180 --> 00:01:37.063
The flow begins at the fuel tank, and goes
to the engine, and then to the wheels.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg4.mp4
question: When does my hybrid power turn on?

video_name: Rear Folding Seats with Side Release and Folding Head Restraints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nTO2w5-8rIA
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.364
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.364 --> 00:00:09.020
Did you know that you can fold
the back seat down in your vehicle?
00:00:09.020 --> 00:00:10.590
Here's how to do it.
00:00:10.590 --> 00:00:13.670
First, fold the outside
head restraints down and
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:16.160
lower the center head restraint like this.
00:00:16.160 --> 00:00:20.830
Next, find the lever located on
the side of the seat base, here, and
00:00:20.830 --> 00:00:22.920
pull the level up to
fold the seat back down.
00:00:24.180 --> 00:00:28.250
To unfold your seats, just pull the seat
back up into the lock position.
00:00:28.250 --> 00:00:28.920
You'll hear a click.
00:00:30.160 --> 00:00:31.300
And on some vehicles,
00:00:31.300 --> 00:00:34.870
you may see a red indicator on
the lever to let you know it's locked.
00:00:34.870 --> 00:00:36.584
Just give it a slight pull to make sure.
00:00:36.584 --> 00:00:40.486
Any questions?
00:00:40.486 --> 00:00:40.986
Go to www.FordOwner.com.
00:00:40.986 --> 00:00:50.942
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Rear Folding Seats with Side Release and Folding Head Restraints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nTO2w5-8rIA_seg1.mp4
question: How to unfold the rear seats in the car?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:03:05.580 --> 00:03:08.610
To do so, touch the Alert button here.
00:03:08.610 --> 00:03:10.760
Then the Enable Alerts button.
00:03:10.760 --> 00:03:14.970
To set an alert, anytime you hear a song
or artist you want to be notified of,
00:03:14.970 --> 00:03:19.210
touch the Alert button,
choose either the artist, song title, or
00:03:19.210 --> 00:03:20.989
both, to add them to your alert.
00:03:22.030 --> 00:03:24.710
You'll get a message letting
you know they've been saved.
00:03:24.710 --> 00:03:26.470
Now, anytime that song or
00:03:26.470 --> 00:03:30.210
artist is being played on any channel
you'll receive a message on your screen
00:03:30.210 --> 00:03:35.150
asking if you'd like to tune to that
channel, delete, or disable alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg10.mp4
question: When the alert button will be display?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:52.860 --> 00:01:54.050
When towing a trailer,
00:01:54.050 --> 00:01:58.308
pressing the Tow/Haul mode button located
at the end of the gear shift lever, here,
00:01:58.308 --> 00:02:03.220
activates the tow/haul feature which will
allow the adaptive cruise control system
00:02:03.220 --> 00:02:06.130
to automatically follow at
a slightly greater distance.
00:02:06.130 --> 00:02:09.120
This is handy since the extra
weight of a trailer requires more
00:02:09.120 --> 00:02:11.050
breaking distance if needed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg9.mp4
question: Where is the Tow/Haul mode button located in the car?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:00.295 --> 00:01:03.545
If you plan on towing a trailer or
boat for example, you'll need to
00:01:03.545 --> 00:01:08.390
activate the tow/haul feature by pressing
the button on the gear shift lever, here.
00:01:08.390 --> 00:01:11.540
The Tow Haul indicator will
illuminate in the instrument cluster,
00:01:11.540 --> 00:01:14.470
indicating that tow/haul
mode is now activated.
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:17.518
To deactivate,
simply press the button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg3.mp4
question: How do you activate or deactivate the tow/haul feature?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:00:44.181 --> 00:00:46.430
To adjust the gap setting,
press the up and
00:00:46.430 --> 00:00:49.590
down arrows on your steering
wheel control switch.
00:00:49.590 --> 00:00:52.240
Pressing it up decreases your
follow distance setting and
00:00:52.240 --> 00:00:54.330
allows your car to follow
at a closer distance.
00:00:55.530 --> 00:00:58.530
And pressing it down, increases
your follow distance setting, and
00:00:58.530 --> 00:01:01.460
expands the distance between you and
a car in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg4.mp4
question: How do you adjust the gap setting?

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:31.810 --> 00:00:36.120
When you come to a stop, the Brake Coach
screen appears in your display.
00:00:36.120 --> 00:00:38.830
And shows you your
braking efficiency score.
00:00:38.830 --> 00:00:41.820
You'll get higher percentages by
coming to gradual stops and
00:00:41.820 --> 00:00:46.220
100% means that you maximize
your braking efficiency.
00:00:46.230 --> 00:00:49.060
If at any time you want a quick
refresher on what this feature is,
00:00:49.076 --> 00:00:52.260
use the five way control on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:00:52.260 --> 00:00:56.420
Go to the Main Menu,
scroll to Information, Tutorial,
00:00:56.420 --> 00:00:59.320
then select Brake Coach and
a brief description will appear.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg3.mp4
question: What does the brake coach shows and signifies driver's efficiency?

video_name: Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck
video_trans:
00:00:29.830 --> 00:00:33.000
Before we start,
you'll need a tape measure, some tape, and
00:00:33.000 --> 00:00:34.550
a Phillips screwdriver.
00:00:34.550 --> 00:00:37.370
And you'll want to park about
25 feet from a garage door or
00:00:37.370 --> 00:00:39.580
a wall with your headlamps aimed at it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck_seg2.mp4
question: What tools do I need before we get started on the car?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:58.497 --> 00:01:01.470
Now, let's talk about Cross-Traffic alert.
00:01:01.470 --> 00:01:05.650
It warns you of moving cars coming from
either side when you're in reverse or
00:01:05.650 --> 00:01:09.550
backing up and gives you three warnings,
a light on the corresponding
00:01:09.550 --> 00:01:13.470
side view mirror, a chime, and
a message in your message center.
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:16.970
Extreme weather conditions
could block the sensors, but
00:01:16.970 --> 00:01:20.370
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:01:20.370 --> 00:01:23.234
And keep in mind,
as with the most radar, infrared, and
00:01:23.234 --> 00:01:27.246
ultrasonic-type sensing system,
there is the possibility of false alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg4.mp4
question: how many warnings does cross traffic alert give?

video_name: Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.947
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.947 --> 00:00:09.731
Your Mustang has a feature that allows you
to do a burn out to heat up your tires for
00:00:09.731 --> 00:00:12.040
an improved track experience.
00:00:12.040 --> 00:00:15.430
It's called Line Lock and
it's part of the Track Apps feature.
00:00:15.430 --> 00:00:19.830
When turned on, the front brakes are
locked so the rear wheels can spin freely.
00:00:19.830 --> 00:00:23.690
This is helpful when doing a burnout to
heat up the tires for better traction.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo_seg1.mp4

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:48.160 --> 00:00:49.250
Keep in mind,
00:00:49.250 --> 00:00:53.440
there are some factors that affect the
amount of energy being used while driving.
00:00:53.440 --> 00:00:57.330
For instance, mild or
aggressive acceleration or braking,
00:00:57.330 --> 00:01:01.905
your vehicle's speed, how much you use
accessories, such as climate control.
00:01:01.905 --> 00:01:06.232
The ambient temperature and other weather
conditions, as well as whether you're
00:01:06.232 --> 00:01:09.335
driving in the city or
on the highway, and the road grades.
00:01:09.335 --> 00:01:10.463
Any questions?

To set the cruising speed, use the cruise
control switch on your steering wheel.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:40.903
Press On, accelerate to your
desired speed and press Set.
00:00:40.903 --> 00:00:44.181
Then take your foot off the accelerator.

video_name: Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc
video_trans:
00:00:23.920 --> 00:00:28.690
If you have rain-sensing front wipers,
move the stalk up to the first position.
00:00:28.690 --> 00:00:32.790
You can change their speed or sensitivity
by turning the inner-ring up or down.
00:00:33.920 --> 00:00:35.900
If you don't have
the rain-sensing feature,
00:00:35.900 --> 00:00:38.860
the ring controls the delay between wipes.
00:00:38.860 --> 00:00:40.830
And if you just don't
want to use the feature,
00:00:40.830 --> 00:00:44.400
you can always choose between normal and
fast wipes.

For more convenience, you can also set
it up to send you automatic reminders to
00:01:46.261 --> 00:01:50.935
prompt you to run a report by pressing on,
and then choose whether you want to
00:01:50.935 --> 00:01:55.338
be reminded every 5,000,
7,500, or 10,000 miles.
00:01:55.338 --> 00:01:59.490
You can opt out at any time by
turning automatic reminders off.

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:00:32.110 --> 00:00:36.110
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.110 --> 00:00:39.960
For best results, it's recommended to use
a draw bar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:39.960 --> 00:00:44.600
drop to position your trailer level to
the ground. Then line up your vehicle and
00:00:44.600 --> 00:00:47.360
trailer by pulling forward, so
they're in line with one another.
00:00:48.500 --> 00:00:51.994
Second, from inside the vehicle
to begin programming,
00:00:51.994 --> 00:00:56.797
press the center of the Pro Trailer Backup
Assist button located to the right of
00:00:56.797 --> 00:00:58.569
the steering wheel, here.
00:00:58.569 --> 00:01:02.792
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:02.792 --> 00:01:06.612
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:06.612 --> 00:01:08.489
Press OK once finished.
00:01:08.489 --> 00:01:11.508
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:11.508 --> 00:01:16.095
Electric, which is the default or
surge type and press OK.
00:01:16.095 --> 00:01:18.751
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer.
00:01:18.751 --> 00:01:21.737
Low, which is the recommended setting for
most trailers,
00:01:21.737 --> 00:01:25.892
Medium or High if your trailer requires
more aggressive braking like if you have
00:01:25.892 --> 00:01:29.230
a larger, heavier trailer, for instance.
00:01:29.230 --> 00:01:33.586
And since Pro Trailer Backup Assist is not
currently compatible with fifth-wheel or
00:01:33.586 --> 00:01:37.592
gooseneck type trailers, conventional
will be the default trailer type.
00:01:37.592 --> 00:01:41.507
You'll get a message asking if you
want to add Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:01:41.507 --> 00:01:43.224
Select Yes to confirm.
00:01:43.224 --> 00:01:45.864
A prompt will direct you
to straighten the trailer,
00:01:45.864 --> 00:01:47.725
if necessary to continue the setup.
00:01:47.725 --> 00:01:51.208
You'll then get another message directing
you to put the vehicle in park and
00:01:51.208 --> 00:01:54.810
to place the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
target sticker on your trailer tongue.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg3.mp4
question: How do I set up a profile for my trailer?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:01:21.930 --> 00:01:26.230
Once plugged in and charging, the port
light will show the current charge status.
00:01:26.230 --> 00:01:30.020
When one bar is pulsing,
the charge is between 0 and 25%.
00:01:31.220 --> 00:01:34.017
One solid bar and
one pulsing bar is 25 to 50%.
00:01:34.017 --> 00:01:40.604
Two solids and one pulsing is 50 to 75%.
00:01:40.604 --> 00:01:44.169
Three solid and one pulsing is 75 to 100%.
00:01:45.300 --> 00:01:49.340
And when all four bars are solidly lit,
the charge is complete.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg5.mp4
question: What does it mean when one bar is pulsing?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:

If your vehicle includes the blind
spot information system BLIS,
00:01:57.020 --> 00:01:59.970
the system first prompts you to
set up your trailer BLIS feature.
00:02:00.980 --> 00:02:03.920
Next, a message appears in
the information display,
00:02:03.920 --> 00:02:06.570
asking if you want to
Add Trailer Reverse Guidance.
00:02:06.570 --> 00:02:07.350
Select Yes.
00:02:08.360 --> 00:02:12.620
A prompt will direct you to straighten the

00:02:12.620 --> 00:02:15.790
You'll then get another message directing
you to use the quick start guide
00:02:15.790 --> 00:02:16.359
to proceed.

menu on the touch screen.

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:01:10.090 --> 00:01:10.830
When braking or
00:01:10.830 --> 00:01:14.970
coasting, you'll see power flow back from
the drive train to charge the battery.
00:01:14.970 --> 00:01:17.890
This represents active
regenerative braking.
00:01:17.890 --> 00:01:21.030
When more power is needed,
the gasoline engine will turn on.
00:01:21.030 --> 00:01:24.650
For instance, when driving on a highway,
under heavy acceleration,
00:01:24.650 --> 00:01:28.670
driving in low gear, or
while the battery is in charge mode
00:01:28.670 --> 00:01:32.180
you'll see a gray power flow cap
when it's switched to hybrid power.
00:01:32.180 --> 00:01:37.063
The flow begins at the fuel tank, and goes
to the engine, and then to the wheels.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg4.mp4
question: what is active regenerative braking?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:26.290 --> 00:00:28.460
When a vehicle enters into
a lane to the right or
00:00:28.460 --> 00:00:33.215
left, BLIS warns you with a solid light
on the corresponding side view mirror.
00:00:33.215 --> 00:00:36.115
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:37.155 --> 00:00:39.805
Also, whenever you
activate your turn signal,
00:00:39.805 --> 00:00:42.995
if a vehicle is within the blind
spot zone, BLIS will give you
00:00:42.995 --> 00:00:46.465
a flashing light warning on
the corresponding side view mirror.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg3.mp4
question: What does Bliss do when there is a car in your blindspot?

video_trans:

And here's something interesting
you might want to know,
00:00:37.281 --> 00:00:40.524
thereâ€™s a zoom button in the upper
left corner of your LCD screen.
00:00:40.524 --> 00:00:43.076
Push it to get a closer look at
your hitch and how you're lined up.

Now I'll tell you about some of
the on-road features that can help make
00:00:58.505 --> 00:01:00.812
hauling a trailer a little more convenient.
00:01:00.812 --> 00:01:04.593
Available power scope mirrors will
integrated spotlights can extend
00:01:04.593 --> 00:01:08.052
out an additional three inches with
just the press of a button for
00:01:08.052 --> 00:01:09.286
a wider viewing area.

video_trans:
00:00:40.590 --> 00:00:43.575
Keep in mind, even though you
are manually changing gears,
00:00:43.575 --> 00:00:45.910
SelectShift will automatically
make some shifts for
00:00:45.910 --> 00:00:50.190
you, if your enter speed is to high,
or if your RPMs are too low.
00:00:50.190 --> 00:00:52.970
And once you've gone into Sport Mode,
00:00:52.970 --> 00:00:55.470
your car will stay there until
you shift back to Drive Mode.

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:00:10.810 --> 00:00:14.600
For starters, your vehicle has
a high-strength steel frame with enhanced
00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.454
stiffness and
durability to help control your trailer.
00:00:17.454 --> 00:00:20.870
It also has something called
the Smart Trailer Tow Connector.
00:00:20.870 --> 00:00:24.692
You can access it under the towing tab
in the eight-inch productivity screen.
00:00:24.692 --> 00:00:27.872
It provides you with trailer connection
status along with lighting and
00:00:27.872 --> 00:00:30.510
trailer battery alerts, and warnings.

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:01:02.740 --> 00:01:04.950
Every time that you turn your vehicle off,
and
00:01:04.950 --> 00:01:07.280
you've used plug in
energy during your trip,
00:01:07.280 --> 00:01:10.870
the Next Full Charge screen will appear on
the right side of your instrument cluster.
00:01:10.870 --> 00:01:15.470
It will show your estimated miles per
full charge, just like on the left side,
00:01:15.470 --> 00:01:19.880
plus additional information about how your
energy usage has impacted your estimate
00:01:19.880 --> 00:01:22.590
as compared to the rated
the electric range for your vehicle.

video_trans:
00:00:22.160 --> 00:00:26.190
Vehicles equipped with Sirius XM
come with a pre-activated six month
00:00:26.190 --> 00:00:31.020
all access trial subscription, which
includes Sirius XM radio for your vehicle,
00:00:31.020 --> 00:00:36.450
plus the ability to enjoy Sirius XM while
outside your Ford by streaming online and
00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:38.130
on the Sirius XM app.
00:00:38.130 --> 00:00:41.070
Keep in mind,
in order to stream Sirius XM,
00:00:41.070 --> 00:00:45.250
you'll need to set up your account
with a username and password online.

video_name: Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck
video_trans:
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:12.670
Great, now let's talk about what to do
if your lights do need to be adjusted.
00:01:12.670 --> 00:01:16.450
Or if you're going to be towing
something and need to move them.
00:01:16.450 --> 00:01:20.920
First, open your hood, do you see
the adjuster on your head lamps?
00:01:22.118 --> 00:01:26.320
With your screwdriver, twist each one
until your beams are at the right level.
00:01:26.320 --> 00:01:28.830
And remember to leave the marks
on your door or wall so
00:01:28.830 --> 00:01:31.700
that you can readjust the lights
back when you need to.
00:01:31.700 --> 00:01:32.670
Any questions?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:54.600 --> 00:00:56.900
Keep in mind stones, rocks, and
00:00:56.900 --> 00:01:01.420
dirt can create tiny pits on your
chrome bumper resulting in rust spots.
00:01:01.420 --> 00:01:05.320
If you notice rust spots appearing on your
bumper use a chrome polish to help remove
00:01:05.320 --> 00:01:09.710
the spots, maintain the luster, and
prevent the reoccurrence of new ones.

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:38.782 --> 00:02:43.168
Keep in mind, you can cancel adaptive cruise
control one set anytime by braking or
00:02:43.168 --> 00:02:46.965
pressing the cancel button on
the steering wheel, which will cancel
00:02:46.965 --> 00:02:51.489
the adaptive cruise control and allow you
to gain manual control of your vehicle.
00:02:51.489 --> 00:02:55.998
Pressing the resume button will return the
vehicle to the previously set speed and
00:02:55.998 --> 00:02:56.790
gap setting.
 
00:02:56.790 --> 00:02:57.996
Any questions?
00:02:57.996 --> 00:02:59.971
Go to Owner.Ford.com.

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.139 --> 00:00:04.420
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.420 --> 00:00:08.054
Programming your HomeLink system
is simple, let me show you how.
00:00:08.054 --> 00:00:10.470
First, turn on your car.
00:00:10.470 --> 00:00:13.491
Hold your old transmitter a couple of
inches away from the HomeLink button
00:00:13.491 --> 00:00:15.880
you want to control your garage door with.
00:00:15.880 --> 00:00:19.880
Now press and hold both the transmitter
button and the home link button
00:00:19.880 --> 00:00:24.560
until the indicator light changes from
a slow blink to a fast one, like this.
00:00:24.560 --> 00:00:27.520
Now, press and hold the button on your
HomeLink that you want to control
00:00:27.520 --> 00:00:30.950
your garage door for
five seconds and release it.
00:00:30.950 --> 00:00:35.120
Your garage door should, move but if it
doesn't, repeat the five second hold.
00:00:35.120 --> 00:00:39.230
If your indicator light is still on
your programming is complete and you can
00:00:39.230 --> 00:00:42.860
just press and release your HomeLink
button to activate your garage door.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g_seg1.mp4
question: What if the garage door does not move?

video_name: Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw
video_trans:
00:00:15.750 --> 00:00:19.831
To open all of your windows at once and
vent the moon roof if you have one,
00:00:19.831 --> 00:00:24.141
press and hold the unlock button on
your key fob for at least three seconds.
00:00:24.141 --> 00:00:27.449
If you want to stop them from opening,
just press the lock or
00:00:27.449 --> 00:00:28.738
unlock button again.
00:00:28.738 --> 00:00:30.999
[MUSIC]

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:01:52.902 --> 00:01:56.464
The stop and go feature comes in handy
while driving on the highway and
00:01:56.464 --> 00:01:57.947
heavy traffic conditions.
00:01:57.947 --> 00:02:00.656
If the vehicle ahead of
you comes to a stop your
00:02:00.656 --> 00:02:03.093
vehicle will also follow down to a stop.
00:02:03.093 --> 00:02:07.718
Once the lead vehicle begins moving within
a short period of about three seconds,
00:02:07.718 --> 00:02:10.346
your car will automatically
begin to follow.
00:02:10.346 --> 00:02:14.312
If it takes longer to move, you can press
the resume button on your steering wheel.
00:02:14.312 --> 00:02:18.866
Or tap the accelerator pedal to start
following the lead vehicle again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg8.mp4
question: What to do when the car is slow after the break?

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:44.190 --> 00:00:46.160
Now, let me show you how it works.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:50.420
The LATCH system consists of three
anchor points to secure your child seat.
00:00:50.420 --> 00:00:54.850
The two lower anchors in the seat bite,
where the back and the seat cushion meet.
00:00:54.850 --> 00:00:58.860
And the top tether anchor on the back
of or behind the vehicle seat, here.
00:01:00.520 --> 00:01:04.110
Attach the metal connectors on
the bottom of your child seat, remember,
00:01:04.110 --> 00:01:08.320
the ones that are either rigid or
on a strap, to the anchors,
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:11.350
which may be marked with
a child seat symbol, here.
00:01:11.350 --> 00:01:12.870
If your seat has straps,
00:01:12.870 --> 00:01:16.060
tighten them by pulling up until
the seat is secure and doesn't move.
00:01:16.060 --> 00:01:19.780
If your clips are on a rigid attachment,
push your seat back and
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:23.270
forth after you've attached it,
to make sure it doesn't move.
00:01:23.270 --> 00:01:27.190
Once you've installed your child seat with
the lower anchors of the latch system,
00:01:27.190 --> 00:01:31.910
attach the top tether strap under the head
rest, or over the top of the head
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:36.010
restraint, if it's not adjustable or
removable, and tighten the strap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA_seg4.mp4
question: The latch system consists of how many anchor points?

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:01:02.570 --> 00:01:05.090
You can change the sensitivity
of the warning system
00:01:05.090 --> 00:01:09.630
to one of three settings by using the
five-way control on your steering wheel.
00:01:09.630 --> 00:01:14.240
Scroll to Driver Assist,
Pre-Collision, Alert Sensitivity, and
00:01:14.240 --> 00:01:17.290
then select High, Normal or Low.
00:01:17.290 --> 00:01:21.350
A lower setting can send fewer warnings,
while a higher setting will give earlier,
00:01:21.350 --> 00:01:22.890
more frequent warnings.
00:01:22.890 --> 00:01:26.820
Keep in mind, for the system to
function properly, the radar sensor and
00:01:26.820 --> 00:01:29.130
camera must be clear of obstruction.
00:01:29.130 --> 00:01:33.660
If any obstruction is detected, a message
will appear in the information display.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg4.mp4
question: What happens if the cameras are obstructed?

video_trans:
00:01:35.470 --> 00:01:39.090
In addition, Off Road highlights
information on your power distribution and
00:01:39.090 --> 00:01:40.430
steering angle.
00:01:40.430 --> 00:01:44.960
and settings shows you driver selectable
features like Auto High Beam,
00:01:44.960 --> 00:01:47.839
with Cross Traffic Alert,
parking aids and more.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/8' Productivity Screen _ Ford How-To _ Ford-apfpV4zPyrc_seg7.mp4
question: What driving selectable feature can be selected on setting?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:03:07.000 --> 00:03:09.700
Now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the system's
00:03:09.700 --> 00:03:10.640
information display.
00:03:11.720 --> 00:03:15.190
To input the measurements you recorded
outside the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:15.190 --> 00:03:18.540
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:18.540 --> 00:03:21.130
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed.
00:03:21.130 --> 00:03:24.444
Like this,
then OK to confirm each measurement and
00:03:24.444 --> 00:03:26.769
to move on to the next measurement.
00:03:26.769 --> 00:03:28.618
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:03:28.618 --> 00:03:31.761
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:03:31.761 --> 00:03:35.591
If correct, select Confirm and hit OK.
00:03:35.591 --> 00:03:39.573
Once you've confirmed the measurements,
the system will automatically search for
00:03:39.573 --> 00:03:42.172
the sticker target and
highlight it with a red circle and
00:03:42.172 --> 00:03:44.391
the message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:03:44.391 --> 00:03:47.495
If it is, select yes to confirm.
00:03:47.495 --> 00:03:50.762
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know setup is complete and
00:03:50.762 --> 00:03:51.927
measurements are saved.
00:03:51.927 --> 00:03:54.753
If you don't see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:03:54.753 --> 00:03:57.201
Make sure the measurements are correct and
that the trailer and
00:03:57.201 --> 00:03:59.115
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:03:59.115 --> 00:04:03.779
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straightforward between 4 and 25 miles per
00:04:03.779 --> 00:04:07.844
hour as directed until you get a message
confirming calibration is complete.
00:04:07.844 --> 00:04:08.911
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg6.mp4
question: what do you select if you do not see the sticker circle?

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:00:17.482 --> 00:00:22.109
There are a few in vehicle technology
features that can aid you when hooking up,
00:00:22.109 --> 00:00:25.160
backing up, and
maneuvering an attached trailer.
00:00:25.160 --> 00:00:29.640
The available center high mounted stop
lamp camera offers an elevated perspective
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:34.000
and dynamic center guidelines to help line
up your vehicle with the fifth wheel or
00:00:34.000 --> 00:00:35.160
gooseneck trailer.
00:00:35.160 --> 00:00:40.120
There's also a 360 degree camera feature
that delivers multiple views from
00:00:40.120 --> 00:00:42.139
the top down and all four sides
00:00:42.140 --> 00:00:46.180
as well as  a customer placed trailer
camera kit option that can be mounted to
00:00:46.180 --> 00:00:47.540
the rear of your trailer,
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:51.100
that provides added driver convenience
when backing up a trailer.
00:00:51.120 --> 00:00:55.160
And they all can be viewed on
the center stack console display screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg2.mp4
question: What kind of views are available?

video_trans:

Keep in mind, to help remind you when
power is flowing through the switch,
00:01:22.610 --> 00:01:24.700
it will remain illuminated
to let you know it's on.
00:01:25.880 --> 00:01:26.658
Any questions?
00:01:26.658 --> 00:01:28.720
Go to Owner.Ford.com.

feature that automatically controls

00:00:53.870 --> 00:00:56.429

video_name: Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w
video_trans:
00:00:40.240 --> 00:00:43.325
Here are a few important things you
should know when using Auto Start-Stop.
00:00:44.590 --> 00:00:48.468
Your electric power assisted steering
is inactive when your engine is off.
00:00:48.468 --> 00:00:52.270
And Auto Start-Stop may not shut the
engine off if your battery is charging,
00:00:52.270 --> 00:00:56.770
the engine is still warming up, or if
you're using the heat or air conditioner.
00:00:56.770 --> 00:01:00.930
So, if you AC is on because it's warm
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:02.170 --> 00:01:03.260
One more thing.
00:01:03.260 --> 00:01:07.120
Your vehicle is equipped with a heavy duty
starter and battery to help compensate for
00:01:07.120 --> 00:01:08.930
the increased number of starts and stops.

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:45.300 --> 00:00:48.655
In order to convert the 40 amp
relays to key off battery use,
00:00:48.655 --> 00:00:50.565
there are a few steps you'll need to take.
00:00:50.565 --> 00:00:53.995
First, you'll need to locate
the relay box under the engine hood,
00:00:53.995 --> 00:00:56.015
next to the driver side fender, here.
00:00:57.115 --> 00:01:00.950
Then remove the relay cover by
pressing the tab and lifting it off.
00:01:00.950 --> 00:01:03.060
Next, locate the five amp fuse.
00:01:04.180 --> 00:01:07.900
You'll then need to pull it out,
slide the spacer over, and place it so
00:01:07.900 --> 00:01:12.740
the left prong is in the far left slot and
the right prong is in the middle slot.
00:01:12.740 --> 00:01:16.900
Replace the cover and your 40 amp circuits
are now set to run on battery power
00:01:16.900 --> 00:01:18.930
even with the key out of the truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg4.mp4
question: How do you convert the 40 amp relays to key off battery use?

video_trans:

then turns to a constant light,
00:00:46.486 --> 00:00:49.273
you're not done yet and
will have to take few extra steps.
00:00:49.273 --> 00:00:50.899

00:00:52.750 --> 00:00:55.032
You'll need to complete the next
few steps in 30 seconds, so
00:00:55.032 --> 00:00:57.542
you might want to have someone help
you if you think it would be easier.
00:00:57.542 --> 00:00:59.260
[MUSIC]
00:00:59.260 --> 00:01:03.500
First, press and hold the learn button
on your garage door opener motor, here.
00:01:04.900 --> 00:01:07.170
Next, get back in your car and press and
00:01:07.170 --> 00:01:11.360
hold the selected function button on your
HomeLink for two seconds then release it.
00:01:11.360 --> 00:01:14.500
Then press and hold it for
two seconds again and release it.

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:00:11.610 --> 00:00:14.840
First, you'll notice all the normal
climate features you would typically find
00:00:14.840 --> 00:00:16.150
on most cars.
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:20.250
A climate system power button, which turns
the climate control system off and on.
00:00:20.250 --> 00:00:24.370
A fan speed control or a circulating air
button that let's you switch between
00:00:24.370 --> 00:00:27.450
outside air and
air circulating within the car.
00:00:27.450 --> 00:00:30.395
A distribution control that lets you
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:30.395 --> 00:00:34.505
come through the dashboard vents,
the floor vents, the defrost
00:00:34.505 --> 00:00:39.085
vent at the base of the windshield,
or a combination of multiple vents.
00:00:39.085 --> 00:00:41.552
An air conditioning or AC, button.
00:00:41.552 --> 00:00:44.288
Max defrost and rear defrost buttons.
00:00:44.288 --> 00:00:45.850
And a max A/C button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs_seg2.mp4

video_name: Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA
video_trans:
00:00:11.960 --> 00:00:14.580
First, keep in mind that
convertible top fabric
00:00:14.580 --> 00:00:16.710
does not promote mildew growth itself.
00:00:16.710 --> 00:00:20.705
Mildew may develop on dirt or
other foreign substances if not removed.
00:00:20.705 --> 00:00:25.090
So keeping the fabric clean through
regular washings will enhance the life and
00:00:25.090 --> 00:00:26.696
beauty of the top material.
00:00:26.696 --> 00:00:29.595
When washing vehicles
with cloth top roofs.
00:00:29.595 --> 00:00:33.012
Start by vacuuming with a soft
bristle brush attachment and
00:00:33.012 --> 00:00:35.070
be sure to use a non detergent soap.
00:00:35.070 --> 00:00:40.925
Scrub gently in a circular pattern using
a terrycloth towel or soft bristle brush.
00:00:40.925 --> 00:00:44.030
More specifically horse hair or
soft nylon.
00:00:44.030 --> 00:00:45.950
Do not use stiff bristle brushes or
00:00:45.950 --> 00:00:49.420
any abrasive materials or
cleaners as they can damage the fabric.
00:00:50.840 --> 00:00:54.760
When finished, rinse thoroughly
removing all soap residues.
00:00:54.760 --> 00:00:59.040
Allow the top to air dry completely
before folding it otherwise, mold or
00:00:59.040 --> 00:01:02.340
mildew may develop and
discolor the cloth material.
00:01:02.340 --> 00:01:07.090
To clean away lint debris like cottonwood,
use a standard clothes lint roller or
00:01:07.090 --> 00:01:09.320
a vacuum attachment with
a soft bristle brush.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA_seg2.mp4
question: What is the first step in cleaning a cloth top?

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:01:37.610 --> 00:01:40.350
Your vehicle also has
something called side sensing.
00:01:40.350 --> 00:01:44.550
It's an enhancement to your forward and
reverse sensing systems that uses a chime
00:01:44.550 --> 00:01:48.420
and a visual diagram display on your
touchscreen with red, yellow, and green
00:01:48.420 --> 00:01:52.160
highlights to indicate where the closest
object to your vehicle is detected.
00:01:52.160 --> 00:01:54.880
Red indicates the closest,
and green the farthest away.
00:01:56.054 --> 00:01:57.543
Any questions?
00:01:57.543 --> 00:01:59.036
Go to FordOwner.com.

video_name: Trailer Sway Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-jBHFDhd7638
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.784
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.784 --> 00:00:08.220
Is there any way to keep
my trailer from swaying?
00:00:10.150 --> 00:00:12.310
>> Is there any way to reduce
the sway from my trailer?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:16.510
>> For those of you who like to tow,
Ford has something that can help reduce
00:00:16.510 --> 00:00:19.330
how much your trailer sways
while you are driving.
00:00:19.330 --> 00:00:20.180
Here's how it works.
00:00:20.180 --> 00:00:25.060
If your trailer starts to sway, you'll see
the stability control light flash, and
00:00:25.060 --> 00:00:29.150
a trailer sway reduce speed message
in your information display.
00:00:29.150 --> 00:00:32.380
The trailer sway controller feature
will begin to apply the brakes to
00:00:32.380 --> 00:00:36.210
individual wheels, and
reduce your engine power if needed.
00:00:36.210 --> 00:00:39.800
If this happens, it's likely that
your trailer is improperly loaded, or
00:00:39.800 --> 00:00:42.620
the speed of your vehicle and
trailer are too high.
00:00:42.620 --> 00:00:45.960
Slow down, pull your vehicle off the road,
and make sure that
00:00:45.960 --> 00:00:50.270
your trailer is connected correctly and
your load is distributed properly.
00:00:50.270 --> 00:00:53.250
Then drive at a slower speed than
you were before the sway occurred.
00:00:54.390 --> 00:00:56.300
And here's something
else you need to know.
00:00:56.300 --> 00:01:00.173
Trailer sway control will not affect how
your vehicle handles in normal driving
00:01:00.173 --> 00:01:02.725
conditions, or
when you're not towing a trailer.
00:01:02.725 --> 00:01:03.518
Any questions?
00:01:03.518 --> 00:01:04.904
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:04.904 --> 00:01:14.904
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Sway Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-jBHFDhd7638_seg1.mp4
question: how do you use trailer sway?

to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:11.180 --> 00:01:14.977

And remember, touching the switch at

00:01:18.983 --> 00:01:20.270
closing will stop it.

Any questions?

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.183 --> 00:00:07.223
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.223 --> 00:00:10.453
The second row seats in your
Transit Connect wagon can be folded up or
00:00:10.453 --> 00:00:12.770
even removed for extra cargo space.
00:00:12.770 --> 00:00:14.480
Let me show you how to do it.
00:00:14.480 --> 00:00:16.400
To fold the second row seats forward,
00:00:16.400 --> 00:00:18.450
first push down the head
restraints like this.
00:00:19.530 --> 00:00:23.830
Now, find the strap located on the side
of the seat back closest to the door,
00:00:23.830 --> 00:00:26.260
here, and
pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:27.670 --> 00:00:32.380
Next, find the longer strap located in the
center of the backside of the seat back.
00:00:32.380 --> 00:00:35.610
Pull up to unlock it,
then lift the entire seat up to tumble it.
00:00:36.980 --> 00:00:39.820
Now, secure the seat by
locating the prop rod
00:00:39.820 --> 00:00:42.470
directly below the seat inside the floor.
00:00:42.470 --> 00:00:45.530
Lift it out and snap it onto
the prop rod latch, like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg1.mp4
question: Where are the straps for folding the second row seats?

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.139 --> 00:00:04.420
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.420 --> 00:00:08.054
Programming your HomeLink system
is simple, let me show you how.
00:00:08.054 --> 00:00:10.470
First, turn on your car.
00:00:10.470 --> 00:00:13.491
Hold your old transmitter a couple of
inches away from the HomeLink button
00:00:13.491 --> 00:00:15.880
you want to control your garage door with.
00:00:15.880 --> 00:00:19.880
Now press and hold both the transmitter
button and the home link button
00:00:19.880 --> 00:00:24.560
until the indicator light changes from
a slow blink to a fast one, like this.
00:00:24.560 --> 00:00:27.520
Now, press and hold the button on your
HomeLink that you want to control
00:00:27.520 --> 00:00:30.950
your garage door for
five seconds and release it.
00:00:30.950 --> 00:00:35.120
Your garage door should, move but if it
doesn't, repeat the five second hold.
00:00:35.120 --> 00:00:39.230
If your indicator light is still on
your programming is complete and you can
00:00:39.230 --> 00:00:42.860
just press and release your HomeLink
button to activate your garage door.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g_seg1.mp4
question: How can you tell if your garage door is activated with your homelink system?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:17.518 --> 00:01:21.390
While in tow/haul mode, the truck
will react slower to driver input
00:01:21.390 --> 00:01:26.130
at higher speeds, which allow both truck
and trailer to follow your intended path,
00:01:26.130 --> 00:01:30.580
while also maintaining the ease of parking
and performing low speed maneuvers.
00:01:30.580 --> 00:01:34.490
When starting or turning off your vehicle,
you might hear a faint click sound,
00:01:34.490 --> 00:01:36.670
this is just part of
the system's initialization and
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.270
shutdown process,
don't worry, this is normal.

video_name: Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0
video_trans:
00:00:47.300 --> 00:00:51.375
Using the five way switch on your steering
wheel, from the settings menu, scroll to
00:00:51.375 --> 00:00:56.910
pre-collision, alert sensitivity, and
then select high, normal, or low.
00:00:56.910 --> 00:01:01.280
A lower setting will send fewer warnings,
while a higher setting with give earlier,
00:01:01.280 --> 00:01:02.250
more frequent warnings.

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:52.860 --> 00:01:54.050
When towing a trailer,
00:01:54.050 --> 00:01:58.308
pressing the Tow/Haul mode button located
at the end of the gear shift lever, here,
00:01:58.308 --> 00:02:03.220
activates the tow/haul feature which will
allow the adaptive cruise control system
00:02:03.220 --> 00:02:06.130
to automatically follow at
a slightly greater distance.
00:02:06.130 --> 00:02:09.120
This is handy since the extra
weight of a trailer requires more
00:02:09.120 --> 00:02:11.050
breaking distance if needed.

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:50.630 --> 00:01:53.520
Using the turn signal for
lane changes deactivates it.
00:01:53.520 --> 00:01:57.720
So it won't interfere in daily
driving with frequent turns and stops.
00:01:57.720 --> 00:02:01.630
Keep in mind, if you're driving and
don't have a firm grip on the wheel, or
00:02:01.630 --> 00:02:05.360
if you're on a straight part of the road
that doesn't require much steering input,
00:02:05.360 --> 00:02:09.290
the car may think you're not holding on,
and may alert you to do so.
00:02:09.290 --> 00:02:10.400
Any questions?

Keep in mind, the estimated range is
based on three impact categories.
00:01:36.530 --> 00:01:40.440
The first being driving style and
route, which is the energy used to
00:01:40.440 --> 00:01:45.160

00:01:45.160 --> 00:01:47.630
whether you're doing city or
highway driving.

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:01:02.570 --> 00:01:05.090
You can change the sensitivity
of the warning system
00:01:05.090 --> 00:01:09.630
to one of three settings by using the
five-way control on your steering wheel.
00:01:09.630 --> 00:01:14.240
Scroll to Driver Assist,
Pre-Collision, Alert Sensitivity, and
00:01:14.240 --> 00:01:17.290
then select High, Normal or Low.
00:01:17.290 --> 00:01:21.350
A lower setting can send fewer warnings,
while a higher setting will give earlier,
00:01:21.350 --> 00:01:22.890
more frequent warnings.
00:01:22.890 --> 00:01:26.820
Keep in mind, for the system to
function properly, the radar sensor and
00:01:26.820 --> 00:01:29.130
camera must be clear of obstruction.
00:01:29.130 --> 00:01:33.660
If any obstruction is detected, a message
will appear in the information display.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg4.mp4
question: What setting provides earlier, more frequent warnings?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:13.870 --> 00:00:17.290
To maintain the appearance of
the bright chrome exterior finishes,
00:00:17.290 --> 00:00:19.620
regular cleaning is highly recommended.
00:00:19.620 --> 00:00:24.440
To clean, use water and a mild liquid
automotive soap from an auto supply store.
00:00:24.440 --> 00:00:28.590
Or a 50/50 solution of water and
white vinegar also works well.
00:00:28.590 --> 00:00:33.411
And remove all excess water as hard water
spots can deposit iron which can lead
00:00:33.411 --> 00:00:34.013
to rust.
00:00:34.013 --> 00:00:35.947
To remove tar and bugs from the grill,
00:00:35.947 --> 00:00:39.720
it's recommended to use
an oil-based bug and tar remover.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.220
In extreme winter climates, be sure
to rinse away salt residue as soon as
00:00:43.220 --> 00:00:47.070
possible as salt contains chlorides
that can damage the surface finish.
00:00:48.570 --> 00:00:51.750
Avoid all cleaning products that
contain ammonia, bleach, and
00:00:51.750 --> 00:00:54.600
alcohol as they may
also damage the finish.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg2.mp4
question: What cleaning products to avoid?

video_name: Drive vs. Sport Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7I38idrdK2E
video_trans:
00:00:44.220 --> 00:00:46.456
Okay, now let's talk about SelectShift.
00:00:46.456 --> 00:00:47.911
[MUSIC]
00:00:47.911 --> 00:00:52.109
To use it,
move your gear shift to the S position.
00:00:52.109 --> 00:00:55.615
And press the plus-minus buttons on
the the side of the gear shift to
00:00:55.615 --> 00:00:56.425
select gears.
00:00:56.425 --> 00:01:00.255
Press plus to upshift and
minus to downshift.
00:01:00.255 --> 00:01:03.488
Keep in mind your engine will rev
at various speeds depending on
00:01:03.488 --> 00:01:05.080
what gear you've shifted to.
00:01:05.080 --> 00:01:07.638
If your engine RPM is too high or too low,
00:01:07.638 --> 00:01:11.408
your vehicle will automatically
make some shifts for you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Drive vs. Sport Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7I38idrdK2E_seg3.mp4
question: Where is the driving status feature button located on the gear shift?

For more convenience,
a memory-fold seatback features allows for
00:00:49.860 --> 00:00:53.390

00:00:53.390 --> 00:00:56.090
Just lift the lever located in

00:00:56.090 --> 00:00:58.190

video_name: Easy Fuel Capless Fuel Filler _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Eh3snbTNR1k
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.456
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.456 --> 00:00:07.616
Your vehicle has a capless fuel filler
that saves time at the pump and
00:00:07.616 --> 00:00:09.680
keeps your hands cleaner.
00:00:09.680 --> 00:00:13.010
There's no cap to twist off and
it's simple to use.
00:00:13.010 --> 00:00:16.510
Just open your fuel door by either
putting a finger under the exposed tab
00:00:16.510 --> 00:00:17.530
on the door.
00:00:17.530 --> 00:00:19.800
Or by pushing it in a bit
until it releases and
00:00:19.800 --> 00:00:21.470
you can open it the rest of the way.
00:00:21.470 --> 00:00:25.440
Insert the nozzle all the way,
making sure it goes through both flaps.
00:00:25.440 --> 00:00:29.290
Fill up, then wait five seconds
before removing the nozzle and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:30.780
close the fuel door.
00:00:30.780 --> 00:00:32.840
If you're using a portable fuel container,
00:00:32.840 --> 00:00:36.160
you'll need to use the easy fuel funnel
provided with your vehicle to avoid
00:00:36.160 --> 00:00:38.470
damaging the seals on
the spring loaded flaps.
00:00:39.540 --> 00:00:43.720
And one more thing, to help protect
against fuel theft, splashing, or
00:00:43.720 --> 00:00:47.770
water getting in the tank, the capless
fuel filler is tamper resistant.
00:00:47.770 --> 00:00:51.440
And the self closing, spring loaded flaps
help keep fuel from sloshing out and
00:00:51.440 --> 00:00:54.550
water from leaking in when it rains or
when you wash your vehicle.
00:00:54.550 --> 00:00:55.650
Any questions?
00:00:55.650 --> 00:00:56.919
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:56.919 --> 00:01:06.919
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Easy Fuel Capless Fuel Filler _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Eh3snbTNR1k_seg1.mp4
question: Does the capless fuel filler provide tamper resistance?

00:02:00.990 --> 00:02:05.218

rear-ward to the back of the trailer.

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:01:55.850 --> 00:01:59.360
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:01:59.360 --> 00:02:03.473
The sticker acts as a target with
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist feature and
00:02:03.473 --> 00:02:07.537
rear-view camera used to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:07.537 --> 00:02:09.147
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:09.147 --> 00:02:11.419
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:11.419 --> 00:02:15.521
You want to place the sticker within 7 to
22 inches from the center of the trailer
00:02:15.521 --> 00:02:16.198
hitch ball.
00:02:16.198 --> 00:02:19.879
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal service that
00:02:19.879 --> 00:02:21.681
is visible by the rear-view camera.
00:02:21.681 --> 00:02:24.369
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:24.369 --> 00:02:28.192
One the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:28.192 --> 00:02:29.841
record several measurements.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg4.mp4
question: What do I do after I place the tracker sticker for the trailer guidance system?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:02:29.841 --> 00:02:34.098
First, measure the horizontal distance
from the license plate to the center of
00:02:34.098 --> 00:02:35.889
the hitch ball and write it down.
00:02:35.889 --> 00:02:40.242
Next, measure the horizontal distance from
the center of the hitch ball to the center
00:02:40.242 --> 00:02:41.148
of the sticker and
00:02:41.148 --> 00:02:44.731
the distance from the rear-view
camera to the center of the sticker.
00:02:44.731 --> 00:02:49.037
Keep in mind, the location is not
dependent on a straight or A frame type,
00:02:49.037 --> 00:02:53.211
but based on where a surface is
available that meets the requirements.
00:02:53.211 --> 00:02:57.236
And finally, the horizontal distance from
the tailgate to the center of the trailer
00:02:57.236 --> 00:02:59.000
axle if it's a single axle trailer.
00:03:00.080 --> 00:03:01.280
If the trailer has two or
00:03:01.280 --> 00:03:05.000
more axles, measure to the center
point between both axles, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg5.mp4
question: Where is the distance measured for the rear view camera?

video_name: Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.947
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.947 --> 00:00:09.731
Your Mustang has a feature that allows you
to do a burn out to heat up your tires for
00:00:09.731 --> 00:00:12.040
an improved track experience.
00:00:12.040 --> 00:00:15.430
It's called Line Lock and
it's part of the Track Apps feature.
00:00:15.430 --> 00:00:19.830
When turned on, the front brakes are
locked so the rear wheels can spin freely.
00:00:19.830 --> 00:00:23.690
This is helpful when doing a burnout to
heat up the tires for better traction.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo_seg1.mp4
question: What set of wheels locks to allow you to heat up your tires in order to gain more traction?

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:00:13.370 --> 00:00:15.540
Once you've input
the correct measurements and
00:00:15.540 --> 00:00:18.270
placed the sticker as explained
in the how to set up video.
00:00:19.570 --> 00:00:21.130
When you shift into reverse,
00:00:21.130 --> 00:00:25.170
press the Camera button to expand
the menu options on the display screen.
00:00:25.170 --> 00:00:28.420
Then press the Trailer icon and
select the trailer you want.
00:00:28.420 --> 00:00:34.030
You will then see the camera view on
the side where your trailer is moving,
00:00:34.030 --> 00:00:36.300
or both sides when the trailer
is directly behind you.
00:00:37.360 --> 00:00:41.960
Auto mode, which is the default mode,
changes views with the trailer direction.

question: What icon is pressed on the menu options to select the trailer you want?

video_name: 60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.348 --> 00:00:05.553
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.553 --> 00:00:07.440
Can these seat backs be folded down?
00:00:09.560 --> 00:00:11.150
>> Can I fold down just one side?
00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:15.320
>> Did you know that you
can fold down one or
00:00:15.320 --> 00:00:17.780
both of the rear seat
backs in your vehicle?
00:00:17.780 --> 00:00:21.680
And that's helpful when carrying
longer items like skis or golf bags.
00:00:21.680 --> 00:00:23.740
Here's how to do it.
00:00:23.740 --> 00:00:27.110
Find the release on top of the seat
back you want to fold down.
00:00:27.110 --> 00:00:31.715
Then, just push or pull up to release
the seat back and fold it down.
00:00:31.715 --> 00:00:35.235
Do the same thing on the other side
if you want to fold them both down.
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:38.175
You'll get a full pass through
from the trunk that way.
00:00:38.175 --> 00:00:42.601
And for your convenience, the 2013 Fusion
Hybrid battery has been moved to the floor
00:00:42.601 --> 00:00:45.349
of the trunk, so
it won't block the pass through.
00:00:45.349 --> 00:00:47.900
And there's a clip that holds
your safety belts in place, so
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.305
they won't get caught behind
when folding your seat back.
00:00:51.305 --> 00:00:52.395
Any questions?
00:00:52.395 --> 00:00:53.862
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:53.862 --> 00:00:54.529
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4_seg1.mp4
question: Can I fold one rear seat down?

video_trans:
00:00:41.850 --> 00:00:43.340
To fold the third row seats,
00:00:43.340 --> 00:00:47.460
find the strap on the seat cushion
located in the seat-bite, here.
00:00:47.460 --> 00:00:50.298
Pull it and flip the cushions so
that the seat bottom is face down.
00:00:51.500 --> 00:00:54.090
Next, locate the red
strap in the seat back.
00:00:54.090 --> 00:00:57.641
It looks like it's tucked into a small
pocket in the lower corner of the seat
00:00:57.641 --> 00:00:58.220
back.
00:00:58.220 --> 00:01:00.980
Pull it, and fold the seat back down.

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:00:53.710 --> 00:00:56.530
When ECO Cruise is on but
not active, the ECO and
00:00:56.530 --> 00:00:59.880
car icon in your information
display will be gray.
00:00:59.880 --> 00:01:03.720
Once active both ECO and
the car icon will turn green.
00:01:03.720 --> 00:01:06.140
Now just accelerate to the speed you want.
00:01:06.140 --> 00:01:09.450
Then press the set button on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:01:09.450 --> 00:01:12.770
Your vehicle will keep a constant
speed until you brake.
00:01:12.770 --> 00:01:17.190
Keep in mind, if you do brake but
then want to resume your set speed again,
00:01:17.190 --> 00:01:20.490
you can press the resume button on
the left side of your steering wheel.

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.947
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.947 --> 00:00:09.731
Your Mustang has a feature that allows you
to do a burn out to heat up your tires for
00:00:09.731 --> 00:00:12.040
an improved track experience.
00:00:12.040 --> 00:00:15.430
It's called Line Lock and
it's part of the Track Apps feature.
00:00:15.430 --> 00:00:19.830
When turned on, the front brakes are
locked so the rear wheels can spin freely.
00:00:19.830 --> 00:00:23.690

question: How does the lock line feature work?

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:00:22.760 --> 00:00:25.970
Summer tires are ideal for
performance vehicles and
00:00:25.970 --> 00:00:29.366
do not have the same traction
characteristics of all-season tires.
00:00:29.366 --> 00:00:32.902
As they are designed for
superior traction, cornering, and
00:00:32.902 --> 00:00:37.010
braking performance for
both wet and dry road conditions.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:41.240
This is attributed to specialized tread
patterns, like less grooving, to provide
00:00:41.240 --> 00:00:46.159
more tire contact with the road, shallower
tread depth, and softer rubber compounds.
00:00:47.330 --> 00:00:51.550
Keep in mind, since summer tires
are composed of softer materials,
00:00:51.550 --> 00:00:53.360
they tend to lose flexibility.
00:00:53.360 --> 00:00:55.766
and are less suitable in colder temps and
00:00:55.766 --> 00:00:58.755
generally wear faster
than an all-season tire.
00:00:58.755 --> 00:01:02.646
And unlike all-season tires,
summer tires do not have a mud and
00:01:02.646 --> 00:01:05.601
snow traction rating and
are not recommended for
00:01:05.601 --> 00:01:09.870
cold weather below 45 degrees or
snowy and icy driving conditions.
00:01:11.220 --> 00:01:12.540
As a matter of fact,
00:01:12.540 --> 00:01:17.230
driving on summer tires in below
freezing conditions can damage them.
00:01:17.230 --> 00:01:21.590
If you must drive in these conditions,
Ford recommends using all-season or
00:01:21.590 --> 00:01:23.240
winter snow tires.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg2.mp4
question: what are the benefits of summer tires?

video_trans:

00:00:05.364 --> 00:00:09.020
Did you know that you can fold

00:00:09.020 --> 00:00:10.590
Here's how to do it.
00:00:10.590 --> 00:00:13.670
First, fold the outside
head restraints down and
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:16.160
lower the center head restraint like this.
00:00:16.160 --> 00:00:20.830
Next, find the lever located on
the side of the seat base, here, and
00:00:20.830 --> 00:00:22.920
pull the level up to
fold the seat back down.
00:00:24.180 --> 00:00:28.250
To unfold your seats, just pull the seat
back up into the lock position.
00:00:28.250 --> 00:00:28.920
You'll hear a click.
00:00:30.160 --> 00:00:31.300
And on some vehicles,
00:00:31.300 --> 00:00:34.870
you may see a red indicator on
the lever to let you know it's locked.
00:00:34.870 --> 00:00:36.584
Just give it a slight pull to make sure.
00:00:36.584 --> 00:00:40.486
Any questions?
00:00:40.486 --> 00:00:40.986
Go to www.FordOwner.com.
00:00:40.986 --> 00:00:50.942
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Rear Folding Seats with Side Release and Folding Head Restraints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nTO2w5-8rIA_seg1.mp4
question: how many steps are there to fold the back seat?

00:01:12.784 --> 00:01:16.110

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:52.860 --> 00:01:54.050
When towing a trailer,
00:01:54.050 --> 00:01:58.308
pressing the Tow/Haul mode button located
at the end of the gear shift lever, here,
00:01:58.308 --> 00:02:03.220
activates the tow/haul feature which will
allow the adaptive cruise control system
00:02:03.220 --> 00:02:06.130
to automatically follow at
a slightly greater distance.
00:02:06.130 --> 00:02:09.120
This is handy since the extra
weight of a trailer requires more
00:02:09.120 --> 00:02:11.050
breaking distance if needed.
