video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:00:18.830 --> 00:00:19.730
To access it,
00:00:19.730 --> 00:00:24.040
from the home screen touch Apps on your
SYNC 3 touch screen, then Power Flow.
00:00:25.080 --> 00:00:26.710
The power flow screen will appear and
00:00:26.710 --> 00:00:29.240
you'll see your vehicles
current operating status.
00:00:29.240 --> 00:00:36.020
Either idle, hybrid drive, electric
drive or charging high voltage battery.
00:00:36.020 --> 00:00:38.620
Now depending on which status
you're currently running in
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:41.320
such as electric drive mode
when the engine is off
00:00:41.320 --> 00:00:45.730
you'll see a blue power flow path
indicating which components are in use.
00:00:45.730 --> 00:00:49.360
In this case power from the battery
is being used for accessories like
00:00:49.360 --> 00:00:54.060
the climate control, high voltage electric
heater or air conditioning compressor and
00:00:54.060 --> 00:00:58.500
other low voltage accessories such
as the radio, fans or heated seats.
00:00:58.500 --> 00:01:01.090
You'll also notice power
flowing to the electric motor
00:01:01.090 --> 00:01:02.720
which is driving the wheels.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg2.mp4

video_name: Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc
video_trans:
00:01:06.820 --> 00:01:08.680
If you have the available power seats,
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.510
using the switch located on the side of
the seat you can move the seats forward or
00:01:12.510 --> 00:01:15.320
backward by sliding it forward or
backward.
00:01:15.330 --> 00:01:18.970
To raise the seat bottom,
move the switch up or down.
00:01:20.160 --> 00:01:24.050
And to tilt, just lift the front of
the switch to tilt backward and
00:01:24.050 --> 00:01:25.500
press down to tilt forward.
00:01:25.500 --> 00:01:29.406
To set the firmest of the lumbar
support using the lumbar button,
00:01:29.406 --> 00:01:35.654
here, press the front of it to increase
the firmness and the back to decrease it.
00:01:35.654 --> 00:01:36.635
Any questions?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:59.300 --> 00:01:02.040
To set the blind spot
detection on a trailer,
00:01:02.040 --> 00:01:06.000
use the five way switch on your steering
wheel and select type of trailer.
00:01:06.000 --> 00:01:09.920
Keep in mind, BLIS only supports
conventional-type trailers.
00:01:09.920 --> 00:01:12.764
Other types selected with
automatically turn off the BLIS and
00:01:12.764 --> 00:01:14.700
cross-traffic alert feature.
00:01:14.700 --> 00:01:17.980
Next, you'll be asked if you want
to set up BLIS with a trailer.
00:01:17.980 --> 00:01:20.010
If no, BLIS turns off.
00:01:20.010 --> 00:01:24.960
If yes, you'll be asked if the trailer is
less than nine feet wide and 33 feet long.
00:01:24.960 --> 00:01:26.720
Now, enter length of trailer,
00:01:26.720 --> 00:01:29.890
which is the length of the hitch
bulb to the end of the trailer.
00:01:29.890 --> 00:01:34.230
You do so by toggling up or down,
using the menu buttons to increase or
00:01:34.230 --> 00:01:36.560
decrease the measurement by three feet.
00:01:36.560 --> 00:01:38.790
You'll need to select
the length that is equal to or
00:01:38.790 --> 00:01:43.070
greater than three feet of the actual
trailer to allow for full coverage.
00:01:43.070 --> 00:01:49.240
For example, if the actual measured length
is 25 feet, input the length to 27 feet.
00:01:49.240 --> 00:01:52.290
Once the length has been entered,
the setup is saved.
00:01:52.290 --> 00:01:54.570
If the trailer has been connected but
no information for
00:01:54.570 --> 00:01:58.890
that trailer has been entered, the system
will ask for trailer information.
00:01:58.890 --> 00:02:03.250
If no trailer information is entered, BLIS
and cross-traffic alert will be disabled.
00:02:04.320 --> 00:02:07.620
It's important to remember that if you
select a trailer in the display screen
00:02:07.620 --> 00:02:11.790
prior to connecting the trailer, the
system will load that configuration, and
00:02:11.790 --> 00:02:14.560
you'll get a message in the instrument
cluster when the trailer is connected.
00:02:16.000 --> 00:02:19.592
Correct trailer information must be
stored under towing information for
00:02:19.592 --> 00:02:22.695
BLIS with trailer blind spot
coverage to be active while towing.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg5.mp4
question: Does BLIS provide instructions, information, and steps on how to prepare to tow a trailer?

video_name: 180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc
video_trans:
00:00:28.040 --> 00:00:32.560
While you're in park, neutral, or drive,
press the camera button above the CD slot
00:00:32.560 --> 00:00:35.920
once to see either a front, normal view,
which gives you an image of
00:00:35.920 --> 00:00:39.620
what's directly in front of you,
or again, for a front split-view,
00:00:39.620 --> 00:00:42.720
which gives you a 180 degree extended
view of what's in front of you.
00:00:43.750 --> 00:00:46.900
That can be helpful, as it gives you added
visibility when you're pulling out of
00:00:46.900 --> 00:00:50.450
a driveway, street, parking spot,
or while maneuvering.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc_seg3.mp4

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:02:29.841 --> 00:02:34.098
First, measure the horizontal distance
from the license plate to the center of
00:02:34.098 --> 00:02:35.889
the hitch ball and write it down.
00:02:35.889 --> 00:02:40.242
Next, measure the horizontal distance from
the center of the hitch ball to the center
00:02:40.242 --> 00:02:41.148
of the sticker and
00:02:41.148 --> 00:02:44.731
the distance from the rear-view
camera to the center of the sticker.
00:02:44.731 --> 00:02:49.037
Keep in mind, the location is not
dependent on a straight or A frame type,
00:02:49.037 --> 00:02:53.211
but based on where a surface is
available that meets the requirements.
00:02:53.211 --> 00:02:57.236
And finally, the horizontal distance from
the tailgate to the center of the trailer
00:02:57.236 --> 00:02:59.000
axle if it's a single axle trailer.
00:03:00.080 --> 00:03:01.280
If the trailer has two or
00:03:01.280 --> 00:03:05.000
more axles, measure to the center
point between both axles, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg5.mp4
question: what are you supposed to write down?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:13.850 --> 00:01:18.030
You can adjust your follow distance using
the gap control on your steering wheel.
00:01:18.030 --> 00:01:20.950
Pressing it up decreases your
follow distance setting and
00:01:20.950 --> 00:01:23.910
allows your car to follow
at a closer distance.
00:01:23.910 --> 00:01:26.589
And pressing it down increases
your follow distance and
00:01:26.589 --> 00:01:30.320
expands the distance between you and
a car in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg6.mp4
question: How can we adjust the distance of the car we are behind of  a car?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:02:18.170 --> 00:02:21.850
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:02:21.850 --> 00:02:25.340
The sticker acts as a target that
the trailer reverse guidance feature and
00:02:25.340 --> 00:02:28.480
rear view camera use to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:29.640 --> 00:02:31.250
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:31.250 --> 00:02:33.830
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:33.830 --> 00:02:36.790
You'll want to place the sticker
within 7 to 22 inches from
00:02:36.790 --> 00:02:38.890
the center of the trailer hitch ball.
00:02:38.890 --> 00:02:42.696
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal surface, so
00:02:42.696 --> 00:02:46.573
the entire sticker is in the acceptable
zone invisible by the rearview camera.
00:02:46.573 --> 00:02:48.293
[MUSIC]
00:02:48.293 --> 00:02:50.430
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:50.430 --> 00:02:54.020
Once the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:54.020 --> 00:02:56.020
record several measurements.
00:02:56.020 --> 00:02:59.880
First, measure the horizontal distance
from the license plate to the center of
00:02:59.880 --> 00:03:01.720
the hitch ball, and write it down.
00:03:01.720 --> 00:03:06.130
Next, measure the horizontal distance
from the center of the hitch ball to
00:03:06.130 --> 00:03:07.746
the center of the sticker.
00:03:07.746 --> 00:03:11.870
And the distance from the rear view
camera to the center of the sticker.
00:03:11.870 --> 00:03:15.218
Keep in mind, the location is
not dependent on a straight or
00:03:15.218 --> 00:03:20.780
a frame type, but based on where a surface
is available that meets the requirements.
00:03:20.780 --> 00:03:24.740
And finally, the horizontal distance from
the tailgate to the center of the trailer
00:03:24.740 --> 00:03:26.645
axle if it's a single axle trailer.
00:03:28.335 --> 00:03:30.685
If the trailer has two or more axles,
00:03:30.685 --> 00:03:34.680
measure to the center point
between both axles, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg4.mp4
question: what are the distance to be measured?

video_name: Reverse Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Y33ztmJemJ0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.216
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.216 --> 00:00:06.520
Did you know that your vehicle can
sense when something is behind you?
00:00:06.520 --> 00:00:10.020
It can, thanks to an available
reverse sensing system.
00:00:10.020 --> 00:00:11.940
Let me show you how it works.
00:00:11.940 --> 00:00:16.397
If your vehicle is in reverse, like when
you're backing out of or into a parking
00:00:16.397 --> 00:00:20.454
spot or garage, the reverse sensing
uses sensors on the rear bumpers and
00:00:20.454 --> 00:00:23.804
a warning sound to let you know
if something's behind you.
00:00:23.804 --> 00:00:27.069
If you have both forward and
reverse sensing, sensors on the front and
00:00:27.069 --> 00:00:30.450
back of your vehicle will detect
objects when you're in reverse.
00:00:30.450 --> 00:00:33.392
This is really helpful when you're
parallel parking since your front bumper
00:00:33.392 --> 00:00:34.669
swings when you're backing up.
00:00:34.669 --> 00:00:36.614
[MUSIC]
00:00:36.614 --> 00:00:41.960
And one more thing, the sensors have to be
clear of snow, ice, or mud to work right.
00:00:41.960 --> 00:00:46.220
So make sure to check them periodically
and be aware that outside conditions or
00:00:46.220 --> 00:00:48.690
noises may also trigger the system.
00:00:48.690 --> 00:00:49.800
Any questions?
00:00:49.800 --> 00:00:51.377
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:51.377 --> 00:01:01.377
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Y33ztmJemJ0_seg1.mp4
question: how does the vehicle sense when something is behind you?

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:00:39.684 --> 00:00:43.216
The jack handle and lug wrench are located
in a storage compartment in the side of
00:00:43.216 --> 00:00:46.160
the passenger seat base, by the step well.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:49.460
Just put your fingers under
the two slots and pull it open.
00:00:49.460 --> 00:00:52.100
The six-piece jack handle
is inside a pouch,
00:00:52.100 --> 00:00:54.360
simply unsnap the three
straps to remove it.
00:00:55.560 --> 00:00:59.872
Now assemble the jack handle by inserting
the male end with the locking button into
00:00:59.872 --> 00:01:03.017
the tube, making sure it lines up and
snaps into position.
00:01:03.017 --> 00:01:05.545
Do the same with the remaining pieces.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg3.mp4
question: Where in the vehicle are the jack handle and lug wrench located?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:00:52.590 --> 00:00:55.110
To use it, first press the Auto button.
00:00:55.110 --> 00:00:58.435
Then select the temperature you want
by simply turning the temperature
00:00:58.435 --> 00:00:59.320
control knob.
00:00:59.320 --> 00:01:02.250
You'll see your chosen temperature
displayed in the upper left corner
00:01:02.250 --> 00:01:02.760
of the screen.
00:01:03.770 --> 00:01:07.510
Now, each time you turn on your vehicle
with your climate control on, or
00:01:07.510 --> 00:01:09.320
turn on the A/C control,
00:01:09.320 --> 00:01:13.020
the system will automatically adjust
to reach your set temperature.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg4.mp4
question: When does the system automatically adjust to reach the set temperature?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:01:31.820 --> 00:01:34.530
And here are some important
facts you should know.
00:01:34.530 --> 00:01:39.180
On certain vehicles, the system only
allows up to two remote starts an hour or
00:01:39.180 --> 00:01:41.020
between manual starts.
00:01:41.020 --> 00:01:43.730
On others, you can only run your car for
00:01:43.730 --> 00:01:48.030
35 minutes with remote start before
you need to manually start it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg6.mp4
question: What are the limitations of remote start?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:02:29.841 --> 00:02:34.098
First, measure the horizontal distance
from the license plate to the center of
00:02:34.098 --> 00:02:35.889
the hitch ball and write it down.
00:02:35.889 --> 00:02:40.242
Next, measure the horizontal distance from
the center of the hitch ball to the center
00:02:40.242 --> 00:02:41.148
of the sticker and
00:02:41.148 --> 00:02:44.731
the distance from the rear-view
camera to the center of the sticker.
00:02:44.731 --> 00:02:49.037
Keep in mind, the location is not
dependent on a straight or A frame type,
00:02:49.037 --> 00:02:53.211
but based on where a surface is
available that meets the requirements.
00:02:53.211 --> 00:02:57.236
And finally, the horizontal distance from
the tailgate to the center of the trailer
00:02:57.236 --> 00:02:59.000
axle if it's a single axle trailer.
00:03:00.080 --> 00:03:01.280
If the trailer has two or
00:03:01.280 --> 00:03:05.000
more axles, measure to the center
point between both axles, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg5.mp4
question: What do you measure first?

video_trans:
00:00:54.680 --> 00:00:57.700
The green area of the gauge
represents miles per charge
00:00:57.700 --> 00:01:00.590
that is greater than the rated value for
your vehicle.
00:01:00.590 --> 00:01:01.640
Still with me?
00:01:01.640 --> 00:01:02.740
Great.

question: What does the green area of the guage represent?

00:01:26.620 --> 00:01:30.730

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:17.518 --> 00:01:21.390
While in tow/haul mode, the truck
will react slower to driver input
00:01:21.390 --> 00:01:26.130
at higher speeds, which allow both truck
and trailer to follow your intended path,
00:01:26.130 --> 00:01:30.580
while also maintaining the ease of parking
and performing low speed maneuvers.
00:01:30.580 --> 00:01:34.490
When starting or turning off your vehicle,
you might hear a faint click sound,
00:01:34.490 --> 00:01:36.670
this is just part of
the system's initialization and
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.270
shutdown process,
don't worry, this is normal.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg4.mp4
question: Should I be hearing a click sound when I turn on car on or off?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:

center or the productivity screen
00:00:14.130 --> 00:00:17.920

between the tachometer and speedometer.
00:00:19.030 --> 00:00:21.720

can get to display mode, which shows
00:00:26.190 --> 00:00:29.940
you your distance to empty, transmission
temperature, tire pressure for
00:00:29.940 --> 00:00:34.570
each wheel, engine information,
MyKey status and a digital speedometer.

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:44.190 --> 00:00:46.160
Now, let me show you how it works.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:50.420
The LATCH system consists of three
anchor points to secure your child seat.
00:00:50.420 --> 00:00:54.850
The two lower anchors in the seat bite,
where the back and the seat cushion meet.
00:00:54.850 --> 00:00:58.860
And the top tether anchor on the back
of or behind the vehicle seat, here.
00:01:00.520 --> 00:01:04.110
Attach the metal connectors on
the bottom of your child seat, remember,
00:01:04.110 --> 00:01:08.320
the ones that are either rigid or
on a strap, to the anchors,
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:11.350
which may be marked with
a child seat symbol, here.
00:01:11.350 --> 00:01:12.870
If your seat has straps,
00:01:12.870 --> 00:01:16.060
tighten them by pulling up until
the seat is secure and doesn't move.
00:01:16.060 --> 00:01:19.780
If your clips are on a rigid attachment,
push your seat back and
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:23.270
forth after you've attached it,
to make sure it doesn't move.
00:01:23.270 --> 00:01:27.190
Once you've installed your child seat with
the lower anchors of the latch system,
00:01:27.190 --> 00:01:31.910
attach the top tether strap under the head
rest, or over the top of the head
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:36.010
restraint, if it's not adjustable or
removable, and tighten the strap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA_seg4.mp4
question: When should I attach the top tether strap?

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:01:34.500 --> 00:01:38.570
Trailer sway control works in conjunction
with the roll stability control system
00:01:38.570 --> 00:01:42.170
to determine if your trailer is swaying
and gradually applies your brakes.
00:01:42.170 --> 00:01:44.110
And if necessary,
reduces your engine power.
00:01:45.260 --> 00:01:47.780
Trailer tow mirrors are also
available to help improve
00:01:47.780 --> 00:01:49.850
rear visibility when
towing large trailers.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg8.mp4
question: what is trailer sway control?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:00:44.181 --> 00:00:46.430
To adjust the gap setting,
press the up and
00:00:46.430 --> 00:00:49.590
down arrows on your steering
wheel control switch.
00:00:49.590 --> 00:00:52.240
Pressing it up decreases your
follow distance setting and
00:00:52.240 --> 00:00:54.330
allows your car to follow
at a closer distance.
00:00:55.530 --> 00:00:58.530
And pressing it down, increases
your follow distance setting, and
00:00:58.530 --> 00:01:01.460
expands the distance between you and
a car in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg4.mp4

video_trans:
00:01:16.870 --> 00:01:19.220
There's also a tow haul mode feature,
00:01:19.220 --> 00:01:23.410
which enhances control when hauling
a trailer up and down steep grades and
00:01:23.410 --> 00:01:25.960
augments transmission operation
when towing a heavy load.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg6.mp4

video_name: Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc
video_trans:
00:00:11.450 --> 00:00:13.100
Using the information display, and
00:00:13.100 --> 00:00:16.150
the five way control switch on
the left side of your steering wheel,
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:19.500
you can choose whether you want
your running lamps on or off.
00:00:19.500 --> 00:00:24.380
Just scroll to Settings, Vehicle,
Lighting, then Daytime Lights.
00:00:24.380 --> 00:00:26.750
If you have your daytime
running lamps set to on and
00:00:26.750 --> 00:00:30.430
want to use them, turn the lighting
control to the auto lamp position.
00:00:30.430 --> 00:00:34.110
When the lighting control is in auto lamp
position, and the head lamps are off,
00:00:34.110 --> 00:00:37.099
the daytime running lamps will turn
on automatically when you're driving.
00:00:38.530 --> 00:00:41.770
And will switch between daytime
running lamps and headlamps as needed.
00:00:41.770 --> 00:00:45.150
Based on how light or dark it is outside,
and whether or not the wipers are on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc_seg2.mp4
question: How to choose whether the running lamps to be on or off?

video_trans:

simply kick your leg forward and
00:00:17.520 --> 00:00:21.310
back under the center of the rear
bumper below the license plate.
00:00:21.310 --> 00:00:23.850
Then step back to give
the gate space to open.

From the Sirius screen,

by channel, song title or artist.

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:59.300 --> 00:01:02.040
To set the blind spot
detection on a trailer,
00:01:02.040 --> 00:01:06.000
use the five way switch on your steering
wheel and select type of trailer.
00:01:06.000 --> 00:01:09.920
Keep in mind, BLIS only supports
conventional-type trailers.
00:01:09.920 --> 00:01:12.764
Other types selected with
automatically turn off the BLIS and
00:01:12.764 --> 00:01:14.700
cross-traffic alert feature.
00:01:14.700 --> 00:01:17.980
Next, you'll be asked if you want
to set up BLIS with a trailer.
00:01:17.980 --> 00:01:20.010
If no, BLIS turns off.
00:01:20.010 --> 00:01:24.960
If yes, you'll be asked if the trailer is
less than nine feet wide and 33 feet long.
00:01:24.960 --> 00:01:26.720
Now, enter length of trailer,
00:01:26.720 --> 00:01:29.890
which is the length of the hitch
bulb to the end of the trailer.
00:01:29.890 --> 00:01:34.230
You do so by toggling up or down,
using the menu buttons to increase or
00:01:34.230 --> 00:01:36.560
decrease the measurement by three feet.
00:01:36.560 --> 00:01:38.790
You'll need to select
the length that is equal to or
00:01:38.790 --> 00:01:43.070
greater than three feet of the actual
trailer to allow for full coverage.
00:01:43.070 --> 00:01:49.240
For example, if the actual measured length
is 25 feet, input the length to 27 feet.
00:01:49.240 --> 00:01:52.290
Once the length has been entered,
the setup is saved.
00:01:52.290 --> 00:01:54.570
If the trailer has been connected but
no information for
00:01:54.570 --> 00:01:58.890
that trailer has been entered, the system
will ask for trailer information.
00:01:58.890 --> 00:02:03.250
If no trailer information is entered, BLIS
and cross-traffic alert will be disabled.
00:02:04.320 --> 00:02:07.620
It's important to remember that if you
select a trailer in the display screen
00:02:07.620 --> 00:02:11.790
prior to connecting the trailer, the
system will load that configuration, and
00:02:11.790 --> 00:02:14.560
you'll get a message in the instrument
cluster when the trailer is connected.
00:02:16.000 --> 00:02:19.592
Correct trailer information must be
stored under towing information for
00:02:19.592 --> 00:02:22.695
BLIS with trailer blind spot
coverage to be active while towing.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg5.mp4
question: What is the default trailer length for BLIS in the system?

To set the cruising speed, use the cruise

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:00:53.710 --> 00:00:56.530
When ECO Cruise is on but
not active, the ECO and
00:00:56.530 --> 00:00:59.880
car icon in your information
display will be gray.
00:00:59.880 --> 00:01:03.720
Once active both ECO and
the car icon will turn green.
00:01:03.720 --> 00:01:06.140
Now just accelerate to the speed you want.
00:01:06.140 --> 00:01:09.450
Then press the set button on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:01:09.450 --> 00:01:12.770
Your vehicle will keep a constant
speed until you brake.
00:01:12.770 --> 00:01:17.190
Keep in mind, if you do brake but
then want to resume your set speed again,
00:01:17.190 --> 00:01:20.490
you can press the resume button on
the left side of your steering wheel.

video_trans:

You can also select to have a text message
notification sent to you when your vehicle
00:01:10.760 --> 00:01:13.060
health report is ready to be viewed.
00:01:13.060 --> 00:01:15.970
Likewise, you can choose

00:01:15.970 --> 00:01:17.952

00:01:17.952 --> 00:01:20.120
Once you've saved your setting and
00:01:20.120 --> 00:01:23.930

00:01:26.370 --> 00:01:28.710
You can always opt out at any time.

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:00:11.610 --> 00:00:14.840
First, you'll notice all the normal
climate features you would typically find
00:00:14.840 --> 00:00:16.150
on most cars.
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:20.250
A climate system power button, which turns
the climate control system off and on.
00:00:20.250 --> 00:00:24.370
A fan speed control or a circulating air
button that let's you switch between
00:00:24.370 --> 00:00:27.450
outside air and
air circulating within the car.
00:00:27.450 --> 00:00:30.395
A distribution control that lets you
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:30.395 --> 00:00:34.505
come through the dashboard vents,
the floor vents, the defrost
00:00:34.505 --> 00:00:39.085
vent at the base of the windshield,
or a combination of multiple vents.
00:00:39.085 --> 00:00:41.552
An air conditioning or AC, button.
00:00:41.552 --> 00:00:44.288
Max defrost and rear defrost buttons.
00:00:44.288 --> 00:00:45.850
And a max A/C button.

video_name: How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.323
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.323 --> 00:00:07.842
Did you know your vehicle may be equipped
with a convenient feature that helps make
00:00:07.842 --> 00:00:10.070
maneuvering a trailer in reverse easy?
00:00:10.070 --> 00:00:12.320
It's called Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:00:12.320 --> 00:00:13.590
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:13.590 --> 00:00:15.940
Whether you're backing
a trailer into a job site or
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:20.930
launching a boat, if you can turn a knob,
you can now back up your trailer with ease.
00:00:20.930 --> 00:00:23.630
Which means, whichever direction
you want your trailer to go,
00:00:23.630 --> 00:00:27.640
just turn the knob in that direction and
the system will take over the steering,
00:00:27.640 --> 00:00:30.770
instead of having to turn the wheel
in the opposite direction.
00:00:30.770 --> 00:00:34.150
To use it, press the center button on
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist knob.
00:00:34.150 --> 00:00:36.660
A list of available trailers will appear.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:37.840
Choose the one you want and
00:00:37.840 --> 00:00:40.990
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
will attempt to locate it.
00:00:40.990 --> 00:00:44.010
Once the targeting sticker is
located by the rearview camera,
00:00:44.010 --> 00:00:47.170
the screen will prompt you to
shift into reverse to activate it.
00:00:47.170 --> 00:00:50.450
Then follow the prompts displayed
on the information screen.
00:00:50.450 --> 00:00:52.390
With your hands off the steering wheel,
00:00:52.390 --> 00:00:55.820
use the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
knob to steer the trailer.
00:00:55.820 --> 00:00:59.730
Turn the knob left, or counter-clockwise,
when you want the rear of the trailer to
00:00:59.730 --> 00:01:04.340
go to the left, and right,
clockwise, to go right.
00:01:04.340 --> 00:01:07.070
You should also make it a habit
to use your side view mirrors
00:01:07.070 --> 00:01:10.230
as your primary visual aid
while maneuvering the trailer.
00:01:10.230 --> 00:01:14.190
Once the trailer is moving in
the direction you want, release the knob.
00:01:14.190 --> 00:01:17.450
Keep in mind, you may need to make
small adjustments with the knob to
00:01:17.450 --> 00:01:20.060
keep the trailer moving
along the desired path.
00:01:20.060 --> 00:01:23.820
As soon as the knob is either released or
turned back to the center position,
00:01:23.820 --> 00:01:26.132
the vehicle will follow
the trailer's path.
00:01:26.132 --> 00:01:28.660
You'll need to control the accelerator and
brakes.
00:01:28.660 --> 00:01:29.712
Any questions?
00:01:29.712 --> 00:01:31.599
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:01:31.599 --> 00:01:41.599
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g_seg1.mp4
question: How can we clarify the doubts about the vehicle online?

You'll also appreciate these available
convenience lighting features, such as
00:00:33.990 --> 00:00:38.530

00:00:38.530 --> 00:00:42.290

video_name: Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog
video_trans:
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.720
When you're ready to fold up the step,
00:00:45.720 --> 00:00:48.550
press the yellow number 1
button on the extender bar and
00:00:48.550 --> 00:00:51.200
guide it down with your hand to allow
it to lower into the black bar.
00:00:52.680 --> 00:00:57.140
Now, press the yellow number 2
button at the base of the bar, here.
00:00:57.140 --> 00:01:00.245
Fold the bar toward you and
push it back into the tailgate.
00:01:00.245 --> 00:01:02.985
Finally, lift the step up
until it's horizontal and
00:01:02.985 --> 00:01:05.045
push it back into
the tailgate until it clicks.
00:01:06.135 --> 00:01:07.080
One more thing.
00:01:07.080 --> 00:01:11.028
Unlike previous models, the tailgate
handle is stored within the tailgate
00:01:11.028 --> 00:01:14.556
itself, so it's flush to the surface and
nothing is sticking out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog_seg3.mp4
question: Where is the tailgate handle stored?

video_trans:

To remove the panel, place your hand
underneath the center of the panel and
00:00:20.200 --> 00:00:22.040
feel for the recess.
00:00:22.040 --> 00:00:24.830
Now, just lift up and pull out.
00:00:24.830 --> 00:00:28.170
Once the bottom becomes unlatched
from the side of the panel,
00:00:28.170 --> 00:00:31.550
place your fingers behind and
gently pull it off.
00:00:31.550 --> 00:00:32.239
It's that simple.

To set a separate temperature for
the front passenger side,

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:00:26.460 --> 00:00:29.570
To lock your doors, simply press
the sensor on the door handle for
00:00:29.570 --> 00:00:30.890
about a half a second.
00:00:30.890 --> 00:00:33.470
It'll have ridges or
a square sensor like this.
00:00:34.530 --> 00:00:36.300
When you hear them click,
you'll know they're locked.
00:00:37.450 --> 00:00:41.090
Or you can press the lock/unlock
button on the inside door panel
00:00:41.090 --> 00:00:44.280
before closing the door and
it will automatically lock.

And one more thing.
00:00:45.591 --> 00:00:50.590
If for any reason it doesn't engage
reverse gear, press the clutch pedal down,
00:00:50.590 --> 00:00:55.532
take it out of gear, release the clutch
pedal, then repeat the process again.

video_name: How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.323
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.323 --> 00:00:07.842
Did you know your vehicle may be equipped
with a convenient feature that helps make
00:00:07.842 --> 00:00:10.070
maneuvering a trailer in reverse easy?
00:00:10.070 --> 00:00:12.320
It's called Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:00:12.320 --> 00:00:13.590
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:13.590 --> 00:00:15.940
Whether you're backing
a trailer into a job site or
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:20.930
launching a boat, if you can turn a knob,
you can now back up your trailer with ease.
00:00:20.930 --> 00:00:23.630
Which means, whichever direction
you want your trailer to go,
00:00:23.630 --> 00:00:27.640
just turn the knob in that direction and
the system will take over the steering,
00:00:27.640 --> 00:00:30.770
instead of having to turn the wheel
in the opposite direction.
00:00:30.770 --> 00:00:34.150
To use it, press the center button on
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist knob.
00:00:34.150 --> 00:00:36.660
A list of available trailers will appear.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:37.840
Choose the one you want and
00:00:37.840 --> 00:00:40.990
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
will attempt to locate it.
00:00:40.990 --> 00:00:44.010
Once the targeting sticker is
located by the rearview camera,
00:00:44.010 --> 00:00:47.170
the screen will prompt you to
shift into reverse to activate it.
00:00:47.170 --> 00:00:50.450
Then follow the prompts displayed
on the information screen.
00:00:50.450 --> 00:00:52.390
With your hands off the steering wheel,
00:00:52.390 --> 00:00:55.820
use the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
knob to steer the trailer.
00:00:55.820 --> 00:00:59.730
Turn the knob left, or counter-clockwise,
when you want the rear of the trailer to
00:00:59.730 --> 00:01:04.340
go to the left, and right,
clockwise, to go right.
00:01:04.340 --> 00:01:07.070
You should also make it a habit
to use your side view mirrors
00:01:07.070 --> 00:01:10.230
as your primary visual aid
while maneuvering the trailer.
00:01:10.230 --> 00:01:14.190
Once the trailer is moving in
the direction you want, release the knob.
00:01:14.190 --> 00:01:17.450
Keep in mind, you may need to make
small adjustments with the knob to
00:01:17.450 --> 00:01:20.060
keep the trailer moving
along the desired path.
00:01:20.060 --> 00:01:23.820
As soon as the knob is either released or
turned back to the center position,
00:01:23.820 --> 00:01:26.132
the vehicle will follow
the trailer's path.
00:01:26.132 --> 00:01:28.660
You'll need to control the accelerator and
brakes.
00:01:28.660 --> 00:01:29.712
Any questions?
00:01:29.712 --> 00:01:31.599
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:01:31.599 --> 00:01:41.599
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g_seg1.mp4
question: What is the correct direction I need to turn the knob if I want to go right?

As well as new available navigation

video_trans:

Before you begin, you'll need a few
things to help with the setup.
00:00:20.540 --> 00:00:25.230
Your supplied quick start setup guide with
measurement card, a tape measure, a pen or
00:00:25.230 --> 00:00:29.490
pencil, an assistant to help out if needed
as well as the checkered sticker that
00:00:29.490 --> 00:00:32.110
comes with your guide which
I'll tell you about later.

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:
00:00:40.590 --> 00:00:43.575
Keep in mind, even though you
are manually changing gears,
00:00:43.575 --> 00:00:45.910
SelectShift will automatically
make some shifts for
00:00:45.910 --> 00:00:50.190
you, if your enter speed is to high,
or if your RPMs are too low.
00:00:50.190 --> 00:00:52.970
And once you've gone into Sport Mode,
00:00:52.970 --> 00:00:55.470
your car will stay there until
you shift back to Drive Mode.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc_seg4.mp4
question: How long does your car stay in select shift?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:03:07.000 --> 00:03:09.700
Now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the system's
00:03:09.700 --> 00:03:10.640
information display.
00:03:11.720 --> 00:03:15.190
To input the measurements you recorded
outside the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:15.190 --> 00:03:18.540
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:18.540 --> 00:03:21.130
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed.
00:03:21.130 --> 00:03:24.444
Like this,
then OK to confirm each measurement and
00:03:24.444 --> 00:03:26.769
to move on to the next measurement.
00:03:26.769 --> 00:03:28.618
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:03:28.618 --> 00:03:31.761
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:03:31.761 --> 00:03:35.591
If correct, select Confirm and hit OK.
00:03:35.591 --> 00:03:39.573
Once you've confirmed the measurements,
the system will automatically search for
00:03:39.573 --> 00:03:42.172
the sticker target and
highlight it with a red circle and
00:03:42.172 --> 00:03:44.391
the message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:03:44.391 --> 00:03:47.495
If it is, select yes to confirm.
00:03:47.495 --> 00:03:50.762
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know setup is complete and
00:03:50.762 --> 00:03:51.927
measurements are saved.
00:03:51.927 --> 00:03:54.753
If you don't see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:03:54.753 --> 00:03:57.201
Make sure the measurements are correct and
that the trailer and
00:03:57.201 --> 00:03:59.115
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:03:59.115 --> 00:04:03.779
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straightforward between 4 and 25 miles per
00:04:03.779 --> 00:04:07.844
hour as directed until you get a message
confirming calibration is complete.
00:04:07.844 --> 00:04:08.911
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg6.mp4
question: How do you complete calibration?

00:00:38.331 --> 00:00:42.858

00:00:42.858 --> 00:00:45.430

The camera will turn off when

00:00:48.532 --> 00:00:51.910
when another camera view is
selected from the touch screen.

00:01:01.920 --> 00:01:04.260

00:01:04.260 --> 00:01:07.590

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:00:18.830 --> 00:00:19.730
To access it,
00:00:19.730 --> 00:00:24.040
from the home screen touch Apps on your
SYNC 3 touch screen, then Power Flow.
00:00:25.080 --> 00:00:26.710
The power flow screen will appear and
00:00:26.710 --> 00:00:29.240
you'll see your vehicles
current operating status.
00:00:29.240 --> 00:00:36.020
Either idle, hybrid drive, electric
drive or charging high voltage battery.
00:00:36.020 --> 00:00:38.620
Now depending on which status
you're currently running in
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:41.320
such as electric drive mode
when the engine is off
00:00:41.320 --> 00:00:45.730
you'll see a blue power flow path
indicating which components are in use.
00:00:45.730 --> 00:00:49.360
In this case power from the battery
is being used for accessories like
00:00:49.360 --> 00:00:54.060
the climate control, high voltage electric
heater or air conditioning compressor and
00:00:54.060 --> 00:00:58.500
other low voltage accessories such
as the radio, fans or heated seats.
00:00:58.500 --> 00:01:01.090
You'll also notice power
flowing to the electric motor
00:01:01.090 --> 00:01:02.720
which is driving the wheels.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg2.mp4
question: How many operating statuses are there on the power flow display?

By the way for

it's recommended to upgrade to

00:02:59.510 --> 00:03:04.180

00:03:04.200 --> 00:03:07.915
the supplied 120 volt charging cord.

Go to Owner.Ford.com.

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:02:09.570 --> 00:02:13.270
You may also notice that the charge
cord has multiple LED indicators
00:02:13.270 --> 00:02:17.580
to indicate that charging is in progress
or if any problems have occurred.
00:02:17.580 --> 00:02:21.340
When plugged into an AC outlet,
and you see a solid green light,
00:02:21.340 --> 00:02:24.080
power is available, but
vehicle charging has not begun.
00:02:25.470 --> 00:02:27.770
A flashing green light means
the vehicle is charging.
00:02:28.960 --> 00:02:32.270
If you see a flashing
solid red triangle LED,
00:02:32.270 --> 00:02:37.290
a ground fault circuit interrupter fault
or charge cord fault has been detected.
00:02:37.290 --> 00:02:41.610
However, if at any time you see a flashing
amber LED light in the shape of an outlet
00:02:41.610 --> 00:02:46.020
plug, that means high temperature
at the AC plug has been detected.
00:02:46.020 --> 00:02:48.610
Have the outlet checked by
a qualified electrician and
00:02:48.610 --> 00:02:50.839
make sure the AC plug fits
firmly into the outlet.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg7.mp4
question: What does a flashing LED light means?

video_name: Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg
video_trans:
00:00:12.040 --> 00:00:14.290
First, let's talk about the accelerometer.
00:00:14.290 --> 00:00:16.080
It's part of the Track Apps feature.
00:00:16.080 --> 00:00:19.410
Using the five-way switch on the left
side of your steering wheel,
00:00:19.410 --> 00:00:21.410
select Track Apps in the Main Menu.
00:00:21.410 --> 00:00:23.822
Accelerometer, and press OK.
00:00:23.822 --> 00:00:27.630
The accelerometer displays
the vehicle's rate of acceleration, or
00:00:27.630 --> 00:00:30.672
deceleration on a virtual
gauge in the cluster, here.
00:00:30.672 --> 00:00:34.035
A red indicator dot in the center of
the gauge indicates the vehicle's
00:00:34.035 --> 00:00:37.630
longitudinal, and
latitudinal acceleration in real time.
00:00:37.630 --> 00:00:39.720
And updates it constantly.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.110
The numbers on the outside of the ring
represent the maximum accelerations
00:00:43.110 --> 00:00:44.580
since the last reset values.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg_seg2.mp4
question: Where do I go in the apps menu to access the accelerometer?

screen for a simple,

video_name: USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c
video_trans:
00:00:25.360 --> 00:00:29.640
Unlike traditional USB charging ports
that provide 500 milliamps of power and
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:31.060
can only charge a smartphone or
00:00:31.060 --> 00:00:35.260
media player, smart USB chargers can
provide up to two amps, and know just
00:00:35.260 --> 00:00:38.080
the right amount of power to deliver
to whatever device you're charging.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.743
Meaning, if you have one device plugged
in that needs two amps to charge, and
00:00:42.743 --> 00:00:46.255
another plugged in at the same time
that only needs one amp to fully charge,
00:00:46.255 --> 00:00:49.029
your smart USB port will deliver
the right amount to both.
00:00:49.029 --> 00:00:52.292
And that can help save battery power for
your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c_seg3.mp4
question: WHICH TYPE OF USB CHARGER I CAN USE THIS CAR?

video_name: Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA
video_trans:
00:00:11.960 --> 00:00:14.580
First, keep in mind that
convertible top fabric
00:00:14.580 --> 00:00:16.710
does not promote mildew growth itself.
00:00:16.710 --> 00:00:20.705
Mildew may develop on dirt or
other foreign substances if not removed.
00:00:20.705 --> 00:00:25.090
So keeping the fabric clean through
regular washings will enhance the life and
00:00:25.090 --> 00:00:26.696
beauty of the top material.
00:00:26.696 --> 00:00:29.595
When washing vehicles
with cloth top roofs.
00:00:29.595 --> 00:00:33.012
Start by vacuuming with a soft
bristle brush attachment and
00:00:33.012 --> 00:00:35.070
be sure to use a non detergent soap.
00:00:35.070 --> 00:00:40.925
Scrub gently in a circular pattern using
a terrycloth towel or soft bristle brush.
00:00:40.925 --> 00:00:44.030
More specifically horse hair or
soft nylon.
00:00:44.030 --> 00:00:45.950
Do not use stiff bristle brushes or
00:00:45.950 --> 00:00:49.420
any abrasive materials or
cleaners as they can damage the fabric.
00:00:50.840 --> 00:00:54.760
When finished, rinse thoroughly
removing all soap residues.
00:00:54.760 --> 00:00:59.040
Allow the top to air dry completely
before folding it otherwise, mold or
00:00:59.040 --> 00:01:02.340
mildew may develop and
discolor the cloth material.
00:01:02.340 --> 00:01:07.090
To clean away lint debris like cottonwood,
use a standard clothes lint roller or
00:01:07.090 --> 00:01:09.320
a vacuum attachment with
a soft bristle brush.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA_seg2.mp4
question: How should I clean my convertable fabric top?

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:41.900
To access the other two cup holders and
storage bin, pull the middle seat back
00:00:41.900 --> 00:00:46.540
down by pushing the button on
the passenger side of the console, here.
00:00:46.540 --> 00:00:50.180
You can open the storage
bin by squeezing the small latch.
00:00:50.190 --> 00:00:54.160
For your added security, this storage bin
will only open when the seat is folded.
00:00:54.160 --> 00:00:57.783
So there's no worry of things falling
out when it's in the upright position.
00:00:57.783 --> 00:01:02.415
And keep in mind, because the cup holders
have small rubber pads on the inside,
00:01:02.415 --> 00:01:06.234
they can hold different size cups and
plastic bottles securely.

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:00:14.380 --> 00:00:16.190
It works a lot like
standard cruise control,
00:00:16.190 --> 00:00:19.196
in that it still maintains
your speed on flat roadways.
00:00:19.196 --> 00:00:21.470
But with ECO Cruise,
when you tap the brake, and
00:00:21.470 --> 00:00:25.410
then want to resume your previously set
speed, it accelerates gradually to get
00:00:25.410 --> 00:00:29.100
your vehicle back up to speed and
that can help save energy.
00:00:29.100 --> 00:00:33.160
Be aware that you may experience some
speed loss when first going up hill but
00:00:33.160 --> 00:00:37.110
after a short period of time,
it will catch up to your set speed.
00:00:37.110 --> 00:00:39.380
And if equipped with
adaptive cruise control,
00:00:39.380 --> 00:00:43.320
when your vehicle speed is slowed, it will
automatically accelerate again gradually
00:00:43.320 --> 00:00:47.890
once traffic is cleared. That gradual
acceleration may make it seem as if your
00:00:47.890 --> 00:00:50.930
vehicle isn't keeping up with
the speed you've set, it is.
00:00:50.930 --> 00:00:53.710
It's just that its more efficient
to gradually accelerate.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM_seg2.mp4
question: Does eco control use more or less energy?

00:00:56.902 --> 00:01:00.113

00:01:00.113 --> 00:01:01.307

00:01:03.600 --> 00:01:07.480

when you plug in, when the vehicle is
00:01:07.480 --> 00:01:13.080

00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:17.860

all lighting features.

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:00:30.900 --> 00:00:33.885
To set up and receive a vehicle
health report via your email,
00:00:33.885 --> 00:00:36.690
you'll first need to login
to your owner account.
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:39.990
If you've not logged in before,
you'll need to register.
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:43.550
Just your name, email address, ZIP code,
00:00:43.550 --> 00:00:48.480
your vehicle identification number or
VIN and your mobile phone number.
00:00:48.480 --> 00:00:52.230
Once you've logged in, click on
the Service and Maintenance tab to set up
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:57.560
reports, then Vehicle Health Report and
click Manage Notifications.
00:00:57.560 --> 00:01:01.810
Then you may need to scroll down the page
and select Email a detailed summary.
00:01:01.810 --> 00:01:03.510
Finally, click Save.
00:01:03.510 --> 00:01:05.660
Now, you're ready to
receive email updates.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg2.mp4
question: How can I get a vehicle report via email?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w
video_trans:
00:00:40.240 --> 00:00:43.325
Here are a few important things you
should know when using Auto Start-Stop.
00:00:44.590 --> 00:00:48.468
Your electric power assisted steering
is inactive when your engine is off.
00:00:48.468 --> 00:00:52.270
And Auto Start-Stop may not shut the
engine off if your battery is charging,
00:00:52.270 --> 00:00:56.770
the engine is still warming up, or if
you're using the heat or air conditioner.
00:00:56.770 --> 00:01:00.930
So, if you AC is on because it's warm
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:02.170 --> 00:01:03.260
One more thing.
00:01:03.260 --> 00:01:07.120
Your vehicle is equipped with a heavy duty
starter and battery to help compensate for
00:01:07.120 --> 00:01:08.930
the increased number of starts and stops.

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:01:32.170 --> 00:01:34.792
Once the data of cruise is on,
it uses radar and
00:01:34.792 --> 00:01:39.048
camera technology to constantly scan for
slower vehicles in front of you.
00:01:39.048 --> 00:01:42.403
And automatically adjusts your
speed to maintain the gap.
00:01:42.403 --> 00:01:46.639
You may notice that on occasion, you go
slower than you initially set your cruise for.
00:01:46.639 --> 00:01:49.018
That's the system adjusting the speed.
00:01:49.018 --> 00:01:52.902
Once traffic speeds up,
you'll return to the speed you set.

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:02:18.170 --> 00:02:21.850
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:02:21.850 --> 00:02:25.340
The sticker acts as a target that
the trailer reverse guidance feature and
00:02:25.340 --> 00:02:28.480
rear view camera use to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:29.640 --> 00:02:31.250
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:31.250 --> 00:02:33.830
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:33.830 --> 00:02:36.790
You'll want to place the sticker
within 7 to 22 inches from
00:02:36.790 --> 00:02:38.890
the center of the trailer hitch ball.
00:02:38.890 --> 00:02:42.696
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal surface, so
00:02:42.696 --> 00:02:46.573
the entire sticker is in the acceptable
zone invisible by the rearview camera.
00:02:46.573 --> 00:02:48.293
[MUSIC]
00:02:48.293 --> 00:02:50.430
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:50.430 --> 00:02:54.020
Once the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:54.020 --> 00:02:56.020
record several measurements.
00:02:56.020 --> 00:02:59.880
First, measure the horizontal distance
from the license plate to the center of
00:02:59.880 --> 00:03:01.720
the hitch ball, and write it down.
00:03:01.720 --> 00:03:06.130
Next, measure the horizontal distance
from the center of the hitch ball to
00:03:06.130 --> 00:03:07.746
the center of the sticker.
00:03:07.746 --> 00:03:11.870
And the distance from the rear view
camera to the center of the sticker.
00:03:11.870 --> 00:03:15.218
Keep in mind, the location is
not dependent on a straight or
00:03:15.218 --> 00:03:20.780
a frame type, but based on where a surface
is available that meets the requirements.
00:03:20.780 --> 00:03:24.740
And finally, the horizontal distance from
the tailgate to the center of the trailer
00:03:24.740 --> 00:03:26.645
axle if it's a single axle trailer.
00:03:28.335 --> 00:03:30.685
If the trailer has two or more axles,
00:03:30.685 --> 00:03:34.680
measure to the center point
between both axles, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg4.mp4
question: What is the purpose of the checkered sticker?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:58.497 --> 00:01:01.470
Now, let's talk about Cross-Traffic alert.
00:01:01.470 --> 00:01:05.650
It warns you of moving cars coming from
either side when you're in reverse or
00:01:05.650 --> 00:01:09.550
backing up and gives you three warnings,
a light on the corresponding
00:01:09.550 --> 00:01:13.470
side view mirror, a chime, and
a message in your message center.
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:16.970
Extreme weather conditions
could block the sensors, but
00:01:16.970 --> 00:01:20.370
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:01:20.370 --> 00:01:23.234
And keep in mind,
as with the most radar, infrared, and
00:01:23.234 --> 00:01:27.246
ultrasonic-type sensing system,
there is the possibility of false alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg4.mp4
question: What warnings does the cross-traffic alert give you?

Countdown provides a racing
Christmas tree style start timer.
00:01:28.230 --> 00:01:31.480

timer in the track apps menu,
00:01:31.480 --> 00:01:33.670

00:01:33.670 --> 00:01:36.800

second intervals: yellow,
00:01:36.800 --> 00:01:38.080

If the driver accelerates early the light
will turn red indicating a false start,
00:01:42.550 --> 00:01:43.730
and no data will be recorded.

video_name: SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw
video_trans:
00:01:45.930 --> 00:01:50.082
To set valet mode, which locks out the
SYNC 3 screen to the valet attendant while
00:01:50.082 --> 00:01:52.920
driving your car, press the Valet tile.
00:01:52.920 --> 00:01:56.440
You get a message asking you to enter
a personal identification number of your
00:01:56.440 --> 00:01:58.750
choice and if you want to continue.
00:01:58.750 --> 00:02:00.580
If so, press Yes.
00:02:00.580 --> 00:02:02.867
Then type in your PIN and press Done.
00:02:02.867 --> 00:02:05.810
Re-enter the PIN to complete the process.
00:02:05.810 --> 00:02:07.980
Once you get your key back from the valet,
00:02:07.980 --> 00:02:11.890
you need to enter the PIN again to turn
Valet Mode off and unlock the screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw_seg7.mp4
question: Where is the valet mode button located?

Here are a few more things you'll

the display always shows you a small top
00:01:24.990 --> 00:01:27.910

You'll also see two

First, fold the outside

fold the seat back down.

back up into the lock position.

You'll hear a click.

And on some vehicles,
00:00:31.300 --> 00:00:34.870
you may see a red indicator on
the lever to let you know it's locked.
00:00:34.870 --> 00:00:36.584
Just give it a slight pull to make sure.

Any questions?

Go to www.FordOwner.com.

video_name: Charge Port Door Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-i03oHS_TMug
video_trans:
00:00:15.175 --> 00:00:19.395
To open the charge port door,
just press the indent tab, here, and
00:00:19.395 --> 00:00:21.625
it will automatically spring open.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Charge Port Door Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-i03oHS_TMug_seg2.mp4
question: how will the charge port door open?

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:15.680 --> 00:00:19.000
The trailer brake controller
automatically applies the trailer brakes
00:00:19.000 --> 00:00:21.610
when the tow vehicles brakes are pressed.
00:00:21.610 --> 00:00:24.760
The TBC control is located
on your center console.
00:00:24.760 --> 00:00:29.360
It has a manual control lever that sends
independent power to the trailer's brakes,
00:00:29.360 --> 00:00:31.170
and a plus and minus button.
00:00:31.170 --> 00:00:33.490
Pressing either of them
adjusts how much or
00:00:33.490 --> 00:00:36.940
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:36.940 --> 00:00:38.990
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:38.990 --> 00:00:41.670
lower the gain setting continuously.
00:00:41.670 --> 00:00:42.760
Still with me?
00:00:42.760 --> 00:00:43.880
Okay, then let's move on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg2.mp4
question: Can we adjust the power to the TBC?

Did you know that the charge
port door on Ford Fusion Energy,
00:00:08.694 --> 00:00:13.635
C-MAX Energi and Focus Electric can be
opened with a simple press of your finger?
00:00:13.635 --> 00:00:15.175

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:03:35.150 --> 00:03:39.890
To delete an alert touch Edit Alert,
choose the alert you wish to delete and
00:03:39.890 --> 00:03:43.820
hit the delete box next to it.
00:03:43.820 --> 00:03:45.950
Or, you can also choose Delete All.
00:03:47.020 --> 00:03:51.180
One more thing, for more information,
and a list of all available SiriusXM
00:03:51.180 --> 00:03:55.800
programming, refer to the SiriusXM
brochure located in your glove box, or
00:03:55.800 --> 00:03:58.640
visit siriusxm.com.
00:03:58.640 --> 00:03:59.420
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg11.mp4
question: Where can I find more information?

video_name: SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw
video_trans:
00:01:45.930 --> 00:01:50.082
To set valet mode, which locks out the
SYNC 3 screen to the valet attendant while
00:01:50.082 --> 00:01:52.920
driving your car, press the Valet tile.
00:01:52.920 --> 00:01:56.440
You get a message asking you to enter
a personal identification number of your
00:01:56.440 --> 00:01:58.750
choice and if you want to continue.
00:01:58.750 --> 00:02:00.580
If so, press Yes.
00:02:00.580 --> 00:02:02.867
Then type in your PIN and press Done.
00:02:02.867 --> 00:02:05.810
Re-enter the PIN to complete the process.
00:02:05.810 --> 00:02:07.980
Once you get your key back from the valet,
00:02:07.980 --> 00:02:11.890
you need to enter the PIN again to turn
Valet Mode off and unlock the screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw_seg7.mp4
question: What does the Valet Mode do?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:00:46.420 --> 00:00:50.420
There's also a small white car icon in the
upper left corner of your touch screen.
00:00:50.420 --> 00:00:54.680
It lets you know which camera view is
being used, for example, 360 view,
00:00:54.680 --> 00:00:56.840
split view, etc..
00:00:56.848 --> 00:01:00.550
The icon highlights will change when
you switch from one view to another.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg5.mp4
question: How can you know what camera view is being used?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:40.620 --> 00:01:44.480
When in reverse, you can change the camera
view you see by using the camera button on
00:01:44.480 --> 00:01:48.280
the dash above the screen and pushing
it until you get the view you want.
00:01:48.280 --> 00:01:51.390
Keep in mind, the change camera view
function only works when you're
00:01:51.390 --> 00:01:55.210
driving forward at six miles per hour or
below for safety purposes.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg9.mp4
question: When does the change camera view option work?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:00:22.160 --> 00:00:26.190
Vehicles equipped with Sirius XM
come with a pre-activated six month
00:00:26.190 --> 00:00:31.020
all access trial subscription, which
includes Sirius XM radio for your vehicle,
00:00:31.020 --> 00:00:36.450
plus the ability to enjoy Sirius XM while
outside your Ford by streaming online and
00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:38.130
on the Sirius XM app.
00:00:38.130 --> 00:00:41.070
Keep in mind,
in order to stream Sirius XM,
00:00:41.070 --> 00:00:45.250
you'll need to set up your account
with a username and password online.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg2.mp4
question: How long is the pre-activated all-access trial subscription for vehicles equipped with Sirius XM?

video_name: Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog
video_trans:
00:00:11.850 --> 00:00:15.020
To use the step, first lower the tailgate,
00:00:15.020 --> 00:00:18.950
then press the black release button in
the center of the step molding, here.
00:00:18.950 --> 00:00:20.470
The step will pop out a little, so
00:00:20.470 --> 00:00:23.360
just pull it all the way until it
gently falls into a lower position.
00:00:24.710 --> 00:00:27.860
Next, grab the yellow bar
top to the left of the step.
00:00:27.860 --> 00:00:30.410
Pull until the black bar
is fully extended and
00:00:30.410 --> 00:00:32.920
lift it up until it's locked into place.
00:00:32.920 --> 00:00:35.280
Then, pull the chrome interior
bar all of the way up.
00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:39.410
You'll know the bar is fully
extended when you hear a click.
00:00:39.410 --> 00:00:42.930
The bar can be used as a grab handle to
help pull yourself up into the truck bed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog_seg2.mp4
question: How do I pop the step out of the vehicleâ€™s tailgate?

video_name: Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw
video_trans:
00:00:15.750 --> 00:00:19.831
To open all of your windows at once and
vent the moon roof if you have one,
00:00:19.831 --> 00:00:24.141
press and hold the unlock button on
your key fob for at least three seconds.
00:00:24.141 --> 00:00:27.449
If you want to stop them from opening,
just press the lock or
00:00:27.449 --> 00:00:28.738
unlock button again.
00:00:28.738 --> 00:00:30.999
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw_seg2.mp4
question: What do you push on the key fob to open all the windows at once.

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:00:20.990 --> 00:00:22.920
In an addition to
the traditional gear selections,
00:00:22.920 --> 00:00:26.330
your transmission has
two additional modes.
00:00:26.330 --> 00:00:28.990
Progressive range selection
that lets you lock out
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:32.690
upper gears when the truck is heavily
loaded or when towing on grades.
00:00:32.690 --> 00:00:35.750
And manual,
that lets you manually select gears.

video_trans:
00:02:53.960 --> 00:02:56.400
Another feature you may
appreciate is alert,
00:02:56.400 --> 00:02:59.700
which when available notifies
you if a specific artist or
00:02:59.700 --> 00:03:03.490
song you previously selected,
is being played on another channel.
00:03:03.490 --> 00:03:05.580
You'll first need to enable alerts.

In fact, thanks to available Enhanced

Let me show you how it works.

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:15.650 --> 00:00:19.640
Adaptive cruise control maintains
a pre-set gap by adjusting the vehicle's
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:22.250
speed so you don't need to
constantly use your brake and
00:00:22.250 --> 00:00:25.340
accelerator to adjust with
the speed of traffic.

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:48.160 --> 00:00:49.250
Keep in mind,
00:00:49.250 --> 00:00:53.440
there are some factors that affect the
amount of energy being used while driving.
00:00:53.440 --> 00:00:57.330
For instance, mild or
aggressive acceleration or braking,
00:00:57.330 --> 00:01:01.905
your vehicle's speed, how much you use
accessories, such as climate control.
00:01:01.905 --> 00:01:06.232
The ambient temperature and other weather
conditions, as well as whether you're
00:01:06.232 --> 00:01:09.335
driving in the city or
on the highway, and the road grades.
00:01:09.335 --> 00:01:10.463
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg4.mp4
question: What are the factors which effect the energy being used?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:35.030
Here are a few helpful tips for
unfolding the third row seats.
00:01:35.030 --> 00:01:38.130
You may need to do the next two
steps from the rear of the vehicle.
00:01:38.130 --> 00:01:42.500
First, retract the floor panels by
pulling up on the attached strap.
00:01:42.500 --> 00:01:46.620
Next, grab the third row seat back strap
located behind the head restraint and
00:01:46.620 --> 00:01:47.830
lift it to its locked position.
00:01:49.130 --> 00:01:52.725
Now, go back to the rear side of the door
and use the strap on the front of
00:01:52.725 --> 00:01:55.070
the seat cushion to flip it
back to its original position.
00:01:56.380 --> 00:01:57.950
And here's something you'll appreciate.
00:01:57.950 --> 00:02:02.210
You can also move the third row seats
forward and back and recline them.
00:02:02.210 --> 00:02:04.250
Just lift the metal bar
under the seat cushion and
00:02:04.250 --> 00:02:06.140
slide the seat forward or back.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:09.530
And pull the same strap you used to
fold the seat back down to recline them.
00:02:09.530 --> 00:02:12.160
Only now, just lean back to recline.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg4.mp4
question: How do you adjust the third row seat of the car forward and backward?

video_name: Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo
video_trans:
00:00:23.690 --> 00:00:29.339
To use line lock, using the five-way
switch scroll down to Track Apps.
00:00:29.339 --> 00:00:31.210
And select Line Lock from the menu.
00:00:31.210 --> 00:00:33.860
There are two steps to using Line Lock.
00:00:33.860 --> 00:00:36.660
This step verifies the driver and
car are ready.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:38.670
Simply follow the prompts on the screen.
00:00:38.670 --> 00:00:41.130
If you're unable to select Line Lock,
00:00:41.130 --> 00:00:43.570
check to be sure you're driving
under 25 miles an hour,
00:00:43.570 --> 00:00:49.060
the vehicle is on a level surface, and
you're not in another driving mode.
00:00:49.060 --> 00:00:54.370
To engage, firmly press and hold the
brakes, press OK on the steering wheel,
00:00:54.370 --> 00:00:57.980
remove your foot from the brake pedal,
and hit the accelerator.
00:00:57.980 --> 00:01:02.422
A 15 second countdown timer will
show the remaining time left before
00:01:02.422 --> 00:01:03.785
Line Lock shuts off.
00:01:03.785 --> 00:01:06.480
[MUSIC]
00:01:06.480 --> 00:01:10.670
You can always manually cancel it
by pressing the OK button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo_seg2.mp4
question: What is a line lock and how do you test for it?

video_name: SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw
video_trans:
00:00:34.790 --> 00:00:38.840
Touching the Sound tile allows you to
adjust certain sound settings, like treble
00:00:38.840 --> 00:00:44.330
and bass, midrange, fade and balance,
and speed adaptive volume control,
00:00:44.330 --> 00:00:48.070
which increases or decreases
the volume based on your driving speed.
00:00:48.070 --> 00:00:51.000
To reset sound levels back to
the original default setting,
00:00:51.000 --> 00:00:54.500
just press the Reset All button, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw_seg3.mp4
question: What should you press to bring back the sound settings to default?

video_name: One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk
video_trans:
00:00:46.090 --> 00:00:48.750
For your safety, your windows
also have a bounce back feature.
00:00:48.750 --> 00:00:51.350
If you're closing a window and
it senses something in the way,
00:00:51.350 --> 00:00:53.450
it will automatically stop.
00:00:53.450 --> 00:00:55.750
That way, no one gets hurt and
nothing gets stuck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk_seg5.mp4

EcoSelect will also get the benefits of
00:00:45.715 --> 00:00:49.360
EcoCruise, which helps maximize economy
while driving on hilly roadways,

video_trans:
00:00:45.850 --> 00:00:48.990
The acceleration timer displays
the vehicle's rate of acceleration
00:00:48.990 --> 00:00:51.500

00:00:51.500 --> 00:00:55.305
0 to 30 miles per hour,
0 to 60 miles per hour,
00:00:55.305 --> 00:00:57.775
0 to 100 miles per hour, or distance.

1/8 mile, or 1/4 mile.

video_name: Hands Free Liftgate _ Ford How-to _ Ford-nmWSzJn1Dfk
video_trans:
00:00:33.700 --> 00:00:37.760
If you don't want to use the hands-free
capability, you can always use the lift
00:00:37.760 --> 00:00:41.700
gate button on your key fob,
the button on the instrument panel, or
00:00:41.700 --> 00:00:45.000
the button located on the lift gate
handle just below the license plate.
00:00:46.060 --> 00:00:49.620
One more thing, if your vehicle is
equipped with an available trailer tow
00:00:49.620 --> 00:00:54.190
package, to open or close the lift gate,
just kick under the bumper to the left or
00:00:54.190 --> 00:00:56.120
right of the tow hitch.
00:00:56.120 --> 00:00:57.270
Any questions?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:00:32.110 --> 00:00:36.110
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.110 --> 00:00:39.960
For best results, it's recommended to use
a draw bar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:39.960 --> 00:00:44.600
drop to position your trailer level to
the ground. Then line up your vehicle and
00:00:44.600 --> 00:00:47.360
trailer by pulling forward, so
they're in line with one another.
00:00:48.500 --> 00:00:51.994
Second, from inside the vehicle
to begin programming,
00:00:51.994 --> 00:00:56.797
press the center of the Pro Trailer Backup
Assist button located to the right of
00:00:56.797 --> 00:00:58.569
the steering wheel, here.
00:00:58.569 --> 00:01:02.792
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:02.792 --> 00:01:06.612
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:06.612 --> 00:01:08.489
Press OK once finished.
00:01:08.489 --> 00:01:11.508
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:11.508 --> 00:01:16.095
Electric, which is the default or
surge type and press OK.
00:01:16.095 --> 00:01:18.751
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer.
00:01:18.751 --> 00:01:21.737
Low, which is the recommended setting for
most trailers,
00:01:21.737 --> 00:01:25.892
Medium or High if your trailer requires
more aggressive braking like if you have
00:01:25.892 --> 00:01:29.230
a larger, heavier trailer, for instance.
00:01:29.230 --> 00:01:33.586
And since Pro Trailer Backup Assist is not
currently compatible with fifth-wheel or
00:01:33.586 --> 00:01:37.592
gooseneck type trailers, conventional
will be the default trailer type.
00:01:37.592 --> 00:01:41.507
You'll get a message asking if you
want to add Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:01:41.507 --> 00:01:43.224
Select Yes to confirm.
00:01:43.224 --> 00:01:45.864
A prompt will direct you
to straighten the trailer,
00:01:45.864 --> 00:01:47.725
if necessary to continue the setup.
00:01:47.725 --> 00:01:51.208
You'll then get another message directing
you to put the vehicle in park and
00:01:51.208 --> 00:01:54.810
to place the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
target sticker on your trailer tongue.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg3.mp4
question: What type of surface should you be on to connect your trailer to your vehicle?

video_name: LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk
video_trans:
00:01:00.588 --> 00:01:05.024
High visibility LED box lights in the box
interior make it easy to find and
00:01:05.024 --> 00:01:07.350
load items in the dark.
00:01:07.350 --> 00:01:11.020
There are two lights located in
the rear corners that shine forward.
00:01:11.020 --> 00:01:14.770
There is also one in the high mounted
stop lamp on the rear of the cab.
00:01:14.770 --> 00:01:19.780
To turn them on and off from inside the
cab, just press the box lighting button, here.
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:22.760
After ten minutes they
will turn off gradually.

question: When you have activated the box lighting feature, how many minutes will they remain on?

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:00:39.684 --> 00:00:43.216
The jack handle and lug wrench are located
in a storage compartment in the side of
00:00:43.216 --> 00:00:46.160
the passenger seat base, by the step well.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:49.460
Just put your fingers under
the two slots and pull it open.
00:00:49.460 --> 00:00:52.100
The six-piece jack handle
is inside a pouch,
00:00:52.100 --> 00:00:54.360
simply unsnap the three
straps to remove it.
00:00:55.560 --> 00:00:59.872
Now assemble the jack handle by inserting
the male end with the locking button into
00:00:59.872 --> 00:01:03.017
the tube, making sure it lines up and
snaps into position.
00:01:03.017 --> 00:01:05.545
Do the same with the remaining pieces.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg3.mp4
question: What is the procedure for assembling the jack handle?

video_name: SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek
video_trans:
00:01:04.590 --> 00:01:07.780
Using the navigation system
has also been simplified, so
00:01:07.780 --> 00:01:12.750
finding your nearest favorite coffee shop,
ATM, or any other popular destination
00:01:12.750 --> 00:01:17.580
can now be done quickly, thanks to
condensed destination entry functionality.
00:01:17.580 --> 00:01:21.530
Plus SYNC 3 remembers what you searched,
like coffee shops and
00:01:21.530 --> 00:01:23.200
saves it in its memory.
00:01:23.200 --> 00:01:26.820
So the next time you search for
a coffee shop, it'll remember and preload
00:01:26.820 --> 00:01:30.800
POI search results based on the letters
you type and show you the closest one.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek_seg4.mp4
question: Does the unit save your search results?

your interior illumination,
00:01:09.450 --> 00:01:12.920
meaning how bright your instrument
lights are, just press the plus or
00:01:12.920 --> 00:01:15.720
minus controls next to
the auto lamp controls.

video_name: One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk
video_trans:
00:00:56.930 --> 00:01:00.210
Keep in mind, if you continuously open and
close your windows in a short period of
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:04.370
time, it may cause your window
to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:04.370 --> 00:01:08.270
Also, if you press the window switch
quickly from the first to second position,
00:01:08.270 --> 00:01:11.180
it can cause your window
to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:11.180 --> 00:01:14.977
If this happens, release the switch,
wait a moment, then press it again.
00:01:14.977 --> 00:01:18.983
And remember, touching the switch at
all while the window is opening or
00:01:18.983 --> 00:01:20.270
closing will stop it.
00:01:21.640 --> 00:01:22.260
Any questions?

There are a few convenient ways to gain

00:00:08.658 --> 00:00:09.600

00:00:09.600 --> 00:00:11.210

00:00:11.210 --> 00:00:14.360

the trunk release button on the lower left
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.520

steering column to unlatch the rear deck lid.
00:00:18.520 --> 00:00:20.230
With the standard Intelligent Access,
00:00:20.230 --> 00:00:24.120

without reaching for your key fob.
00:00:24.120 --> 00:00:25.320
With your key fob on you,
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:29.350
just press the trunk release button
located above the license plate here.
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:32.071
It's that simple.
00:00:32.071 --> 00:00:33.095
Any questions?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:01:21.930 --> 00:01:26.230
Once plugged in and charging, the port
light will show the current charge status.
00:01:26.230 --> 00:01:30.020
When one bar is pulsing,
the charge is between 0 and 25%.
00:01:31.220 --> 00:01:34.017
One solid bar and
one pulsing bar is 25 to 50%.
00:01:34.017 --> 00:01:40.604
Two solids and one pulsing is 50 to 75%.
00:01:40.604 --> 00:01:44.169
Three solid and one pulsing is 75 to 100%.
00:01:45.300 --> 00:01:49.340
And when all four bars are solidly lit,
the charge is complete.
