video_name: Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA
video_trans:
00:00:11.960 --> 00:00:14.580
First, keep in mind that
convertible top fabric
00:00:14.580 --> 00:00:16.710
does not promote mildew growth itself.
00:00:16.710 --> 00:00:20.705
Mildew may develop on dirt or
other foreign substances if not removed.
00:00:20.705 --> 00:00:25.090
So keeping the fabric clean through
regular washings will enhance the life and
00:00:25.090 --> 00:00:26.696
beauty of the top material.
00:00:26.696 --> 00:00:29.595
When washing vehicles
with cloth top roofs.
00:00:29.595 --> 00:00:33.012
Start by vacuuming with a soft
bristle brush attachment and
00:00:33.012 --> 00:00:35.070
be sure to use a non detergent soap.
00:00:35.070 --> 00:00:40.925
Scrub gently in a circular pattern using
a terrycloth towel or soft bristle brush.
00:00:40.925 --> 00:00:44.030
More specifically horse hair or
soft nylon.
00:00:44.030 --> 00:00:45.950
Do not use stiff bristle brushes or
00:00:45.950 --> 00:00:49.420
any abrasive materials or
cleaners as they can damage the fabric.
00:00:50.840 --> 00:00:54.760
When finished, rinse thoroughly
removing all soap residues.
00:00:54.760 --> 00:00:59.040
Allow the top to air dry completely
before folding it otherwise, mold or
00:00:59.040 --> 00:01:02.340
mildew may develop and
discolor the cloth material.
00:01:02.340 --> 00:01:07.090
To clean away lint debris like cottonwood,
use a standard clothes lint roller or
00:01:07.090 --> 00:01:09.320
a vacuum attachment with
a soft bristle brush.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA_seg2.mp4
question: What type of motion should you use to clean the convertible top?

video_trans:

00:01:53.520 --> 00:01:57.720

driving with frequent turns and stops.
00:01:57.720 --> 00:02:01.630

00:02:01.630 --> 00:02:05.360

video_name: Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo
video_trans:
00:00:23.690 --> 00:00:29.339
To use line lock, using the five-way
switch scroll down to Track Apps.
00:00:29.339 --> 00:00:31.210
And select Line Lock from the menu.
00:00:31.210 --> 00:00:33.860
There are two steps to using Line Lock.
00:00:33.860 --> 00:00:36.660
This step verifies the driver and
car are ready.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:38.670
Simply follow the prompts on the screen.
00:00:38.670 --> 00:00:41.130
If you're unable to select Line Lock,
00:00:41.130 --> 00:00:43.570
check to be sure you're driving
under 25 miles an hour,
00:00:43.570 --> 00:00:49.060
the vehicle is on a level surface, and
you're not in another driving mode.
00:00:49.060 --> 00:00:54.370
To engage, firmly press and hold the
brakes, press OK on the steering wheel,
00:00:54.370 --> 00:00:57.980
remove your foot from the brake pedal,
and hit the accelerator.
00:00:57.980 --> 00:01:02.422
A 15 second countdown timer will
show the remaining time left before
00:01:02.422 --> 00:01:03.785
Line Lock shuts off.
00:01:03.785 --> 00:01:06.480
[MUSIC]
00:01:06.480 --> 00:01:10.670
You can always manually cancel it
by pressing the OK button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo_seg2.mp4
question: How long is the feature activated for?

video_name: SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek
video_trans:
00:01:04.590 --> 00:01:07.780
Using the navigation system
has also been simplified, so
00:01:07.780 --> 00:01:12.750
finding your nearest favorite coffee shop,
ATM, or any other popular destination
00:01:12.750 --> 00:01:17.580
can now be done quickly, thanks to
condensed destination entry functionality.
00:01:17.580 --> 00:01:21.530
Plus SYNC 3 remembers what you searched,
like coffee shops and
00:01:21.530 --> 00:01:23.200
saves it in its memory.
00:01:23.200 --> 00:01:26.820
So the next time you search for
a coffee shop, it'll remember and preload
00:01:26.820 --> 00:01:30.800
POI search results based on the letters
you type and show you the closest one.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek_seg4.mp4
question: How easy is to use the navigation system?

video_name: Automatic Headlamps With Wiper-Activated Headlamp Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-FOL9B-e2Oz8
video_trans:
00:00:45.461 --> 00:00:48.467
Of course, if you don't want your
lights to stay on that long,
00:00:48.467 --> 00:00:51.260
you could always change the duration.
00:00:51.260 --> 00:00:55.306
Just go to the message center,
scroll to Settings, Lightning and
00:00:55.306 --> 00:00:56.687
then Autolamp Delay.
00:00:56.687 --> 00:01:00.422
Here you can select the length of
time you want them to stay on for.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Automatic Headlamps With Wiper-Activated Headlamp Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-FOL9B-e2Oz8_seg4.mp4
question: How do you select the length of time you want your lights to stay on for?

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
00:01:04.600 --> 00:01:08.660
For even more cargo room,
you can also remove the seats completely.
00:01:08.660 --> 00:01:12.770
To do so, just follow the same steps
you used to tumble them forward.
00:01:12.770 --> 00:01:15.530
Then grab the yellow release
lever underneath the seat bottom,
00:01:15.530 --> 00:01:18.820
pull up to unlock it from the floor
mounts, then lift them out.
00:01:20.320 --> 00:01:21.098
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg3.mp4
question: What is the purpose of removing the seats?

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:00:46.610 --> 00:00:49.360
To adjust the recline of
the second row seat backs,
00:00:49.360 --> 00:00:52.610
pull up on the handle on the side
of the seat closest to the door.
00:00:52.610 --> 00:00:56.180
And push the seat back back for
a greater recline, or forward for
00:00:56.180 --> 00:00:57.560
a more upright position.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM_seg4.mp4
question: How doi get the seat back upright?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:18.866 --> 00:02:23.348
To switch between adaptive cruise control
or normal cruise use the 5-way switch on
00:02:23.348 --> 00:02:26.134
your steering wheel and
the information displays.
00:02:26.134 --> 00:02:30.544
Select Driver Assist, Cruise Control,
then select Adaptive to enable,
00:02:30.544 --> 00:02:33.847
or in Normal for
a conventional cruise control system.
00:02:33.847 --> 00:02:36.399
Meaning, it will not
automatically adjust speed,
00:02:36.399 --> 00:02:38.782
based on the speed of
the vehicle in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg9.mp4
question: What happens when you select normal?

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:00:14.754 --> 00:00:18.435
First, let's talk about how to
jump your battery if it dies.
00:00:18.435 --> 00:00:20.783
Open the engine hood by
pulling on the hood
00:00:20.783 --> 00:00:24.981
release located under the storage bin
next to the driver's side door, here.
00:00:24.981 --> 00:00:29.100
The battery jump box is located on the
driver's side of the engine compartment.
00:00:29.100 --> 00:00:33.072
Lift up the red access panel to
expose the positive battery post, and
00:00:33.072 --> 00:00:36.029
attach the positive end of
your jumper cable to it.
00:00:36.029 --> 00:00:38.537
Now, connect the negative
end to the ground,
00:00:38.537 --> 00:00:41.765
located on the inside of
the driver's side fender, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the battery in this vehicle and is there anything I should know about the positive and negative battery terminals or so I connect the negative jumper cable to a ground instead of the negative post of the battery?

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:00:30.510 --> 00:00:34.670
You can also see your towing status, as
well as towing information like whether or
00:00:34.670 --> 00:00:37.703
not your trailer is connected and
a connection checklist.
00:00:37.703 --> 00:00:40.790
You can also access gain,
pitch, steering angle and
00:00:40.790 --> 00:00:44.950
trailer information for
up to ten trailers under the towing tab.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg3.mp4
question: What towing informaiton can you access from your dashboard?

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:00:41.960 --> 00:00:43.760
If you turn the trailer to the right,
00:00:43.760 --> 00:00:47.240
you'll see the right side of your
vehicle and trailer and vice versa.
00:00:47.240 --> 00:00:51.480
You can switch views manually at
any time by using the arrow keys.
00:00:51.480 --> 00:00:57.820
Either full driver, partial driver, 50-50,
partial passenger or full passenger.
00:00:58.990 --> 00:01:01.740
Pressing the Camera icon takes
you to Normal Rear View,
00:01:01.740 --> 00:01:05.160
which allows you to see your trailer hitch
or what is directly behind your truck.
00:01:06.850 --> 00:01:10.340
Pressing the Plus button zooms in,
pressing the Return or
00:01:10.340 --> 00:01:14.610
Back button takes you back to
the 360 degree camera system.
00:01:14.610 --> 00:01:16.650
And Auto returns you to
Automatic View Mode.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA_seg3.mp4
question: Which button do I press on the touchscreen to let me see the rear view?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:00:37.235 --> 00:00:40.425
You can also drive your car if
it's been started remotely.
00:00:40.425 --> 00:00:43.815
With the car already running,
just press the brake and
00:00:43.815 --> 00:00:48.110
push the ENGINE START STOP button or
turn the key and you're ready to drive.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg3.mp4
question: IF CAR IS NOT ALREADY RUNNING HOW DO YOU START IT.

video_name: SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek
video_trans:
00:00:45.740 --> 00:00:49.720
Also new to SYNC 3 is simplified
voice commands, that make controlling
00:00:49.720 --> 00:00:53.700
certain features quick and easy without
having to go through multiple steps.
00:00:53.700 --> 00:00:56.390
For instance,
if you're listening to the radio and
00:00:56.390 --> 00:01:00.070
want to change to listening to your
media device, use the voice button and
00:01:00.070 --> 00:01:03.320
say, play song I am alive, for example.
00:01:03.320 --> 00:01:04.590
It's that easy.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek_seg3.mp4
question: Does the car accept voice commands to control certain features?

video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:01:13.142 --> 00:01:18.280
To turn Auto Unlock on or off, follow
the steps to enter the programming mode.
00:01:18.280 --> 00:01:21.570
Then press the door lock button and
then the door unlock button.
00:01:21.570 --> 00:01:25.338
The horn will chirp once,
if Auto Unlock was turned off.
00:01:25.338 --> 00:01:31.646
Or twice [NOISE], one short chirp and one
long chirp, if Auto Unlock was turned on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM_seg5.mp4
question: What is the maximum speed of the car?

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:00:18.830 --> 00:00:19.730
To access it,
00:00:19.730 --> 00:00:24.040
from the home screen touch Apps on your
SYNC 3 touch screen, then Power Flow.
00:00:25.080 --> 00:00:26.710
The power flow screen will appear and
00:00:26.710 --> 00:00:29.240
you'll see your vehicles
current operating status.
00:00:29.240 --> 00:00:36.020
Either idle, hybrid drive, electric
drive or charging high voltage battery.
00:00:36.020 --> 00:00:38.620
Now depending on which status
you're currently running in
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:41.320
such as electric drive mode
when the engine is off
00:00:41.320 --> 00:00:45.730
you'll see a blue power flow path
indicating which components are in use.
00:00:45.730 --> 00:00:49.360
In this case power from the battery
is being used for accessories like
00:00:49.360 --> 00:00:54.060
the climate control, high voltage electric
heater or air conditioning compressor and
00:00:54.060 --> 00:00:58.500
other low voltage accessories such
as the radio, fans or heated seats.
00:00:58.500 --> 00:01:01.090
You'll also notice power
flowing to the electric motor
00:01:01.090 --> 00:01:02.720
which is driving the wheels.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg2.mp4
question: How do I get to the power flow menu?

video_name: Dynamic Hitch Assist _ Ford How-To _ Ford-JgPTe-ZM9sk
video_trans:
00:00:10.139 --> 00:00:14.473
Dynamic Hitch Assist is part of the rear
view camera system on your truck.
00:00:14.473 --> 00:00:17.767
It helps you line up the center of the
truck to your trailer from inside using
00:00:17.767 --> 00:00:20.606
a black dotted line that moves
when you move the steering wheel.
00:00:20.606 --> 00:00:24.800
The black line is displayed on
your eight inch LCD touchscreen.
00:00:24.800 --> 00:00:27.165
Because you can see the exact
angle of your truck and
00:00:27.165 --> 00:00:31.015
trailer the whole time you're backing up,
you can line up your truck's hitch with
00:00:31.015 --> 00:00:34.454
the trailer without a spotter and
without getting out of your truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Dynamic Hitch Assist _ Ford How-To _ Ford-JgPTe-ZM9sk_seg2.mp4
question: where is the black dotted line display?

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:00:33.340 --> 00:00:35.100
If a collision risk with the vehicle or
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:38.790
a pedestrian is detected,
it provides a warning to the driver.
00:00:38.790 --> 00:00:42.480
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield.
00:00:42.480 --> 00:00:43.580
A warning chime will sound.
00:00:43.580 --> 00:00:47.420
And a warning message will appear
in your information list this way.
00:00:47.420 --> 00:00:50.640
If you do not reactive and continue
to get closer to the pedestrians or
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:55.440
other vehicles after the alert, the system
precharges the brakes and if needed,
00:00:55.440 --> 00:01:00.050
can automatically apply full braking force
which may help produce the survorarity or
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:02.570
even eliminate certain frontal collisions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg3.mp4
question: Does the car self-break when a collision is detected?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:01:13.290 --> 00:01:17.170
And to help give you control of how long
your car stays running, you can program
00:01:17.170 --> 00:01:21.910
your engine to run in five, ten, or
15 minute intervals using the five way
00:01:21.910 --> 00:01:26.300
steering wheel controls on the left side
to navigate through the settings menu.
00:01:26.300 --> 00:01:28.010
And if you want some extra run time,
00:01:28.010 --> 00:01:31.820
you can repeat the remote
start process to extend it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg5.mp4
question: What 3 intervals can you program your car to keep it running?

video_name: Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI
video_trans:
00:01:22.550 --> 00:01:25.080
And Snow/Wet,
which gives you confident handling and
00:01:25.080 --> 00:01:28.870
a direct connection to the road in wet,
or snowy weather conditions.
00:01:28.870 --> 00:01:32.280
Keep in mind, the selectable driving
modes have diagnostic checks
00:01:32.280 --> 00:01:36.380
that continuously monitor the system
to ensure proper operation.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI_seg7.mp4
question: what is snow/wet mode used for?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.436
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.436 --> 00:00:08.110
Your vehicle may have a feature that
gives you a complete view all around it.
00:00:08.110 --> 00:00:11.970
Let me explain. The 360 degree
Camera with Split-view Display
00:00:11.970 --> 00:00:15.440
uses cameras mounted in the front grill,
tailgate handle, and
00:00:15.440 --> 00:00:18.590
side view mirrors to give you a continuous
view of everything around you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg1.mp4

video_name: SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw
video_trans:
00:00:18.140 --> 00:00:21.010
To start, go to the Settings
menu on the touch screen.
00:00:21.010 --> 00:00:23.690
It's the one that looks like gears, here.
00:00:23.690 --> 00:00:27.230
From here, you could personalize
several of your SYNC 3 features.
00:00:27.230 --> 00:00:31.040
You can set the clock by touching the
Clock tile as well as set automatic time
00:00:31.040 --> 00:00:34.790
zone updates, which adjusts the clock to
match the time zone you're driving in.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw_seg2.mp4
question: How to set automatic time zone updates?

video_name: Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI
video_trans:
00:00:09.330 --> 00:00:13.670
Let me explain. Selectable Driving Mode
instantly modifies the electronic
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:17.230
stability control system and traction
control, which help maintain your vehicle's
00:00:17.230 --> 00:00:20.170
command of the road in poor conditions,
or high performance driving.
00:00:21.280 --> 00:00:24.220
It also enhances throttle response for
quick acceleration,
00:00:24.220 --> 00:00:29.170
crisper transmission shift points,
and finally steering effort and feel.
00:00:29.170 --> 00:00:32.270
Together the selectable driving
mounts automatically tailor your
00:00:32.270 --> 00:00:35.290
vehicles performance to
the mode you've selected.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI_seg2.mp4
question: What are selectable driving modes?

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:01:18.930 --> 00:01:22.610
Keep in mind, to help remind you when
power is flowing through the switch,
00:01:22.610 --> 00:01:24.700
it will remain illuminated
to let you know it's on.
00:01:25.880 --> 00:01:26.658
Any questions?
00:01:26.658 --> 00:01:28.720
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:01:28.720 --> 00:01:38.720
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg5.mp4
question: How will I know if power is flowing through the switch?

video_name: USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c
video_trans:
00:00:25.360 --> 00:00:29.640
Unlike traditional USB charging ports
that provide 500 milliamps of power and
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:31.060
can only charge a smartphone or
00:00:31.060 --> 00:00:35.260
media player, smart USB chargers can
provide up to two amps, and know just
00:00:35.260 --> 00:00:38.080
the right amount of power to deliver
to whatever device you're charging.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.743
Meaning, if you have one device plugged
in that needs two amps to charge, and
00:00:42.743 --> 00:00:46.255
another plugged in at the same time
that only needs one amp to fully charge,
00:00:46.255 --> 00:00:49.029
your smart USB port will deliver
the right amount to both.
00:00:49.029 --> 00:00:52.292
And that can help save battery power for
your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c_seg3.mp4
question: how to save battery power on the vehicle?

video_name: SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q
video_trans:
00:00:32.214 --> 00:00:35.677
Speaking of codes, your keypad comes
with one that's preprogrammed.
00:00:35.677 --> 00:00:39.395
Just enter that five digit code
to unlock the driver's door.
00:00:39.395 --> 00:00:42.880
Then press 3 4 to unlock all the doors.
00:00:42.880 --> 00:00:46.016
To pop your trunk or
your manual lift gate, enter the code.
00:00:46.016 --> 00:00:48.168
Then press 5-6.
00:00:48.168 --> 00:00:53.185
To lock all of your doors,
press 7-8 and 9-0 at the same time.
00:00:53.185 --> 00:00:54.032
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q_seg3.mp4
question: How do you use the code feature on this vehicle to open all the doors?

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:29.510 --> 00:00:32.320
Electric range is the estimated
distance you can travel
00:00:32.320 --> 00:00:35.280
while in plug-in power
mode with the engine off.
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:38.180
This range is based on
calculations determined by
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:43.090
the amount of energy stored in the battery
and the energy being used while driving.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg2.mp4
question: How is the electric range determined?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:58.497 --> 00:01:01.470
Now, let's talk about Cross-Traffic alert.
00:01:01.470 --> 00:01:05.650
It warns you of moving cars coming from
either side when you're in reverse or
00:01:05.650 --> 00:01:09.550
backing up and gives you three warnings,
a light on the corresponding
00:01:09.550 --> 00:01:13.470
side view mirror, a chime, and
a message in your message center.
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:16.970
Extreme weather conditions
could block the sensors, but
00:01:16.970 --> 00:01:20.370
if that happens, you'll get a warning
message and a chime to let you know.
00:01:20.370 --> 00:01:23.234
And keep in mind,
as with the most radar, infrared, and
00:01:23.234 --> 00:01:27.246
ultrasonic-type sensing system,
there is the possibility of false alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg4.mp4
question: Does the car automatically alert me if I get close to something?

video_name: Heated Mirrors _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DOQi4JZSeRQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.483
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.483 --> 00:00:07.630
How do I know if I have heated mirrors?
00:00:08.970 --> 00:00:10.330
>> How do I turn my heated mirrors on?
00:00:11.340 --> 00:00:14.300
>> Did you know that your vehicle may
have heated mirrors to help keep them
00:00:14.300 --> 00:00:15.790
clear in bad weather?
00:00:15.790 --> 00:00:18.080
You'll know you have them
if you see this icon.
00:00:18.080 --> 00:00:19.780
If you have power folding mirrors or
00:00:19.780 --> 00:00:23.600
Bliss, you'll still have heated mirrors
but you won't see the heated mirror icon.
00:00:23.600 --> 00:00:27.500
Instead, you'll either see this or this.

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:00:38.005 --> 00:00:41.420
To adjust the auto lamp time delay,
or how long your head lamps
00:00:41.420 --> 00:00:46.290
stay on after you've turned off your car,
use the information display controls.
00:00:46.290 --> 00:00:51.210
Press the down arrow to find settings,
then press OK and the right arrow.
00:00:51.210 --> 00:00:55.520
And scroll down to vehicle, or
convenience depending on your vehicle.
00:00:55.520 --> 00:00:59.370
Next, press the right arrow and
scroll to auto lamp delay.
00:00:59.370 --> 00:01:03.880
Press the right arrow again,
select off or the time delay you wish.
00:01:03.880 --> 00:01:05.350
Then press OK to set it.

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:00:12.858 --> 00:00:16.194
The jack is located under
the passenger seat. To get to it,
00:00:16.194 --> 00:00:18.530
simply move the seat all the way forward,
00:00:18.530 --> 00:00:22.937
using either the power control button
located on the side closest to the door,
00:00:22.937 --> 00:00:26.650
or the manual adjust seat bar
located under the front of the seat.
00:00:26.650 --> 00:00:29.475
Lift the cover panel by pulling up on it.
00:00:29.475 --> 00:00:33.807
It's held in position with Velcro, so
just give it a little tug.
00:00:33.807 --> 00:00:38.574
Now unstrap the jack by stretching
the rubber hold down strap and releasing,
00:00:38.574 --> 00:00:39.684
then lift it out.

question: What holds the jack in place under the seat?

00:00:18.140 --> 00:00:22.120

system, or TPMS, will display
00:00:22.120 --> 00:00:25.670

00:00:26.790 --> 00:00:27.623

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:11.045 --> 00:00:15.500
Lane-keeping system is made up
of two parts, Alert and Aid.
00:00:16.700 --> 00:00:18.860
The Alert mode lets you know if
you're drifting out of your lane.
00:00:19.928 --> 00:00:24.740
Using three short vibrations, it warns you
to steer your vehicle back into your lane.
00:00:24.740 --> 00:00:28.180
If you want to change the strength
of the vibration your car gives you,
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:31.245
you can adjust the intensity
setting in the message center.
00:00:31.245 --> 00:00:33.680
Lane-keeping will remember
the changes you make, so
00:00:33.680 --> 00:00:36.640
you won't have to reset it the next
time you turn on the system.

video_name: Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA
video_trans:
00:00:11.960 --> 00:00:14.580
First, keep in mind that
convertible top fabric
00:00:14.580 --> 00:00:16.710
does not promote mildew growth itself.
00:00:16.710 --> 00:00:20.705
Mildew may develop on dirt or
other foreign substances if not removed.
00:00:20.705 --> 00:00:25.090
So keeping the fabric clean through
regular washings will enhance the life and
00:00:25.090 --> 00:00:26.696
beauty of the top material.
00:00:26.696 --> 00:00:29.595
When washing vehicles
with cloth top roofs.
00:00:29.595 --> 00:00:33.012
Start by vacuuming with a soft
bristle brush attachment and
00:00:33.012 --> 00:00:35.070
be sure to use a non detergent soap.
00:00:35.070 --> 00:00:40.925
Scrub gently in a circular pattern using
a terrycloth towel or soft bristle brush.
00:00:40.925 --> 00:00:44.030
More specifically horse hair or
soft nylon.
00:00:44.030 --> 00:00:45.950
Do not use stiff bristle brushes or
00:00:45.950 --> 00:00:49.420
any abrasive materials or
cleaners as they can damage the fabric.
00:00:50.840 --> 00:00:54.760
When finished, rinse thoroughly
removing all soap residues.
00:00:54.760 --> 00:00:59.040
Allow the top to air dry completely
before folding it otherwise, mold or
00:00:59.040 --> 00:01:02.340
mildew may develop and
discolor the cloth material.
00:01:02.340 --> 00:01:07.090
To clean away lint debris like cottonwood,
use a standard clothes lint roller or
00:01:07.090 --> 00:01:09.320
a vacuum attachment with
a soft bristle brush.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA_seg2.mp4
question: Why should you wait for the top to dry completely before opening it?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:01:09.710 --> 00:01:12.960
And finally, to extend the life
of the bright chrome grill and
00:01:12.960 --> 00:01:17.600
other exterior trim parts, wax all
finishes regularly, especially before and
00:01:17.600 --> 00:01:19.050
after the winter season.
00:01:19.050 --> 00:01:22.100
Polishing and waxing can
maintain the finishes luster and
00:01:22.100 --> 00:01:24.580
help eliminate the occurrence
of rust spots.
00:01:24.580 --> 00:01:28.740
For best results, wipe residue off
using a microfiber detailing cloth and
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:30.530
following product directions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg4.mp4
question: How do you extend the life of the car components?

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.963
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.963 --> 00:00:06.130
Why do my headlamps automatically turn on?
00:00:07.520 --> 00:00:09.500
>> How do I get my headlamps
to turn on automatically?
00:00:10.530 --> 00:00:14.620
>> Your vehicle may be equipped with
automatic headlamps, or autolamp.
00:00:14.620 --> 00:00:18.610
It's easy to tell, just look for
this icon on your headlamp controls.
00:00:18.610 --> 00:00:22.530
Your headlamps will automatically turn
on when ambient light levels are low, or
00:00:22.530 --> 00:00:23.630
when natural light decreases.

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:01:39.921 --> 00:01:44.632
Adaptive steering helps reduce under steer
at higher speeds, while allowing the front
00:01:44.660 --> 00:01:48.720
wheels to turn fully with fewer turns
of the steering wheel at lower speeds.
00:01:48.720 --> 00:01:51.640
And when used with tow haul
the vehicle delays upshifts and
00:01:51.646 --> 00:01:55.359
provides engine breaking when descending
hilly roads with heavy loads.
00:01:55.359 --> 00:01:56.568
[MUSIC]

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:01:40.420 --> 00:01:44.360
As you turn the wheel,
you'll see two zones, yellow and red.
00:01:44.360 --> 00:01:48.630
Yellow being a caution alert that warns
you of a potential jackknife position.
00:01:48.630 --> 00:01:52.160
And red signaling that you need to stop,
pull forward, and
00:01:52.160 --> 00:01:55.610
put the truck and
trailer back into an inline position.
00:01:55.610 --> 00:01:59.550
One more thing, when using the Straight
Backup mode, a steering wheel graphic
00:01:59.550 --> 00:02:02.920
shows you which way to turn your steering
wheel to keep your trailer straight.
00:02:03.990 --> 00:02:05.060
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA_seg5.mp4
question: Will the monitor advise me on how to turn the steering wheel when I'm backing up my trailer?

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
00:00:42.860 --> 00:00:46.486
However, if your light flashes rapidly and
then turns to a constant light,
00:00:46.486 --> 00:00:49.273
you're not done yet and
will have to take few extra steps.
00:00:49.273 --> 00:00:50.899
[MUSIC]
00:00:50.899 --> 00:00:52.750
Don't worry, I'll walk you through them.
00:00:52.750 --> 00:00:55.032
You'll need to complete the next
few steps in 30 seconds, so
00:00:55.032 --> 00:00:57.542
you might want to have someone help
you if you think it would be easier.
00:00:57.542 --> 00:00:59.260
[MUSIC]
00:00:59.260 --> 00:01:03.500
First, press and hold the learn button
on your garage door opener motor, here.
00:01:04.900 --> 00:01:07.170
Next, get back in your car and press and
00:01:07.170 --> 00:01:11.360
hold the selected function button on your
HomeLink for two seconds then release it.
00:01:11.360 --> 00:01:14.500
Then press and hold it for
two seconds again and release it.

video_name: Trailer Tire Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-lcsygGhXqk0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.259
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.259 --> 00:00:07.200
Did you know that you can equip
a trailer with a feature that allows
00:00:07.200 --> 00:00:09.876
your vehicle to monitor and
provide a warning if the tires of
00:00:09.876 --> 00:00:13.350
a trailer that you're towing
are significantly underinflated?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:14.850
Let me explain.
00:00:14.850 --> 00:00:18.140
If one or more tires of a connected
trailer become underinflated,
00:00:18.140 --> 00:00:22.120
the trailer tire pressure monitoring
system, or TPMS, will display
00:00:22.120 --> 00:00:25.670
a pop-up warning in your instrument
display indicating which tire is low.
00:00:26.790 --> 00:00:27.623
Any questions?
00:00:27.623 --> 00:00:29.513
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:29.513 --> 00:00:39.513
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Tire Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-lcsygGhXqk0_seg1.mp4
question: What does the abbreviation TPMS stand for?

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:45.230 --> 00:00:47.680
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:47.680 --> 00:00:52.470
you'll want to have the trailer screen up
on your LCD productivity screen, here.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:54.840
To get there, go to Truck Apps,
00:00:54.840 --> 00:00:57.930
then push the right arrow twice
until you see the trailer display.
00:00:58.940 --> 00:01:03.460
Unless a trailer is connected, the display
will read, Trailer Disconnected.
00:01:03.460 --> 00:01:06.740
As soon as a trailer is connected,
you'll see this message.
00:01:06.740 --> 00:01:08.100
Press OK.
00:01:08.100 --> 00:01:12.680
Once the trailer connected message
goes away, you'll see gain setting.
00:01:12.680 --> 00:01:16.370
This is what we talked about earlier, and
a bar graph that lights up to show you
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:19.390
the amount of power going
to the trailer brakes.
00:01:19.390 --> 00:01:23.960
From the trailer display, press OK, and
choose the Connection Checklist option.
00:01:25.110 --> 00:01:27.640
It corresponds to
different trailer types and
00:01:27.640 --> 00:01:32.160
walks you through the connection process
to remind you of the necessary steps.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg3.mp4
question: How to set up possible different trailer options?

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:01:06.450 --> 00:01:10.310
If at any time the battery in your remote
dies or the signal is interrupted,
00:01:10.310 --> 00:01:14.320
you can use the removable key
inside to unlock the driver's door.
00:01:14.320 --> 00:01:16.110
Just press the button and
slide the key out.
00:01:17.180 --> 00:01:19.920
Next, insert the key into the slot located
00:01:19.920 --> 00:01:22.440
underneath the rear of
the driver's door handle and
00:01:22.440 --> 00:01:26.320
push up until you feel the internal
tab flex and unlock the plastic bezel.
00:01:27.520 --> 00:01:30.560
Slide the bezel back to
completely remove it.
00:01:30.560 --> 00:01:35.220
When you do, you'll be able to access
the key cylinder and unlock your door.
00:01:35.220 --> 00:01:36.350
To replace the bezel,
00:01:36.350 --> 00:01:39.410
slide it forward until you feel
it snap into the locked position.
00:01:40.650 --> 00:01:44.537
Once you're in, there's a pocket in the
center console made just for the key fob.
00:01:44.537 --> 00:01:46.680
It'll allow you to start your car.
00:01:46.680 --> 00:01:49.860
Place the key fob in the slot
with the button's facing up and
00:01:49.860 --> 00:01:52.810
the unlock button towards
the front of the vehicle.
00:01:52.810 --> 00:01:56.695
Keep in mind, because the key is
programmed to your car, if you lose it,
00:01:56.695 --> 00:01:59.050
you'll need to contact your dealer for
a replacement.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c_seg6.mp4
question: Can you still start your car without the original keys?

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:25.550 --> 00:00:28.610
You'll know if your child's seat can
be used with the LATCH system if it has
00:00:28.610 --> 00:00:33.220
either two rigid attachments with metal
connectors, or two flexible straps
00:00:33.220 --> 00:00:37.200
with metal hooks that can be connected
to the lower anchors in your seat.
00:00:37.200 --> 00:00:40.490
And if it has a belt strap with a metal
clip that's attached to the top back
00:00:40.490 --> 00:00:42.030
portion of the seat.
00:00:42.030 --> 00:00:43.180
Still with me?
00:00:43.180 --> 00:00:44.190
Great.

video_name: Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.090 --> 00:00:06.099
[MUSIC]
00:00:06.099 --> 00:00:10.110
Your vehicle may be equipped with
inflatable rear outboard safety belts.
00:00:10.110 --> 00:00:13.222
They work similarly to standard
belts in everyday use.
00:00:13.222 --> 00:00:16.254
But in the event of an accident
they work a little differently.
00:00:16.254 --> 00:00:17.647
Let me explain.
00:00:17.647 --> 00:00:22.222
Unlike a standard safety belt the
inflatable outboard rear safety belt uses
00:00:22.222 --> 00:00:23.303
two retractors.
00:00:23.303 --> 00:00:25.981
One for your torso and one for your lap.
00:00:25.981 --> 00:00:30.081
To fasten it, just grab the tongue, that's
the part that connects the torso and
00:00:30.081 --> 00:00:30.820
lap portion.
00:00:30.820 --> 00:00:36.081
Pull the entire belt over your body at the
same time, then latch it into the buckle.
00:00:36.081 --> 00:00:39.196
Make sure to insert the tongue in
a straight-in motion to the buckle.
00:00:39.196 --> 00:00:42.434
This will help ensure
the inflation mechanism lines up.
00:00:42.434 --> 00:00:44.869
And that it inflates properly if needed.
00:00:44.869 --> 00:00:49.316
If you're in an accident, the crash system
in your vehicle will determine when, and
00:00:49.316 --> 00:00:52.176
if, the inflatable rear
safety belts should deploy.
00:00:52.176 --> 00:00:56.496
If they're needed, the air bags will
inflate with cold, compressed gas and
00:00:56.496 --> 00:01:01.149
expand across the passengers' bodies to
distribute the forces from the crash over
00:01:01.149 --> 00:01:03.551
a larger area to reduce
the risk of injury.
00:01:03.551 --> 00:01:04.604
Any questions?
00:01:04.604 --> 00:01:06.484
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:06.484 --> 00:01:16.484
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc_seg1.mp4
question: how many retractors are in the seat belts?

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:00:33.340 --> 00:00:35.100
If a collision risk with the vehicle or
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:38.790
a pedestrian is detected,
it provides a warning to the driver.
00:00:38.790 --> 00:00:42.480
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield.
00:00:42.480 --> 00:00:43.580
A warning chime will sound.
00:00:43.580 --> 00:00:47.420
And a warning message will appear
in your information list this way.
00:00:47.420 --> 00:00:50.640
If you do not reactive and continue
to get closer to the pedestrians or
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:55.440
other vehicles after the alert, the system
precharges the brakes and if needed,
00:00:55.440 --> 00:01:00.050
can automatically apply full braking force
which may help produce the survorarity or
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:02.570
even eliminate certain frontal collisions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg3.mp4
question: When will a warning be provided to the driver?

video_name: Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs
video_trans:
00:00:45.570 --> 00:00:48.950
There are a few things that you may
need to know to prevent damaging them.
00:00:48.950 --> 00:00:51.430
Before you put a jack
underneath your vehicle,
00:00:51.430 --> 00:00:54.790
you'll need to ensure that the power
running boards are turned off.
00:00:54.790 --> 00:00:58.400
Also, when using a jack,
be sure to check your owner's manual for
00:00:58.400 --> 00:01:00.440
proper mounting locations.
00:01:00.440 --> 00:01:04.510
And when using a hoist lift be sure to
place the lift arms under the frame rails
00:01:04.510 --> 00:01:09.130
at all times to avoid damage to the under
body and running board components.
00:01:09.130 --> 00:01:10.250
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs_seg4.mp4
question: What do you need to check to ensure proper placement before you place a jack?

To deactivate,
press the button again one time.
00:00:53.260 --> 00:00:57.260
The indicator light will turn off and
return you back to Normal driving mode.
00:00:57.261 --> 00:00:58.331
Any questions?

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:13.790 --> 00:00:16.520
Brake Coach works to help you
maximize the amount of energy
00:00:16.520 --> 00:00:19.350
captured through your
regenerative braking system.
00:00:19.350 --> 00:00:21.910
Regenerative braking works with
your standard brake system by
00:00:21.910 --> 00:00:25.170
recovering energy that is usually
lost through your friction brakes and
00:00:25.170 --> 00:00:27.350
engine drag during braking or coasting.
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.810
And then storing that recovered energy
in your battery to help maximize efficiency.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg2.mp4
question: How does regenerative braking work with normal braking system?

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:01:09.170 --> 00:01:13.070
To manually shift gears,
move your gear shift from D to M.
00:01:13.070 --> 00:01:15.820
Now, only your current gear will appear.
00:01:15.820 --> 00:01:19.590
And you can use the plus button to up
shift and the minus to down shift.
00:01:19.590 --> 00:01:23.690
Keep in mind, even though you're manually
changing gears, SelectShift will prevent
00:01:23.690 --> 00:01:28.510
some shifts if your engine speed is
too high or if your RPMs are too low.
00:01:28.510 --> 00:01:32.710
And if you come to a stop while in Manual
Mode, the transmission will automatically
00:01:32.710 --> 00:01:36.600
downshift to a lower gear for
easier acceleration when you drive away.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0_seg4.mp4
question: How to upshift and downshift the gears?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.070
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.070 --> 00:00:07.360
Did you know that you can open your
tailgate without using your hands?
00:00:07.360 --> 00:00:08.700
Let me explain.
00:00:08.700 --> 00:00:11.340
Push the tailgate release button
on your remote two times.
00:00:12.500 --> 00:00:16.220
The tailgate is dampened, which reduces
the speed that the tailgate lowers.
00:00:16.220 --> 00:00:20.280
So don't worry, it'll gradually come down
to a flat position without slamming.
00:00:20.280 --> 00:00:22.620
To close the tailgate,
push it up with both hands.
00:00:23.640 --> 00:00:24.610
You can also lock and
00:00:24.610 --> 00:00:27.740
unlock the tailgate using the lock or
unlock buttons on your remote.
00:00:28.980 --> 00:00:31.496
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:31.496 --> 00:00:41.496
[MUSIC]

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:00.980 --> 00:01:04.100
Okay, now I'll quickly discuss
the short strap mentioned earlier.
00:01:04.100 --> 00:01:07.460
To fold the second row seats from
the third row, pull the short strap, and
00:01:07.460 --> 00:01:09.980
the seat back will fold down forward.
00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:12.780
Next, pull the longer
strap to unlock the seat.
00:01:12.780 --> 00:01:15.490
Now, push the seat forward and down.
00:01:15.490 --> 00:01:18.690
Your vehicle also has folding floor
support panels that makes stowing
00:01:18.690 --> 00:01:20.150
cargo easier.
00:01:20.150 --> 00:01:20.910
With the second and
00:01:20.910 --> 00:01:25.670
third row seats folded down, grab hold of
the panels and pull to disconnect them.
00:01:25.670 --> 00:01:28.740
You may need to give them a little tug
to disengage them from their magnetic
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:29.850
fasteners.
00:01:29.850 --> 00:01:31.910
Then unfold like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg3.mp4

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:29.510 --> 00:00:32.320
Electric range is the estimated
distance you can travel
00:00:32.320 --> 00:00:35.280
while in plug-in power
mode with the engine off.
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:38.180
This range is based on
calculations determined by
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:43.090
the amount of energy stored in the battery
and the energy being used while driving.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg2.mp4
question: What is electric range based on?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:27.410 --> 00:00:29.194
When a vehicle enters into your left or
00:00:29.194 --> 00:00:32.561
right adjacent lane radar sensors in
the rear of the vehicle detect it.
00:00:32.561 --> 00:00:35.482
And BLIS warns you with a solid
light on the corresponding side
00:00:35.482 --> 00:00:39.060
view mirror when the vehicle
is within blind spot zone.
00:00:39.060 --> 00:00:41.860
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:43.250 --> 00:00:44.615
When you activate your turn signal,
00:00:44.615 --> 00:00:48.070
BLIS will give you a secondary flashing
light warning on the corresponding
00:00:48.070 --> 00:00:50.590
side view mirror when a vehicle's
within the blind spot zone.
00:00:51.854 --> 00:00:55.264
And remember, the system only
warns you of motorized vehicles,
00:00:55.264 --> 00:00:58.497
it does not detect bicycles,
pedestrians or other objects.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg3.mp4
question: Where is the indicator light located to notify you of other traffic?

video_name: Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI
video_trans:
00:00:16.330 --> 00:00:18.660
If your vehicle is equipped
with a manual transmission,
00:00:18.660 --> 00:00:22.950
be sure your vehicle is at a complete stop
before attempting to shift into reverse.
00:00:22.950 --> 00:00:26.670
Now, press the clutch pedal all
the way to the floor to disengage it.
00:00:26.670 --> 00:00:31.110
Then use your fingers to pull up on the
collar located below the gear shift knob,
00:00:31.110 --> 00:00:35.105
and move the gear shift lever all
the way to the left, then forward.
00:00:35.105 --> 00:00:39.315
Remember, the gear shift can only be moved
to reverse by raising the lock-out ring.
00:00:39.315 --> 00:00:42.525
It protects the transmission from
accidentally engaging reverse when you're
00:00:42.525 --> 00:00:44.679
intending to shift into first.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI_seg2.mp4
question: What is the proper way to use a stick shift?

back in to a parking perpendicular or
00:01:17.140 --> 00:01:19.240

00:01:19.240 --> 00:01:22.140
Just press the Active Park Assist
button two times.
00:01:22.140 --> 00:01:26.350
Signal to indicate which side you want to
park on, then simply follow the prompts
00:01:26.350 --> 00:01:30.560
displayed on your screen, accelerating,
shifting, and braking as needed.

video_name: Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0
video_trans:
00:00:14.740 --> 00:00:18.920
The forward collision warning with brake
support, uses a radar sensor to detect
00:00:18.920 --> 00:00:22.445
slower moving vehicles traveling
in the same direction as you and
00:00:22.445 --> 00:00:24.880
warns you if you're
rapidly approaching them.
00:00:24.880 --> 00:00:28.520
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield and
00:00:28.520 --> 00:00:30.110
the warning chime will sound.
00:00:30.110 --> 00:00:33.120
If you don't react after the alert and
continue to get closer to
00:00:33.120 --> 00:00:36.870
the other vehicle, the system will
pre-charge your breaks for rapid breaking.
00:00:36.870 --> 00:00:39.420
So, they can respond faster once
you do press your brake pedal.
00:00:40.470 --> 00:00:43.720
Once your brakes have been pre-charged,
even if you press them lightly,
00:00:43.720 --> 00:00:46.300
they'll apply full stopping
power to help stop you quickly.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0_seg2.mp4
question: When will the forward collision warning system precharge my brakes?

00:00:26.609 --> 00:00:29.641
You'll know it's locked when

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:13.870 --> 00:00:17.290
To maintain the appearance of
the bright chrome exterior finishes,
00:00:17.290 --> 00:00:19.620
regular cleaning is highly recommended.
00:00:19.620 --> 00:00:24.440
To clean, use water and a mild liquid
automotive soap from an auto supply store.
00:00:24.440 --> 00:00:28.590
Or a 50/50 solution of water and
white vinegar also works well.
00:00:28.590 --> 00:00:33.411
And remove all excess water as hard water
spots can deposit iron which can lead
00:00:33.411 --> 00:00:34.013
to rust.
00:00:34.013 --> 00:00:35.947
To remove tar and bugs from the grill,
00:00:35.947 --> 00:00:39.720
it's recommended to use
an oil-based bug and tar remover.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.220
In extreme winter climates, be sure
to rinse away salt residue as soon as
00:00:43.220 --> 00:00:47.070
possible as salt contains chlorides
that can damage the surface finish.
00:00:48.570 --> 00:00:51.750
Avoid all cleaning products that
contain ammonia, bleach, and
00:00:51.750 --> 00:00:54.600
alcohol as they may
also damage the finish.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg2.mp4
question: How do I care for my chrome elements?

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.183 --> 00:00:07.223
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.223 --> 00:00:10.453
The second row seats in your
Transit Connect wagon can be folded up or
00:00:10.453 --> 00:00:12.770
even removed for extra cargo space.
00:00:12.770 --> 00:00:14.480
Let me show you how to do it.
00:00:14.480 --> 00:00:16.400
To fold the second row seats forward,
00:00:16.400 --> 00:00:18.450
first push down the head
restraints like this.
00:00:19.530 --> 00:00:23.830
Now, find the strap located on the side
of the seat back closest to the door,
00:00:23.830 --> 00:00:26.260
here, and
pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:27.670 --> 00:00:32.380
Next, find the longer strap located in the
center of the backside of the seat back.
00:00:32.380 --> 00:00:35.610
Pull up to unlock it,
then lift the entire seat up to tumble it.
00:00:36.980 --> 00:00:39.820
Now, secure the seat by
locating the prop rod
00:00:39.820 --> 00:00:42.470
directly below the seat inside the floor.
00:00:42.470 --> 00:00:45.530
Lift it out and snap it onto
the prop rod latch, like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg1.mp4
question: How do I fold up the second row seats?

video_trans:

00:00:49.250 --> 00:00:53.440
there are some factors that affect the
amount of energy being used while driving.
00:00:53.440 --> 00:00:57.330
For instance, mild or
aggressive acceleration or braking,
00:00:57.330 --> 00:01:01.905
your vehicle's speed, how much you use
accessories, such as climate control.
00:01:01.905 --> 00:01:06.232
The ambient temperature and other weather
conditions, as well as whether you're
00:01:06.232 --> 00:01:09.335
driving in the city or
on the highway, and the road grades.
00:01:09.335 --> 00:01:10.463
Any questions?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:13.870 --> 00:00:17.290
To maintain the appearance of
the bright chrome exterior finishes,
00:00:17.290 --> 00:00:19.620
regular cleaning is highly recommended.
00:00:19.620 --> 00:00:24.440
To clean, use water and a mild liquid
automotive soap from an auto supply store.
00:00:24.440 --> 00:00:28.590
Or a 50/50 solution of water and
white vinegar also works well.
00:00:28.590 --> 00:00:33.411
And remove all excess water as hard water
spots can deposit iron which can lead
00:00:33.411 --> 00:00:34.013
to rust.
00:00:34.013 --> 00:00:35.947
To remove tar and bugs from the grill,
00:00:35.947 --> 00:00:39.720
it's recommended to use
an oil-based bug and tar remover.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.220
In extreme winter climates, be sure
to rinse away salt residue as soon as
00:00:43.220 --> 00:00:47.070
possible as salt contains chlorides
that can damage the surface finish.
00:00:48.570 --> 00:00:51.750
Avoid all cleaning products that
contain ammonia, bleach, and
00:00:51.750 --> 00:00:54.600
alcohol as they may
also damage the finish.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg2.mp4
question: How do you remove tar and bugs from the grill?

video_name: Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA
video_trans:
00:00:11.960 --> 00:00:14.580
First, keep in mind that
convertible top fabric
00:00:14.580 --> 00:00:16.710
does not promote mildew growth itself.
00:00:16.710 --> 00:00:20.705
Mildew may develop on dirt or
other foreign substances if not removed.
00:00:20.705 --> 00:00:25.090
So keeping the fabric clean through
regular washings will enhance the life and
00:00:25.090 --> 00:00:26.696
beauty of the top material.
00:00:26.696 --> 00:00:29.595
When washing vehicles
with cloth top roofs.
00:00:29.595 --> 00:00:33.012
Start by vacuuming with a soft
bristle brush attachment and
00:00:33.012 --> 00:00:35.070
be sure to use a non detergent soap.
00:00:35.070 --> 00:00:40.925
Scrub gently in a circular pattern using
a terrycloth towel or soft bristle brush.
00:00:40.925 --> 00:00:44.030
More specifically horse hair or
soft nylon.
00:00:44.030 --> 00:00:45.950
Do not use stiff bristle brushes or
00:00:45.950 --> 00:00:49.420
any abrasive materials or
cleaners as they can damage the fabric.
00:00:50.840 --> 00:00:54.760
When finished, rinse thoroughly
removing all soap residues.
00:00:54.760 --> 00:00:59.040
Allow the top to air dry completely
before folding it otherwise, mold or
00:00:59.040 --> 00:01:02.340
mildew may develop and
discolor the cloth material.
00:01:02.340 --> 00:01:07.090
To clean away lint debris like cottonwood,
use a standard clothes lint roller or
00:01:07.090 --> 00:01:09.320
a vacuum attachment with
a soft bristle brush.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA_seg2.mp4
question: What type of cleaning agent do i use for cleaning the soft top?

video_name: How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.323
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.323 --> 00:00:07.842
Did you know your vehicle may be equipped
with a convenient feature that helps make
00:00:07.842 --> 00:00:10.070
maneuvering a trailer in reverse easy?
00:00:10.070 --> 00:00:12.320
It's called Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:00:12.320 --> 00:00:13.590
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:13.590 --> 00:00:15.940
Whether you're backing
a trailer into a job site or
00:00:15.940 --> 00:00:20.930
launching a boat, if you can turn a knob,
you can now back up your trailer with ease.
00:00:20.930 --> 00:00:23.630
Which means, whichever direction
you want your trailer to go,
00:00:23.630 --> 00:00:27.640
just turn the knob in that direction and
the system will take over the steering,
00:00:27.640 --> 00:00:30.770
instead of having to turn the wheel
in the opposite direction.
00:00:30.770 --> 00:00:34.150
To use it, press the center button on
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist knob.
00:00:34.150 --> 00:00:36.660
A list of available trailers will appear.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:37.840
Choose the one you want and
00:00:37.840 --> 00:00:40.990
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
will attempt to locate it.
00:00:40.990 --> 00:00:44.010
Once the targeting sticker is
located by the rearview camera,
00:00:44.010 --> 00:00:47.170
the screen will prompt you to
shift into reverse to activate it.
00:00:47.170 --> 00:00:50.450
Then follow the prompts displayed
on the information screen.
00:00:50.450 --> 00:00:52.390
With your hands off the steering wheel,
00:00:52.390 --> 00:00:55.820
use the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
knob to steer the trailer.
00:00:55.820 --> 00:00:59.730
Turn the knob left, or counter-clockwise,
when you want the rear of the trailer to
00:00:59.730 --> 00:01:04.340
go to the left, and right,
clockwise, to go right.
00:01:04.340 --> 00:01:07.070
You should also make it a habit
to use your side view mirrors
00:01:07.070 --> 00:01:10.230
as your primary visual aid
while maneuvering the trailer.
00:01:10.230 --> 00:01:14.190
Once the trailer is moving in
the direction you want, release the knob.
00:01:14.190 --> 00:01:17.450
Keep in mind, you may need to make
small adjustments with the knob to
00:01:17.450 --> 00:01:20.060
keep the trailer moving
along the desired path.
00:01:20.060 --> 00:01:23.820
As soon as the knob is either released or
turned back to the center position,
00:01:23.820 --> 00:01:26.132
the vehicle will follow
the trailer's path.
00:01:26.132 --> 00:01:28.660
You'll need to control the accelerator and
brakes.
00:01:28.660 --> 00:01:29.712
Any questions?
00:01:29.712 --> 00:01:31.599
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:01:31.599 --> 00:01:41.599
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GZQFXF_db7g_seg1.mp4
question: How does the pro trailer backup assist work when reversing a trailer?

video_name: Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog
video_trans:
00:00:11.850 --> 00:00:15.020
To use the step, first lower the tailgate,
00:00:15.020 --> 00:00:18.950
then press the black release button in
the center of the step molding, here.
00:00:18.950 --> 00:00:20.470
The step will pop out a little, so
00:00:20.470 --> 00:00:23.360
just pull it all the way until it
gently falls into a lower position.
00:00:24.710 --> 00:00:27.860
Next, grab the yellow bar
top to the left of the step.
00:00:27.860 --> 00:00:30.410
Pull until the black bar
is fully extended and
00:00:30.410 --> 00:00:32.920
lift it up until it's locked into place.
00:00:32.920 --> 00:00:35.280
Then, pull the chrome interior
bar all of the way up.
00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:39.410
You'll know the bar is fully
extended when you hear a click.
00:00:39.410 --> 00:00:42.930
The bar can be used as a grab handle to
help pull yourself up into the truck bed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the step located?

video_name: Track Apps - Brake Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYBQURcQLFs
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.168
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.168 --> 00:00:07.829
Your Mustang has a feature that measures
the rate at which your car decelerates for
00:00:07.829 --> 00:00:10.130
an improved track experience.
00:00:10.130 --> 00:00:14.310
It's called Brake Performance, which
measures your stopping time and distance.
00:00:14.310 --> 00:00:17.500
To get to it, go to Track Apps
in your information display,
00:00:17.500 --> 00:00:19.590
scroll to Brake Performance, and press OK.
00:00:20.590 --> 00:00:26.490
Then choose whether you want to record
60 to 0, or 100 to 0, and hit OK.
00:00:26.490 --> 00:00:30.520
You'll then be instructed on how to
acquire your car's braking performance.
00:00:30.520 --> 00:00:34.660
First, you'll be instructed to
accelerate to or above the set speed.
00:00:34.660 --> 00:00:38.620
Once the speed has been reached,
it'll instruct you to hit the brakes.
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:40.748
Once you've come to a complete stop,
00:00:40.748 --> 00:00:44.815
your braking performance results will
be posted in the message center.
00:00:44.815 --> 00:00:45.870
Any questions?
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.022
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.022 --> 00:00:58.022
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Brake Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYBQURcQLFs_seg1.mp4
question: Where can I locate break performance in the menu?

video_name: How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.081 --> 00:00:03.902
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.902 --> 00:00:06.147
Your vehicle may be equipped
with power outlets,
00:00:06.147 --> 00:00:09.900
where you can charge devices like laptops,
rechargeable power tools, and more.
00:00:09.900 --> 00:00:12.030
Let me explain.
00:00:12.030 --> 00:00:14.190
There are two outlets in your vehicle.
00:00:14.190 --> 00:00:18.710
One in the instrument panel, here, and
one in the rear of the center console
00:00:18.710 --> 00:00:21.650
that is easily accessible for
someone in the back seat.
00:00:21.650 --> 00:00:25.510
The outlets can charge when your truck is
running ,and can deliver up to 400 watts
00:00:25.510 --> 00:00:29.650
when you're parked or idling, and
up to 300 watts when you're driving.
00:00:29.650 --> 00:00:33.970
Keep in mind, when using power tools,
the power outlets are only to be used for
00:00:33.970 --> 00:00:37.600
recharging and
should not be used as a main power source.
00:00:37.600 --> 00:00:38.303
Any questions?
00:00:38.303 --> 00:00:40.149
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:40.149 --> 00:00:50.149
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo_seg1.mp4
question: What is the max wattage that is available?

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
00:01:04.600 --> 00:01:08.660
For even more cargo room,
you can also remove the seats completely.
00:01:08.660 --> 00:01:12.770
To do so, just follow the same steps
you used to tumble them forward.
00:01:12.770 --> 00:01:15.530
Then grab the yellow release
lever underneath the seat bottom,
00:01:15.530 --> 00:01:18.820
pull up to unlock it from the floor
mounts, then lift them out.
00:01:20.320 --> 00:01:21.098
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg3.mp4
question: What is the procedure to remove the seats?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:22.880 --> 00:00:24.570
When ready to charge the vehicle,
00:00:24.570 --> 00:00:28.560
first be sure that the cord is
completely unwound to avoid overheating.
00:00:28.560 --> 00:00:33.250
And plug the AC plug into an AC outlet,
making sure to use a dedicated line that
00:00:33.250 --> 00:00:37.010
no other appliances are connected to,
to avoid tripping a circuit.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:40.910
Then, connect the charging coupler
to the charge port on the vehicle.
00:00:40.910 --> 00:00:43.410
You'll know it's properly attached
when you hear a click and
00:00:43.410 --> 00:00:44.760
the lock release button pops up.
00:00:45.830 --> 00:00:49.580
The FORD charge port LED lights
will flash in sequence two times,
00:00:49.580 --> 00:00:52.540
to confirm an electrical
connection has been made.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg3.mp4
question: How will you know the charging coupler is properly attached?

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:43.090 --> 00:00:45.920
Gasoline range is the estimated
distance to empty
00:00:45.920 --> 00:00:48.160
based on the fuel remaining in the tank.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg3.mp4
question: What is the gasoline range calculated based on?

video_trans:
00:00:29.470 --> 00:00:33.870
When you do, you'll notice the oil
pressure, engine temperature, fuel and
00:00:33.870 --> 00:00:37.630
transmission temperature gauges, are
always displayed at the top of the screen.
00:00:37.630 --> 00:00:40.590
Keep in mind, you can switch
the transmission temperature gauge,
00:00:40.590 --> 00:00:42.200
to display a turbo boost gauge.

video_trans:
00:00:42.200 --> 00:00:47.140
See my view, which automatically shows
you trip fuel information, truck info,
00:00:47.140 --> 00:00:49.820
towing and off road screens.
00:00:49.820 --> 00:00:53.450
You can also customize up to seven screens

00:00:53.450 --> 00:00:57.200

Your vehicle has a standard
cruise control function.

It's called ECO Cruise.

video_name: SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q
video_trans:
00:00:54.032 --> 00:00:56.484
If you want to change the factory
code to something that's easier for
00:00:56.484 --> 00:00:57.849
you to remember, you can do that too.
00:00:57.849 --> 00:00:58.848
[MUSIC]
00:00:58.848 --> 00:01:03.598
Just enter the factory code, press 1 2,
then enter your new code and
00:01:03.598 --> 00:01:07.478
your personal code will be
saved to position number one.
00:01:07.478 --> 00:01:10.699
If you're going to program
more than one code,
00:01:10.699 --> 00:01:14.725
press 1 2 after you entered
your first new code to save it,
00:01:14.725 --> 00:01:19.496
then enter a second personal code and
press3 4 to save it, and so on.

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:01:28.318 --> 00:01:30.480
The Search channels using voice command,
00:01:30.480 --> 00:01:32.680
use the voice button on your
steering wheel, wait for
00:01:32.680 --> 00:01:37.990
the beep then say browse Sirius, and
a full list of categories will appear.
00:01:37.990 --> 00:01:42.270
Touch the one you want to hear and once
you decide, touch the voice button and
00:01:42.270 --> 00:01:45.390
then say the channel number,
like, Sirius channel 36.
00:01:45.390 --> 00:01:50.290
Or you can use the Voice button and just
say the name or number of the channel,
00:01:50.290 --> 00:01:54.200
like ALT Nation, for example,
and it will tune to that channel.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg5.mp4
question: Where is the button for voice commands located?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:01:04.550 --> 00:01:07.340
Thereâ€™s also an option that
lets you skip channels or
00:01:07.340 --> 00:01:09.690
lock them out from young listeners.
00:01:09.690 --> 00:01:14.240
From the listing screen, anytime you touch
the skip button next to a specific channel
00:01:14.240 --> 00:01:18.680
or use the seek up and down buttons,
that channel will be automatically skipped
00:01:18.680 --> 00:01:22.640
when manually tuned using the tune up or
tune down buttons.
00:01:22.640 --> 00:01:25.220
Touching the lock button
followed by your PIN number
00:01:25.220 --> 00:01:28.318
will prevent that channel
from being listened to.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg4.mp4

video_name: Rear Folding Seats with Side Release and Folding Head Restraints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nTO2w5-8rIA
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.364
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.364 --> 00:00:09.020
Did you know that you can fold
the back seat down in your vehicle?
00:00:09.020 --> 00:00:10.590
Here's how to do it.
00:00:10.590 --> 00:00:13.670
First, fold the outside
head restraints down and
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:16.160
lower the center head restraint like this.
00:00:16.160 --> 00:00:20.830
Next, find the lever located on
the side of the seat base, here, and
00:00:20.830 --> 00:00:22.920
pull the level up to
fold the seat back down.
00:00:24.180 --> 00:00:28.250
To unfold your seats, just pull the seat
back up into the lock position.
00:00:28.250 --> 00:00:28.920
You'll hear a click.
00:00:30.160 --> 00:00:31.300
And on some vehicles,
00:00:31.300 --> 00:00:34.870
you may see a red indicator on
the lever to let you know it's locked.
00:00:34.870 --> 00:00:36.584
Just give it a slight pull to make sure.
00:00:36.584 --> 00:00:40.486
Any questions?
00:00:40.486 --> 00:00:40.986
Go to www.FordOwner.com.
00:00:40.986 --> 00:00:50.942
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Rear Folding Seats with Side Release and Folding Head Restraints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nTO2w5-8rIA_seg1.mp4
question: How do I fold the backseat down in my vehicle?

video_trans:

control one set anytime by braking or
00:02:43.168 --> 00:02:46.965

the steering wheel, which will cancel
00:02:46.965 --> 00:02:51.489

to gain manual control of your vehicle.
00:02:51.489 --> 00:02:55.998
Pressing the resume button will return the
vehicle to the previously set speed and
00:02:55.998 --> 00:02:56.790
gap setting.

Any questions?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:27.410 --> 00:00:29.194
When a vehicle enters into your left or
00:00:29.194 --> 00:00:32.561
right adjacent lane radar sensors in
the rear of the vehicle detect it.
00:00:32.561 --> 00:00:35.482
And BLIS warns you with a solid
light on the corresponding side
00:00:35.482 --> 00:00:39.060
view mirror when the vehicle
is within blind spot zone.
00:00:39.060 --> 00:00:41.860
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:43.250 --> 00:00:44.615
When you activate your turn signal,
00:00:44.615 --> 00:00:48.070
BLIS will give you a secondary flashing
light warning on the corresponding
00:00:48.070 --> 00:00:50.590
side view mirror when a vehicle's
within the blind spot zone.
00:00:51.854 --> 00:00:55.264
And remember, the system only
warns you of motorized vehicles,
00:00:55.264 --> 00:00:58.497
it does not detect bicycles,
pedestrians or other objects.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg3.mp4
question: Can I get similar warning of blind spot with pedestrians?

00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.536

00:00:04.536 --> 00:00:08.538
DId you know that your plug-in hybrid electric
vehicle is equipped with a feature that
00:00:08.538 --> 00:00:12.543
gives you an approximate estimate of how

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.402 --> 00:00:05.166
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.166 --> 00:00:08.958
You may be interested to know that your
hybrid electric vehicle can show you where
00:00:08.958 --> 00:00:12.040
and how the power is being distributed
to help monitor its usage.
00:00:12.040 --> 00:00:13.650
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:13.650 --> 00:00:17.300
Your vehicle has a power flow status
screen that visually displays the power
00:00:17.300 --> 00:00:18.830
usage in real time.

If at any time you want a quick refresher
on what this feature is, scroll to
00:01:24.070 --> 00:01:27.900
information, use the five way control on
the left side of your steering wheel.
00:01:27.900 --> 00:01:32.130
Go to the main menu Tutorial
then select ECO Cruise and
00:01:32.130 --> 00:01:34.090
a brief description will appear.

video_trans:

Your brakes also have something
called a Drive Away Release.
00:00:32.229 --> 00:00:36.990
Once you've closed the door, buckled in,
turned on the ignition, shifted into
00:00:36.990 --> 00:00:41.971
gear and pressed the accelerator, your
parking brake will automatically release.

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:14.090 --> 00:01:18.120
When the system is on,
you'll see a car icon with lane markings.
00:01:18.120 --> 00:01:20.900
If the lines are gray,
you're either driving too slow for
00:01:20.900 --> 00:01:24.500
the system to work,
the road has poor lane markings, or
00:01:24.500 --> 00:01:27.020
the camera cannot see the markings
because of weather conditions.

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:52.860 --> 00:01:54.050
When towing a trailer,
00:01:54.050 --> 00:01:58.308
pressing the Tow/Haul mode button located
at the end of the gear shift lever, here,
00:01:58.308 --> 00:02:03.220
activates the tow/haul feature which will
allow the adaptive cruise control system
00:02:03.220 --> 00:02:06.130
to automatically follow at
a slightly greater distance.
00:02:06.130 --> 00:02:09.120
This is handy since the extra
weight of a trailer requires more
00:02:09.120 --> 00:02:11.050
breaking distance if needed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg9.mp4
question: Where is the tow haul mode button located?

video_name: USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c
video_trans:
00:00:25.360 --> 00:00:29.640
Unlike traditional USB charging ports
that provide 500 milliamps of power and
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:31.060
can only charge a smartphone or
00:00:31.060 --> 00:00:35.260
media player, smart USB chargers can
provide up to two amps, and know just
00:00:35.260 --> 00:00:38.080
the right amount of power to deliver
to whatever device you're charging.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.743
Meaning, if you have one device plugged
in that needs two amps to charge, and
00:00:42.743 --> 00:00:46.255
another plugged in at the same time
that only needs one amp to fully charge,
00:00:46.255 --> 00:00:49.029
your smart USB port will deliver
the right amount to both.
00:00:49.029 --> 00:00:52.292
And that can help save battery power for
your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c_seg3.mp4
question: How many amps can the smart charger provide?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:01:49.340 --> 00:01:54.030
Keep in mind, the charge port light
illumination will time out after 1 minute.
00:01:54.030 --> 00:01:57.439
If a fault is detected at any time,
all the lights will flash continuously.
00:01:58.760 --> 00:02:02.930
And if the charge scheduled for later,
the number of lights which represents your
00:02:02.930 --> 00:02:06.140
current minimum state of
charge will be solidly lit.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:08.550
And the charge port lights
will timeout after one minute.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg6.mp4
question: How will I know if the charge point connection has failed?

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:
00:00:17.320 --> 00:00:20.822
Here's how it works, to use SelectShift,
00:00:20.822 --> 00:00:24.333
move your gear shift into S,
or Sport Mode.
00:00:24.333 --> 00:00:27.600
If your vehicle has the select shift
controls on the steering wheel,
00:00:27.600 --> 00:00:32.040
you'll pull the right paddle to upshift,
or the left paddle to downshift.
00:00:32.040 --> 00:00:35.990
If your controls are located on the
Shifter, you upshift by pressing the plus
00:00:35.990 --> 00:00:40.590
button on the Gear Shift Lever, or
downshift by pressing the minus button.

video_trans:

When you do, you'll notice the oil
pressure, engine temperature, fuel and
00:00:33.870 --> 00:00:37.630
transmission temperature gauges, are
always displayed at the top of the screen.
00:00:37.630 --> 00:00:40.590
Keep in mind, you can switch
the transmission temperature gauge,
00:00:40.590 --> 00:00:42.200
to display a turbo boost gauge.

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.947
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.947 --> 00:00:09.731
Your Mustang has a feature that allows you
to do a burn out to heat up your tires for
00:00:09.731 --> 00:00:12.040
an improved track experience.
00:00:12.040 --> 00:00:15.430
It's called Line Lock and
it's part of the Track Apps feature.
00:00:15.430 --> 00:00:19.830
When turned on, the front brakes are
locked so the rear wheels can spin freely.
00:00:19.830 --> 00:00:23.690
This is helpful when doing a burnout to
heat up the tires for better traction.

If you'd rather control
your temperature manually,
00:01:15.640 --> 00:01:17.820
just press the distribution
control button.
00:01:17.820 --> 00:01:19.660
Or any of the fans feed buttons.
