video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:01:38.526 --> 00:01:39.932
To remove the battery cover,
00:01:39.932 --> 00:01:44.100
first remove the small panel that
covers the negative battery cable.
00:01:44.100 --> 00:01:47.050
Once the panel is off, you'll need
to loosen the nuts on the negative
00:01:47.050 --> 00:01:49.680
pull clamps and
remove the cable from the battery.
00:01:49.680 --> 00:01:52.608
Next, unsnap the tab in the front, here.
00:01:52.608 --> 00:01:55.984
Then, slide the lid forward until
the two additional front-side tabs
00:01:55.984 --> 00:01:57.830
come unattached.
00:01:57.830 --> 00:02:01.028
Now, lift and pull the cover to remove it.
00:02:01.028 --> 00:02:03.426
Then, loosen the nuts on
the positive pull clamps and
00:02:03.426 --> 00:02:05.580
remove the clamps from the battery.
00:02:05.580 --> 00:02:09.139
Be sure to use the lift handles
provided when removing the batteries,
00:02:09.139 --> 00:02:10.539
since they are very heavy.
00:02:10.539 --> 00:02:14.739
You may have a single battery. To replace
it with the cover panel off, loosen and
00:02:14.739 --> 00:02:17.060
remove the negative pull clamp.
00:02:17.060 --> 00:02:20.798
Then rotate the battery and
remove the positive pull clamp.
00:02:20.798 --> 00:02:24.062
To install the new battery,
just follow the same directions, but
00:02:24.062 --> 00:02:25.180
in the reverse order.
00:02:26.520 --> 00:02:30.043
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg5.mp4
question: What do you need to do to install the new battery?

00:01:23.840 --> 00:01:26.110

Then select the temperature you want,

A/C on or off, and to recirculate air.

video_name: Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog
video_trans:
00:00:11.850 --> 00:00:15.020
To use the step, first lower the tailgate,
00:00:15.020 --> 00:00:18.950
then press the black release button in
the center of the step molding, here.
00:00:18.950 --> 00:00:20.470
The step will pop out a little, so
00:00:20.470 --> 00:00:23.360
just pull it all the way until it
gently falls into a lower position.
00:00:24.710 --> 00:00:27.860
Next, grab the yellow bar
top to the left of the step.
00:00:27.860 --> 00:00:30.410
Pull until the black bar
is fully extended and
00:00:30.410 --> 00:00:32.920
lift it up until it's locked into place.
00:00:32.920 --> 00:00:35.280
Then, pull the chrome interior
bar all of the way up.
00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:39.410
You'll know the bar is fully
extended when you hear a click.
00:00:39.410 --> 00:00:42.930
The bar can be used as a grab handle to
help pull yourself up into the truck bed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog_seg2.mp4
question: Does the truck have a fold down step up device?

00:01:32.390 --> 00:01:36.190

00:01:36.190 --> 00:01:39.970

down by pulling and
00:01:42.570 --> 00:01:45.969

you're pushing the seat back forward.

Once it starts to fold,
let go of the strap.

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:03:07.000 --> 00:03:09.700
Now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the system's
00:03:09.700 --> 00:03:10.640
information display.
00:03:11.720 --> 00:03:15.190
To input the measurements you recorded
outside the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:15.190 --> 00:03:18.540
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:18.540 --> 00:03:21.130
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed.
00:03:21.130 --> 00:03:24.444
Like this,
then OK to confirm each measurement and
00:03:24.444 --> 00:03:26.769
to move on to the next measurement.
00:03:26.769 --> 00:03:28.618
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:03:28.618 --> 00:03:31.761
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:03:31.761 --> 00:03:35.591
If correct, select Confirm and hit OK.
00:03:35.591 --> 00:03:39.573
Once you've confirmed the measurements,
the system will automatically search for
00:03:39.573 --> 00:03:42.172
the sticker target and
highlight it with a red circle and
00:03:42.172 --> 00:03:44.391
the message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:03:44.391 --> 00:03:47.495
If it is, select yes to confirm.
00:03:47.495 --> 00:03:50.762
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know setup is complete and
00:03:50.762 --> 00:03:51.927
measurements are saved.
00:03:51.927 --> 00:03:54.753
If you don't see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:03:54.753 --> 00:03:57.201
Make sure the measurements are correct and
that the trailer and
00:03:57.201 --> 00:03:59.115
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:03:59.115 --> 00:04:03.779
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straightforward between 4 and 25 miles per
00:04:03.779 --> 00:04:07.844
hour as directed until you get a message
confirming calibration is complete.
00:04:07.844 --> 00:04:08.911
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg6.mp4
question: How do you confirm once you have selected your measurements?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:01:53.105 --> 00:01:57.020
If your vehicle includes the blind
spot information system BLIS,
00:01:57.020 --> 00:01:59.970
the system first prompts you to
set up your trailer BLIS feature.
00:02:00.980 --> 00:02:03.920
Next, a message appears in
the information display,
00:02:03.920 --> 00:02:06.570
asking if you want to
Add Trailer Reverse Guidance.
00:02:06.570 --> 00:02:07.350
Select Yes.
00:02:08.360 --> 00:02:12.620
A prompt will direct you to straighten the
trailer if necessary, to continue set up.
00:02:12.620 --> 00:02:15.790
You'll then get another message directing
you to use the quick start guide
00:02:15.790 --> 00:02:16.359
to proceed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg3.mp4
question: How to set up the Blind Spot Information System?

video_name: Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0
video_trans:
00:00:42.260 --> 00:00:43.540
And one more thing.
00:00:43.540 --> 00:00:46.130
To help protect against fuel theft,
splashing, or
00:00:46.130 --> 00:00:49.770
water getting in the tank, the capless
fuel filler is tamper resistant.
00:00:49.770 --> 00:00:53.241
And the self closing spring-loaded flaps
help keep fuel from sloshing out and
00:00:53.241 --> 00:00:56.145
water from leaking in when it rains or
when you wash your vehicle.
00:00:56.145 --> 00:00:57.706
[MUSIC]
00:00:57.706 --> 00:00:58.774
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0_seg3.mp4
question: How does the self closing, capless fuel tank beneficial to car owners?

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:13.790 --> 00:00:16.520
Brake Coach works to help you
maximize the amount of energy
00:00:16.520 --> 00:00:19.350
captured through your
regenerative braking system.
00:00:19.350 --> 00:00:21.910
Regenerative braking works with
your standard brake system by
00:00:21.910 --> 00:00:25.170
recovering energy that is usually
lost through your friction brakes and
00:00:25.170 --> 00:00:27.350
engine drag during braking or coasting.
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.810
And then storing that recovered energy
in your battery to help maximize efficiency.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg2.mp4
question: what does regenerative breaking do?

video_name: 180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc
video_trans:
00:00:28.040 --> 00:00:32.560
While you're in park, neutral, or drive,
press the camera button above the CD slot
00:00:32.560 --> 00:00:35.920
once to see either a front, normal view,
which gives you an image of
00:00:35.920 --> 00:00:39.620
what's directly in front of you,
or again, for a front split-view,
00:00:39.620 --> 00:00:42.720
which gives you a 180 degree extended
view of what's in front of you.
00:00:43.750 --> 00:00:46.900
That can be helpful, as it gives you added
visibility when you're pulling out of
00:00:46.900 --> 00:00:50.450
a driveway, street, parking spot,
or while maneuvering.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc_seg3.mp4
question: What button do I press if I'm in reverse to check my visibility?

video_trans:
00:01:26.980 --> 00:01:30.699
To turn it on, simply press the button
located on your gear shift lever.
00:01:30.699 --> 00:01:34.500
You'll know what's on when you see it
illuminated in your instrument cluster.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg7.mp4
question: What does the button labelled 'T/S' stand for?

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:17.846 --> 00:00:22.105
Using the five-way controls on your
steering wheel, scroll to the main menu,
00:00:22.105 --> 00:00:25.400
Display/Trip, then scroll to MyView and
00:00:25.400 --> 00:00:27.740
press the right arrow on
the five-way controls.
00:00:27.740 --> 00:00:31.030
It takes you to the Options menu
where you can select Change MyView.
00:00:31.030 --> 00:00:35.100
From here, simply use the up or
down arrows to view the available content,
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:39.280
like Vehicle Range, Trip 1 and
2, Fuel History, Coach, etc,
00:00:39.280 --> 00:00:43.030
and the right and left arrows to move
between the left and right columns.
00:00:44.360 --> 00:00:46.710
Each time you select a screen
that you want to display,
00:00:46.710 --> 00:00:49.650
press the OK button on your
five-way control to save it.
00:00:49.650 --> 00:00:51.980
This will now be your MyView screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM_seg2.mp4
question: What button do you have to press to save after you've selected a screen you want to display?

video_trans:
00:01:32.110 --> 00:01:36.530
Keep in mind, the estimated range is
based on three impact categories.
00:01:36.530 --> 00:01:40.440
The first being driving style and
route, which is the energy used to
00:01:40.440 --> 00:01:45.160

breaking behavior, road grades, and
00:01:45.160 --> 00:01:47.630
whether you're doing city or
highway driving.

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:00:10.560 --> 00:00:14.130
Let me tell you about it. The message
center or the productivity screen
00:00:14.130 --> 00:00:17.920
has a 4.2 inch screen that's located
between the tachometer and speedometer.
00:00:19.030 --> 00:00:21.720
Use the five-way switch on the left
side of your steering wheel
00:00:21.720 --> 00:00:26.190
to scroll to the main menu. From here, you
can get to display mode, which shows
00:00:26.190 --> 00:00:29.940
you your distance to empty, transmission
temperature, tire pressure for
00:00:29.940 --> 00:00:34.570
each wheel, engine information,
MyKey status and a digital speedometer.

video_trans:
00:01:22.590 --> 00:01:26.600
A green bar indicates a positive
effect on your EV range,
00:01:26.600 --> 00:01:29.150
while an amber bar indicates
a negative effect.
00:01:29.150 --> 00:01:32.110
The longer the bar, the larger the impact.

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:01:23.240 --> 00:01:24.670
One more thing.
00:01:24.670 --> 00:01:27.310
When storing summer tires,
be sure to store them
00:01:27.310 --> 00:01:32.024
away from direct heating devices where
the temperatures are above 19 degrees Fahrenheit
00:01:32.024 --> 00:01:36.900
as lower temperatures may
result in loss of rubber flexibility and
00:01:36.900 --> 00:01:39.470
develop surface cracks in the treads.
00:01:39.470 --> 00:01:43.636
If the tires have been stored and
conditioned at 19 degrees or cooler,
00:01:43.636 --> 00:01:47.190
warm them to 41 degrees Fahrenheit for
at least 24 hours
00:01:47.190 --> 00:01:50.510
before installing them on a vehicle or
checking the tire pressure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg3.mp4
question: What do I do before installing new tires?

video_name: Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.277
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.277 --> 00:00:06.654
Did you know that dirty glass or wiper
blades are one of the major reasons for
00:00:06.654 --> 00:00:09.020
streaks and
smears on your windshield when wiping?
00:00:10.170 --> 00:00:12.640
If this happens,
lift your wiper blades up and
  
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:16.680
clean the entire windshield glass,
as well as the rubber blades.
00:00:16.680 --> 00:00:19.270
Be sure to clean the windshield
using a neutral detergent
00:00:19.270 --> 00:00:23.030
such as Motorcraft Premium
Windshield Washer Concentrate or
00:00:23.030 --> 00:00:26.960
Motorcraft Ultra-Clear Spray
Glass Cleaner, and a soft cloth.
00:00:26.960 --> 00:00:28.090
Then rinse with clear water.
00:00:29.330 --> 00:00:32.405
In extreme cases,
you may need to use a mild abrasive,
00:00:32.405 --> 00:00:36.480
non-chlorinated cleaner, and
wash the wiper blades using a sponge or
00:00:36.480 --> 00:00:40.860
soft cloth and rubbing alcohol, or
Premium Windshield Washer Fluid.
00:00:40.860 --> 00:00:45.060
If your wipers continue to smear your
windshield, you may need to replace them.
00:00:45.060 --> 00:00:45.920
Any questions?
00:00:45.920 --> 00:00:48.075
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.075 --> 00:00:58.075
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM_seg1.mp4
question: How do you clean the wiper blades?

video_trans:

Adaptive cruise control with stop and go
keeps a constant speed without having to
00:00:21.180 --> 00:00:25.510

also automatically maintains a comfortable
00:00:25.510 --> 00:00:28.330

00:00:28.330 --> 00:00:31.350

stop if needed in heavy traffic.

The step will pop out a little, so
00:00:20.470 --> 00:00:23.360
just pull it all the way until it
gently falls into a lower position.
00:00:24.710 --> 00:00:27.860
Next, grab the yellow bar
top to the left of the step.
00:00:27.860 --> 00:00:30.410
Pull until the black bar
is fully extended and
00:00:30.410 --> 00:00:32.920
lift it up until it's locked into place.
00:00:32.920 --> 00:00:35.280
Then, pull the chrome interior
bar all of the way up.
00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:39.410
You'll know the bar is fully
extended when you hear a click.
00:00:39.410 --> 00:00:42.930
The bar can be used as a grab handle to
help pull yourself up into the truck bed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog_seg2.mp4
question: How do I use the tailgate step?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:02:18.170 --> 00:02:21.850
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:02:21.850 --> 00:02:25.340
The sticker acts as a target that
the trailer reverse guidance feature and
00:02:25.340 --> 00:02:28.480
rear view camera use to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:29.640 --> 00:02:31.250
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:31.250 --> 00:02:33.830
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:33.830 --> 00:02:36.790
You'll want to place the sticker
within 7 to 22 inches from
00:02:36.790 --> 00:02:38.890
the center of the trailer hitch ball.
00:02:38.890 --> 00:02:42.696
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal surface, so
00:02:42.696 --> 00:02:46.573
the entire sticker is in the acceptable
zone invisible by the rearview camera.
00:02:46.573 --> 00:02:48.293
[MUSIC]
00:02:48.293 --> 00:02:50.430
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:50.430 --> 00:02:54.020
Once the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:54.020 --> 00:02:56.020
record several measurements.
00:02:56.020 --> 00:02:59.880
First, measure the horizontal distance
from the license plate to the center of
00:02:59.880 --> 00:03:01.720
the hitch ball, and write it down.
00:03:01.720 --> 00:03:06.130
Next, measure the horizontal distance
from the center of the hitch ball to
00:03:06.130 --> 00:03:07.746
the center of the sticker.
00:03:07.746 --> 00:03:11.870
And the distance from the rear view
camera to the center of the sticker.
00:03:11.870 --> 00:03:15.218
Keep in mind, the location is
not dependent on a straight or
00:03:15.218 --> 00:03:20.780
a frame type, but based on where a surface
is available that meets the requirements.
00:03:20.780 --> 00:03:24.740
And finally, the horizontal distance from
the tailgate to the center of the trailer
00:03:24.740 --> 00:03:26.645
axle if it's a single axle trailer.
00:03:28.335 --> 00:03:30.685
If the trailer has two or more axles,
00:03:30.685 --> 00:03:34.680
measure to the center point
between both axles, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg4.mp4
question: What should you measure first after placing the checkered sticker?

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:01:57.030 --> 00:01:59.800
To lift the seat out of
the stowed position, squeeze and
00:01:59.800 --> 00:02:01.960
pull up on the handle as you lift.
00:02:01.960 --> 00:02:05.000
The seat will lift out of
the floor in a folded position.
00:02:05.000 --> 00:02:08.310
So just push it back to lock
it into the floor latches.
00:02:08.310 --> 00:02:13.038
Then, move your seat back into the upright
position by pulling strap number 1 and
00:02:13.038 --> 00:02:14.901
the long strap on the seat back.

question: How to lif the sead out of the load position?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:11.045 --> 00:00:15.500
Lane-keeping system is made up
of two parts, Alert and Aid.
00:00:16.700 --> 00:00:18.860
The Alert mode lets you know if
you're drifting out of your lane.
00:00:19.928 --> 00:00:24.740
Using three short vibrations, it warns you
to steer your vehicle back into your lane.
00:00:24.740 --> 00:00:28.180
If you want to change the strength
of the vibration your car gives you,
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:31.245
you can adjust the intensity
setting in the message center.
00:00:31.245 --> 00:00:33.680
Lane-keeping will remember
the changes you make, so
00:00:33.680 --> 00:00:36.640
you won't have to reset it the next
time you turn on the system.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg2.mp4
question: what can be adjusted to change the strength of the vibration in message center?

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:01:39.921 --> 00:01:44.632
Adaptive steering helps reduce under steer
at higher speeds, while allowing the front
00:01:44.660 --> 00:01:48.720
wheels to turn fully with fewer turns
of the steering wheel at lower speeds.
00:01:48.720 --> 00:01:51.640
And when used with tow haul
the vehicle delays upshifts and
00:01:51.646 --> 00:01:55.359
provides engine breaking when descending
hilly roads with heavy loads.
00:01:55.359 --> 00:01:56.568
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg7.mp4
question: Does adaptive steering delay upshifts?

video_name: 180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc
video_trans:
00:00:28.040 --> 00:00:32.560
While you're in park, neutral, or drive,
press the camera button above the CD slot
00:00:32.560 --> 00:00:35.920
once to see either a front, normal view,
which gives you an image of
00:00:35.920 --> 00:00:39.620
what's directly in front of you,
or again, for a front split-view,
00:00:39.620 --> 00:00:42.720
which gives you a 180 degree extended
view of what's in front of you.
00:00:43.750 --> 00:00:46.900
That can be helpful, as it gives you added
visibility when you're pulling out of
00:00:46.900 --> 00:00:50.450
a driveway, street, parking spot,
or while maneuvering.

video_trans:

00:00:30.200 --> 00:00:33.180
you'll see dotted yellow lines
on each side of the vehicle.
00:00:33.180 --> 00:00:36.690
These represent the keep-out zone and
let you know where the edges of your
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:40.290
mirror are in relation to what
you're seeing in the camera image.

video_trans:

To unfold the second row seats,
pull the longer strap on the seat back up.
00:02:16.400 --> 00:02:20.020

move the entire seat back and
00:02:20.020 --> 00:02:22.690
push down until you feel it
lock into position again.

And until you hear it click.
00:02:24.622 --> 00:02:27.481

flip the seat back up.

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:00:35.570 --> 00:00:39.810
Trip view mode gives you a four quadrant
look that displays trip one and two.
00:00:39.810 --> 00:00:43.870
Both of which allow you to see your timer,
instantaneous fuel economy,
00:00:43.870 --> 00:00:46.620
miles traveled, and
average miles per gallon.
00:00:46.620 --> 00:00:50.340
Under the same mode, you also have a fuel
economy screen that displays your average
00:00:50.340 --> 00:00:55.430
miles per gallon, an instantaneous fuel
economy graph, miles to empty, and
00:00:55.430 --> 00:01:00.210
a fuel history which shows a bar graph of
your fuel history over a period of time,
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:03.670
a compass as well as your
Auto StartStop status.

view you see by using the camera button on

it until you get the view you want.
00:01:48.280 --> 00:01:51.390
Keep in mind, the change camera view
function only works when you're
00:01:51.390 --> 00:01:55.210
driving forward at six miles per hour or
below for safety purposes.

Keep in mind, the selectable driving

Your brakes also have something
called a Drive Away Release.

Once you've closed the door, buckled in,

00:00:36.990 --> 00:00:41.971

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:51.980 --> 00:00:55.130
In addition to being able to personalize
your left side screen choices,
00:00:55.130 --> 00:00:58.734
there are also a few screens that
are only available in MyView.
00:00:58.734 --> 00:01:03.010
Like Accessory Power, which indicates the
electrical power demands being put on your
00:01:03.010 --> 00:01:04.650
vehicle from your climate system, and
00:01:04.650 --> 00:01:08.680
other accessories like your radio,
headlights, and windshield wipers.
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.700
Coolant temp, which indicates if your
engine temperature is normal, or high.
00:01:12.700 --> 00:01:16.550
Keep in mind, whichever two choices you
select, the far right side of the screen
00:01:16.550 --> 00:01:19.540
will always display your fuel gauge and
battery gauge.
00:01:19.540 --> 00:01:20.860
Any questions?

To fold the seats flat, pull up on the
same handle you used to recline the seat,
00:01:01.980 --> 00:01:05.570
and push the seat back all
the way forward until it's flat.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM_seg5.mp4

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:01:06.450 --> 00:01:10.310
If at any time the battery in your remote
dies or the signal is interrupted,
00:01:10.310 --> 00:01:14.320
you can use the removable key
inside to unlock the driver's door.
00:01:14.320 --> 00:01:16.110
Just press the button and
slide the key out.
00:01:17.180 --> 00:01:19.920
Next, insert the key into the slot located
00:01:19.920 --> 00:01:22.440
underneath the rear of
the driver's door handle and
00:01:22.440 --> 00:01:26.320
push up until you feel the internal
tab flex and unlock the plastic bezel.
00:01:27.520 --> 00:01:30.560
Slide the bezel back to
completely remove it.
00:01:30.560 --> 00:01:35.220
When you do, you'll be able to access
the key cylinder and unlock your door.
00:01:35.220 --> 00:01:36.350
To replace the bezel,
00:01:36.350 --> 00:01:39.410
slide it forward until you feel
it snap into the locked position.
00:01:40.650 --> 00:01:44.537
Once you're in, there's a pocket in the
center console made just for the key fob.
00:01:44.537 --> 00:01:46.680
It'll allow you to start your car.
00:01:46.680 --> 00:01:49.860
Place the key fob in the slot
with the button's facing up and
00:01:49.860 --> 00:01:52.810
the unlock button towards
the front of the vehicle.
00:01:52.810 --> 00:01:56.695
Keep in mind, because the key is
programmed to your car, if you lose it,
00:01:56.695 --> 00:01:59.050
you'll need to contact your dealer for
a replacement.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c_seg6.mp4
question: How do you access the key cylinder?

video_name: LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.512
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.512 --> 00:00:08.350
Your vehicle may be equipped with some or
all of these LED lighting features,
00:00:08.350 --> 00:00:12.610
that are both convenient and offer
a little extra security when traveling.
00:00:12.610 --> 00:00:13.270
Let me explain.
00:00:14.320 --> 00:00:17.450
Our quad beam LED head lamps
generate a brighter light,
00:00:17.450 --> 00:00:21.160
that resembles natural daylight,
which in turn can help reduce eye strain.
00:00:21.160 --> 00:00:24.425
Plus, they typically
last longer than halogen.
00:00:24.425 --> 00:00:25.631
Bright LED tail lamps and
00:00:25.631 --> 00:00:30.130
fog lamps compliment the headlamps
while enhancing nighttime visibility.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk_seg1.mp4

This means it's ready to go.

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:01:28.040 --> 00:01:30.508
To set a separate temperature for
the front passenger side,
00:01:30.508 --> 00:01:35.360
press the dual-zone button or just turn
the knob to activate Dual-Zone control,
00:01:35.360 --> 00:01:38.370
and adjust the temperature for
the passenger side.
00:01:38.370 --> 00:01:40.340
An amber light will illuminate
to let you know it's on.
00:01:40.340 --> 00:01:44.270
And you'll see the temperature displayed
in the upper right corner of the screen.
00:01:44.270 --> 00:01:46.560
But, the driver's
temperature will not change.

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:00:33.340 --> 00:00:35.100
If a collision risk with the vehicle or
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:38.790
a pedestrian is detected,
it provides a warning to the driver.
00:00:38.790 --> 00:00:42.480
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield.
00:00:42.480 --> 00:00:43.580
A warning chime will sound.
00:00:43.580 --> 00:00:47.420
And a warning message will appear
in your information list this way.
00:00:47.420 --> 00:00:50.640
If you do not reactive and continue
to get closer to the pedestrians or
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:55.440
other vehicles after the alert, the system
precharges the brakes and if needed,
00:00:55.440 --> 00:01:00.050
can automatically apply full braking force
which may help produce the survorarity or
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:02.570
even eliminate certain frontal collisions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg3.mp4
question: Does this feature replace the need for the driver to apply the brakes?

00:00:48.467 --> 00:00:51.260

video_trans:
00:01:37.610 --> 00:01:40.350
Your vehicle also has
something called side sensing.
00:01:40.350 --> 00:01:44.550

touchscreen with red, yellow, and green
00:01:48.420 --> 00:01:52.160

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:00:22.760 --> 00:00:25.970
Summer tires are ideal for
performance vehicles and
00:00:25.970 --> 00:00:29.366
do not have the same traction
characteristics of all-season tires.
00:00:29.366 --> 00:00:32.902
As they are designed for
superior traction, cornering, and
00:00:32.902 --> 00:00:37.010
braking performance for
both wet and dry road conditions.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:41.240
This is attributed to specialized tread
patterns, like less grooving, to provide
00:00:41.240 --> 00:00:46.159
more tire contact with the road, shallower
tread depth, and softer rubber compounds.
00:00:47.330 --> 00:00:51.550
Keep in mind, since summer tires
are composed of softer materials,
00:00:51.550 --> 00:00:53.360
they tend to lose flexibility.
00:00:53.360 --> 00:00:55.766
and are less suitable in colder temps and
00:00:55.766 --> 00:00:58.755
generally wear faster
than an all-season tire.
00:00:58.755 --> 00:01:02.646
And unlike all-season tires,
summer tires do not have a mud and
00:01:02.646 --> 00:01:05.601
snow traction rating and
are not recommended for
00:01:05.601 --> 00:01:09.870
cold weather below 45 degrees or
snowy and icy driving conditions.
00:01:11.220 --> 00:01:12.540
As a matter of fact,
00:01:12.540 --> 00:01:17.230
driving on summer tires in below
freezing conditions can damage them.
00:01:17.230 --> 00:01:21.590
If you must drive in these conditions,
Ford recommends using all-season or
00:01:21.590 --> 00:01:23.240
winter snow tires.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg2.mp4
question: what does for recommend for driving in the winter?

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:00:22.890 --> 00:00:25.210
To activate the park assist feature,
00:00:25.210 --> 00:00:28.670
press the active park assist button
on the center console, here.
00:00:28.670 --> 00:00:31.400
Then signal to indicate which side
you'd like the vehicle to search.
00:00:32.520 --> 00:00:35.450
An information screen will
appear on your center display.
00:00:35.450 --> 00:00:39.120
And the system will begin to scan for
available parking spots.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.160
Once an appropriate spot is found,
youâ€™ll hear a chime and
00:00:42.160 --> 00:00:44.910
see a spot found message on your screen.
00:00:44.910 --> 00:00:48.180
Follow the prompts on your screen,
accelerating, shifting and
00:00:48.180 --> 00:00:50.070
braking as needed.
00:00:50.070 --> 00:00:52.180
And be sure to watch your mirrors and
your surroundings for
00:00:52.180 --> 00:00:54.660
any objects which you may
be getting too close to.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the park assist button located on the console?

video_trans:

First press the lock button on your
key fob to lock all the doors.
00:00:20.620 --> 00:00:24.120
Then press the remote start button,
the one with the 2x icon two times.
00:00:24.120 --> 00:00:29.300
Your outside lights will flash twice and
then your car will start.
00:00:30.490 --> 00:00:31.340
For some vehicles,
00:00:31.340 --> 00:00:35.225
a light on your your remote will also let
you know if your car has started or not.
00:00:35.225 --> 00:00:37.235
Pretty convenient, right?

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:00:14.754 --> 00:00:18.435
First, let's talk about how to
jump your battery if it dies.
00:00:18.435 --> 00:00:20.783
Open the engine hood by
pulling on the hood
00:00:20.783 --> 00:00:24.981
release located under the storage bin
next to the driver's side door, here.
00:00:24.981 --> 00:00:29.100
The battery jump box is located on the
driver's side of the engine compartment.
00:00:29.100 --> 00:00:33.072
Lift up the red access panel to
expose the positive battery post, and
00:00:33.072 --> 00:00:36.029
attach the positive end of
your jumper cable to it.
00:00:36.029 --> 00:00:38.537
Now, connect the negative
end to the ground,
00:00:38.537 --> 00:00:41.765
located on the inside of
the driver's side fender, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg2.mp4
question: How do you open the hood?

video_trans:

And select either Auto, which extends or
retracts every time you open or
00:00:34.199 --> 00:00:35.160
close the doors.
00:00:35.160 --> 00:00:37.096
Out, to keep them open all the time,
00:00:37.096 --> 00:00:41.120
which can be helpful when
accessing items from a roof rack.
00:00:41.120 --> 00:00:45.570
Or Off, to disable them, which is
useful if you're using a hoist or jack.

video_name: EcoSelect _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Um28JeKN_iI
video_trans:
00:00:10.860 --> 00:00:14.460
To turn EcoSelect on,
simply press the Eco button located
00:00:14.460 --> 00:00:17.230
on the center console next
to the driver's seat.
00:00:17.230 --> 00:00:21.480
Here, you'll know it's on when you see
this icon in your information display.
00:00:21.480 --> 00:00:24.780
When activated, this feature is
designed to enhance fuel economy
00:00:24.780 --> 00:00:27.570
with some trade-offs in vehicle
performance and comfort.
00:00:27.570 --> 00:00:30.360
You may notice that your climate
system takes a bit longer to heat or
00:00:30.360 --> 00:00:33.880
cool the cabin, while also
altering other vehicle features.
00:00:33.880 --> 00:00:38.030
You may also experience less aggressive
acceleration and increased deceleration
00:00:38.030 --> 00:00:41.700
while coasting, which helps recharge
the battery more efficiently.

question: How do you turn eco select on?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:00:24.510 --> 00:00:29.400
Let me explain, adaptive steering with
tow/haul mode, changes the ratio between
00:00:29.400 --> 00:00:32.570
the driver's actions with the steering
wheel, meaning how much the driver
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:36.630
turns the steering wheel, and
how much the front wheels actually turn.
00:00:36.630 --> 00:00:39.660
At slower speeds, this allows
the front wheels to fully turn,
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.520
with fewer rotations
of the steering wheel,
00:00:42.520 --> 00:00:45.980
which is helpful when performing
low speed maneuvers like parking.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:48.280
When traveling at higher speeds,
on a highway for
00:00:48.280 --> 00:00:52.500
instance, this feature further
optimizes the steering response,
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.235
enabling the vehicle to react more
precisely to driver input and
00:00:56.235 --> 00:00:59.065
provide a smoother vehicle response
to your steering wheel input.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg2.mp4
question: Does it have an effect at slower speeds?

video_name: USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c
video_trans:
00:00:25.360 --> 00:00:29.640
Unlike traditional USB charging ports
that provide 500 milliamps of power and
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:31.060
can only charge a smartphone or
00:00:31.060 --> 00:00:35.260
media player, smart USB chargers can
provide up to two amps, and know just
00:00:35.260 --> 00:00:38.080
the right amount of power to deliver
to whatever device you're charging.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.743
Meaning, if you have one device plugged
in that needs two amps to charge, and
00:00:42.743 --> 00:00:46.255
another plugged in at the same time
that only needs one amp to fully charge,
00:00:46.255 --> 00:00:49.029
your smart USB port will deliver
the right amount to both.
00:00:49.029 --> 00:00:52.292
And that can help save battery power for
your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c_seg3.mp4
question: What does "smart charger" mean as functions?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:38.782 --> 00:02:43.168
Keep in mind, you can cancel adaptive cruise
control one set anytime by braking or
00:02:43.168 --> 00:02:46.965
pressing the cancel button on
the steering wheel, which will cancel
00:02:46.965 --> 00:02:51.489
the adaptive cruise control and allow you
to gain manual control of your vehicle.
00:02:51.489 --> 00:02:55.998
Pressing the resume button will return the
vehicle to the previously set speed and
00:02:55.998 --> 00:02:56.790
gap setting.
 
00:02:56.790 --> 00:02:57.996
Any questions?
00:02:57.996 --> 00:02:59.971
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:02:59.971 --> 00:03:01.889
[MUSIC]

video_trans:
00:02:05.218 --> 00:02:09.733
And finally, smart trailer tow connector
informs you of trailer connectivity
00:02:09.733 --> 00:02:13.653
issues, such as burned out lights,
and trailer battery problems.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg9.mp4
question: How can I be informed of trailer connectivity issues?

video_name: SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q
video_trans:
00:01:19.496 --> 00:01:24.257
On select vehicles, you may even be able
to link your driver memory setting to your
00:01:24.257 --> 00:01:25.984
personal code on the keypad.
00:01:25.984 --> 00:01:29.393
Whatever five-digit code you
programmed as code number one,
00:01:29.393 --> 00:01:31.397
remember, the one set to one, two?
00:01:31.397 --> 00:01:35.251
Will be linked to the memory settings
that are stored in the memory one button.
00:01:35.251 --> 00:01:40.401
So, when you enter that five digit code,
the memory one position will be recalled.
00:01:40.401 --> 00:01:44.677
Whatever five-digit code you programmed
as code number two, the one set on 3 4,
00:01:44.677 --> 00:01:48.666
will be linked to the memory setting that
are stored in the memory two button.
00:01:48.666 --> 00:01:51.916
And if you have a third,
you can store it on 5-6.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q_seg5.mp4
question: What position can you store your five digit code on position number 1?

video_name: SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.405 --> 00:00:03.973
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.980 --> 00:00:07.180
Did you know that your vehicle may be
equipped with a feature
00:00:07.180 --> 00:00:11.520
that allows you to stay connected and control certain
features remotely, like unlock and
00:00:11.540 --> 00:00:14.900
lock your doors as well as
remote start your vehicle?
00:00:14.920 --> 00:00:19.208
All you need is the available
Sync Connect, a compatible smartphone, and
00:00:19.208 --> 00:00:20.170
Ford Pass.
00:00:20.170 --> 00:00:21.520
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:21.520 --> 00:00:25.340
The first thing you'll need to do is
download FordPass from the App Store or
00:00:25.340 --> 00:00:28.500
Google Play and
accept the terms and conditions.
00:00:28.500 --> 00:00:33.491
If you already have a Ford owner account,
you can log in using your username and
00:00:33.491 --> 00:00:34.350
password.
00:00:34.350 --> 00:00:38.920
If not, you can create an account via the
FordPass app with some basic information
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:40.400
and a four digit PIN.
00:00:40.400 --> 00:00:43.820
You'll then need to add your
sync connect equipped vehicle.
00:00:43.820 --> 00:00:45.710
Go to the My Vehicles card.
00:00:45.710 --> 00:00:47.600
Click on Add Vehicle.
00:00:47.600 --> 00:00:50.610
To add a second vehicle hit the + button.
00:00:50.610 --> 00:00:55.500
Next, scan the VIN bar code by selecting
the Use Camera tab and point your
00:00:55.500 --> 00:00:59.920
phone's camera to the VIN label located
on your vehicle's driver door sill.
00:00:59.920 --> 00:01:02.530
You'll get a scanned successfully screen.
00:01:02.530 --> 00:01:05.570
Next, assign a vehicle nickname,
then, hit Finish.
00:01:06.590 --> 00:01:10.360
Next, you'll see this screen directing
you to activate SYNC Connect by
00:01:10.360 --> 00:01:13.200
touching the Activate SYNC Connect button.
00:01:13.200 --> 00:01:16.170
After a few minutes,
go to your vehicle and start it.
00:01:16.170 --> 00:01:19.630
You will then see this pop up
on the SYNC 3 touchscreen.
00:01:19.630 --> 00:01:20.800
Touch Allow to continue.
00:01:21.880 --> 00:01:25.843
Keep in mind, if you do not touch Allow
in the pop-up within 10 start-ups,
00:01:25.843 --> 00:01:28.306
you will not gain access
to remote features, and
00:01:28.306 --> 00:01:30.608
will need to reactivate
from the beginning.
00:01:30.608 --> 00:01:31.873
[MUSIC]
00:01:31.873 --> 00:01:36.091
Once you do, after a short period of time,
all remote features can be
00:01:36.091 --> 00:01:40.188
accessed from your smartphones
FordPass Vehicle Controls card.
00:01:40.188 --> 00:01:41.265
Any questions?
00:01:41.265 --> 00:01:44.705
Go to owner.ford.com or FordPass.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s_seg1.mp4
question: What is the name of the App?

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:00:30.510 --> 00:00:34.670
You can also see your towing status, as
well as towing information like whether or
00:00:34.670 --> 00:00:37.703
not your trailer is connected and
a connection checklist.
00:00:37.703 --> 00:00:40.790
You can also access gain,
pitch, steering angle and
00:00:40.790 --> 00:00:44.950
trailer information for
up to ten trailers under the towing tab.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg3.mp4
question: Where can you view a connection checklist for trailer?

video_name: Rear Decklid Release _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fjh0-VKzUEk
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.036
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.036 --> 00:00:08.658
There are a few convenient ways to gain
access to the rear luggage compartment in
00:00:08.658 --> 00:00:09.600
your vehicle.
00:00:09.600 --> 00:00:11.210
Let me explain.
00:00:11.210 --> 00:00:14.360
From the driver's seat, simply push
the trunk release button on the lower left
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.520
side of the instrument panel next to the
steering column to unlatch the rear deck lid.
00:00:18.520 --> 00:00:20.230
With the standard Intelligent Access,
00:00:20.230 --> 00:00:24.120
you can get into your vehicle remotely
without reaching for your key fob.
00:00:24.120 --> 00:00:25.320
With your key fob on you,
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:29.350
just press the trunk release button
located above the license plate here.
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:32.071
It's that simple.
00:00:32.071 --> 00:00:33.095
Any questions?
00:00:33.095 --> 00:00:34.727
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:34.727 --> 00:00:44.727
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Rear Decklid Release _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fjh0-VKzUEk_seg1.mp4
question: How do you gain access to the rear luggage compartment of the vehicle from the driverâ€™s seat?

video_name: Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI
video_trans:
00:01:03.660 --> 00:01:06.870
Track provides more of
a performance driving experience
00:01:06.870 --> 00:01:10.650
as the engine responds directly to your
input, and takes on a more powerful tone.
00:01:10.650 --> 00:01:15.280
When you're in track mode a performance
oriented advance track calibration
00:01:15.280 --> 00:01:17.020
is automatically selected.
00:01:17.020 --> 00:01:21.110
And the usual advance track intervention
is reduced and tunes specifically for
00:01:21.110 --> 00:01:22.550
race track usage.

question: What does the Track drive mode option do?

video_trans:
00:00:25.708 --> 00:00:28.180
To turn it on, when shifted into reverse,
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:32.135
a 360 degree view will
display on the center screen.
00:00:32.135 --> 00:00:34.475
Touch the expand button, here.
00:00:34.475 --> 00:00:36.945
Then touch the high-mounted camera button.
00:00:36.945 --> 00:00:40.905
When you do, the image also gives you
a dynamic guideline to help locate
00:00:40.905 --> 00:00:43.585

For a closer look, you can zoom in on
the image by touching the + button.

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:01:59.490 --> 00:02:02.630
To run a report,
press Run Vehicle Health Report Now.
00:02:03.800 --> 00:02:06.250
You'll then get a running
report confirmation message.
00:02:06.250 --> 00:02:10.490
The vehicle must've been running for
at least a minute before running a report.
00:02:11.660 --> 00:02:15.040
Once it's finished running the report,
you'll receive a text message letting you
00:02:15.040 --> 00:02:16.760
know that you can now
view it in your email.
00:02:17.810 --> 00:02:19.090
If there is a problem,
00:02:19.090 --> 00:02:22.810
you can access dealer information
from your email to scheduled service.

question: what is the condition for obatianing run vehicle report?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:00:24.510 --> 00:00:29.400
Let me explain, adaptive steering with
tow/haul mode, changes the ratio between
00:00:29.400 --> 00:00:32.570
the driver's actions with the steering
wheel, meaning how much the driver
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:36.630
turns the steering wheel, and
how much the front wheels actually turn.
00:00:36.630 --> 00:00:39.660
At slower speeds, this allows
the front wheels to fully turn,
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.520
with fewer rotations
of the steering wheel,
00:00:42.520 --> 00:00:45.980
which is helpful when performing
low speed maneuvers like parking.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:48.280
When traveling at higher speeds,
on a highway for
00:00:48.280 --> 00:00:52.500
instance, this feature further
optimizes the steering response,
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.235
enabling the vehicle to react more
precisely to driver input and
00:00:56.235 --> 00:00:59.065
provide a smoother vehicle response
to your steering wheel input.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg2.mp4
question: What does adaptive steering help with?

video_name: Using Sport Mode - Ford Trucks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYZKTkmXyro
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.263
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.263 --> 00:00:07.204
You may be interested to know that
your vehicle may be equipped with
00:00:07.204 --> 00:00:11.430
a feature to enhance its performance when
driven on hilly and mountainous roads.
00:00:11.430 --> 00:00:12.750
Let me explain.
00:00:12.750 --> 00:00:15.200
It's called Sport Mode,
and when activated,
00:00:15.200 --> 00:00:19.140
the transmission extends the duration
between shifts of the lower gears.
00:00:19.140 --> 00:00:23.170
So the engine stays in the sweet spot
of the engine's RPM power band for
00:00:23.170 --> 00:00:25.580
a more spirited throttle response.
00:00:25.580 --> 00:00:27.350
So instead of constant up and
00:00:27.350 --> 00:00:31.420
down gear shifts, the transmission
holds a specific gear longer for
00:00:31.420 --> 00:00:35.720
peak performance when driving on twisty,
rolling roads with a steep grade.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Sport Mode - Ford Trucks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-rYZKTkmXyro_seg1.mp4
question: What is the use of sport mode?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:01:55.850 --> 00:01:59.360
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:01:59.360 --> 00:02:03.473
The sticker acts as a target with
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist feature and
00:02:03.473 --> 00:02:07.537
rear-view camera used to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:07.537 --> 00:02:09.147
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:09.147 --> 00:02:11.419
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:11.419 --> 00:02:15.521
You want to place the sticker within 7 to
22 inches from the center of the trailer
00:02:15.521 --> 00:02:16.198
hitch ball.
00:02:16.198 --> 00:02:19.879
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal service that
00:02:19.879 --> 00:02:21.681
is visible by the rear-view camera.
00:02:21.681 --> 00:02:24.369
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:24.369 --> 00:02:28.192
One the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:28.192 --> 00:02:29.841
record several measurements.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg4.mp4
question: Where does the checkered sticker need to be placed?

And push the seat back back for
a greater recline, or forward for

a more upright position.

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:01:02.740 --> 00:01:04.950
Every time that you turn your vehicle off,
and
00:01:04.950 --> 00:01:07.280
you've used plug in
energy during your trip,
00:01:07.280 --> 00:01:10.870
the Next Full Charge screen will appear on
the right side of your instrument cluster.
00:01:10.870 --> 00:01:15.470
It will show your estimated miles per
full charge, just like on the left side,
00:01:15.470 --> 00:01:19.880
plus additional information about how your
energy usage has impacted your estimate
00:01:19.880 --> 00:01:22.590
as compared to the rated
the electric range for your vehicle.

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:48.160 --> 00:00:49.250
Keep in mind,
00:00:49.250 --> 00:00:53.440
there are some factors that affect the
amount of energy being used while driving.
00:00:53.440 --> 00:00:57.330
For instance, mild or
aggressive acceleration or braking,
00:00:57.330 --> 00:01:01.905
your vehicle's speed, how much you use
accessories, such as climate control.
00:01:01.905 --> 00:01:06.232
The ambient temperature and other weather
conditions, as well as whether you're
00:01:06.232 --> 00:01:09.335
driving in the city or
on the highway, and the road grades.
00:01:09.335 --> 00:01:10.463
Any questions?

00:00:03.356 --> 00:00:06.996
Your vehicle may be equipped with a

the charge is complete.

 To toggle through the different gauge

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:00:33.340 --> 00:00:35.100
If a collision risk with the vehicle or
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:38.790
a pedestrian is detected,
it provides a warning to the driver.
00:00:38.790 --> 00:00:42.480
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield.
00:00:42.480 --> 00:00:43.580
A warning chime will sound.
00:00:43.580 --> 00:00:47.420
And a warning message will appear
in your information list this way.
00:00:47.420 --> 00:00:50.640
If you do not reactive and continue
to get closer to the pedestrians or
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:55.440
other vehicles after the alert, the system
precharges the brakes and if needed,
00:00:55.440 --> 00:01:00.050
can automatically apply full braking force
which may help produce the survorarity or
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:02.570
even eliminate certain frontal collisions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg3.mp4
question: Can the collision detection system automatically use the breaking feature?

00:02:30.490 --> 00:02:34.740

00:02:34.740 --> 00:02:36.670
a message in your message center.

video_trans:

Using the turn signal for
lane changes deactivates it.
00:01:53.520 --> 00:01:57.720
So it won't interfere in daily
driving with frequent turns and stops.
00:01:57.720 --> 00:02:01.630

00:02:01.630 --> 00:02:05.360

that you'll find helpful on sunny days.
00:00:09.670 --> 00:00:13.960

extension, and it adds an extra few inches
00:00:13.960 --> 00:00:17.200
to your sun visor arm to help
block the sunlight better.
00:00:17.200 --> 00:00:18.960
It's easy to use.
00:00:18.960 --> 00:00:21.650
Just rotate the visor toward
your side window, and
00:00:21.650 --> 00:00:23.610
pull it toward the rear
of the car to extend it.
00:00:24.730 --> 00:00:28.070
Then, push it back into
place to retract it.

Any questions?

facts you should know.

On certain vehicles, the system only

video_trans:
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:12.670
Great, now let's talk about what to do
if your lights do need to be adjusted.
00:01:12.670 --> 00:01:16.450
Or if you're going to be towing
something and need to move them.
00:01:16.450 --> 00:01:20.920
First, open your hood, do you see
the adjuster on your head lamps?
00:01:22.118 --> 00:01:26.320
With your screwdriver, twist each one
until your beams are at the right level.
00:01:26.320 --> 00:01:28.830
And remember to leave the marks
on your door or wall so
00:01:28.830 --> 00:01:31.700
that you can readjust the lights
back when you need to.

video_name: How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs
video_trans:
00:00:26.130 --> 00:00:29.690
During cold and hot weather,
you'll see reduced electric range.
00:00:29.690 --> 00:00:33.220
To help minimize this loss in
range in cold weather conditions,
00:00:33.220 --> 00:00:37.280
use the heated seats, and set your climate
control temperature and fan speed lower
00:00:37.280 --> 00:00:40.870
to help lessen the energy needed for
the high voltage electric heater.
00:00:40.870 --> 00:00:44.010
And for electric only vehicles,
specifically, keeping your vehicle
00:00:44.010 --> 00:00:47.670
plugged in whenever possible will help
maintain the battery temperature.
00:00:47.670 --> 00:00:51.580
It's also recommended that you
pre-heat your cabin while plugged in.
00:00:51.580 --> 00:00:53.640
You can do so through your touchscreen or
00:00:53.640 --> 00:00:57.633
through MyFord Mobile by setting your
planned departure time or go time and
00:00:57.633 --> 00:01:02.180
your desired cabin temperature so that the
system uses the energy from your home or
00:01:02.180 --> 00:01:05.880
charging station, instead of your
vehicle's high voltage battery.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Maximize EV Range _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fq63BXNCGUs_seg2.mp4
question: how to maintain the battery temperature during cold weather?

video_trans:

The green area of the gauge
represents miles per charge
00:00:57.700 --> 00:01:00.590
that is greater than the rated value for
your vehicle.
00:01:00.590 --> 00:01:01.640
Still with me?
00:01:01.640 --> 00:01:02.740
Great.

video_name: Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0
video_trans:
00:00:47.300 --> 00:00:51.375
Using the five way switch on your steering
wheel, from the settings menu, scroll to
00:00:51.375 --> 00:00:56.910
pre-collision, alert sensitivity, and
then select high, normal, or low.
00:00:56.910 --> 00:01:01.280
A lower setting will send fewer warnings,
while a higher setting with give earlier,
00:01:01.280 --> 00:01:02.250
more frequent warnings.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0_seg3.mp4
question: How many settings are there for sensitivity?

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:00:22.760 --> 00:00:25.970
Summer tires are ideal for
performance vehicles and
00:00:25.970 --> 00:00:29.366
do not have the same traction
characteristics of all-season tires.
00:00:29.366 --> 00:00:32.902
As they are designed for
superior traction, cornering, and
00:00:32.902 --> 00:00:37.010
braking performance for
both wet and dry road conditions.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:41.240
This is attributed to specialized tread
patterns, like less grooving, to provide
00:00:41.240 --> 00:00:46.159
more tire contact with the road, shallower
tread depth, and softer rubber compounds.
00:00:47.330 --> 00:00:51.550
Keep in mind, since summer tires
are composed of softer materials,
00:00:51.550 --> 00:00:53.360
they tend to lose flexibility.
00:00:53.360 --> 00:00:55.766
and are less suitable in colder temps and
00:00:55.766 --> 00:00:58.755
generally wear faster
than an all-season tire.
00:00:58.755 --> 00:01:02.646
And unlike all-season tires,
summer tires do not have a mud and
00:01:02.646 --> 00:01:05.601
snow traction rating and
are not recommended for
00:01:05.601 --> 00:01:09.870
cold weather below 45 degrees or
snowy and icy driving conditions.
00:01:11.220 --> 00:01:12.540
As a matter of fact,
00:01:12.540 --> 00:01:17.230
driving on summer tires in below
freezing conditions can damage them.
00:01:17.230 --> 00:01:21.590
If you must drive in these conditions,
Ford recommends using all-season or
00:01:21.590 --> 00:01:23.240
winter snow tires.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg2.mp4
question: Do summer tires wear easier than all-season tires?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:01:09.710 --> 00:01:12.960
And finally, to extend the life
of the bright chrome grill and
00:01:12.960 --> 00:01:17.600
other exterior trim parts, wax all
finishes regularly, especially before and
00:01:17.600 --> 00:01:19.050
after the winter season.
00:01:19.050 --> 00:01:22.100
Polishing and waxing can
maintain the finishes luster and
00:01:22.100 --> 00:01:24.580
help eliminate the occurrence
of rust spots.
00:01:24.580 --> 00:01:28.740
For best results, wipe residue off
using a microfiber detailing cloth and
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:30.530
following product directions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg4.mp4
question: How often should you wax your car?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:03:05.580 --> 00:03:08.610
To do so, touch the Alert button here.
00:03:08.610 --> 00:03:10.760
Then the Enable Alerts button.
00:03:10.760 --> 00:03:14.970
To set an alert, anytime you hear a song
or artist you want to be notified of,
00:03:14.970 --> 00:03:19.210
touch the Alert button,
choose either the artist, song title, or
00:03:19.210 --> 00:03:20.989
both, to add them to your alert.
00:03:22.030 --> 00:03:24.710
You'll get a message letting
you know they've been saved.
00:03:24.710 --> 00:03:26.470
Now, anytime that song or
00:03:26.470 --> 00:03:30.210
artist is being played on any channel
you'll receive a message on your screen
00:03:30.210 --> 00:03:35.150
asking if you'd like to tune to that
channel, delete, or disable alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg10.mp4
question: Where is the alert button?

system to work, the lines will turn green.
00:01:32.470 --> 00:01:34.270
This means it's ready to go.

00:00:25.154 --> 00:00:28.647

video_name: SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q
video_trans:
00:01:19.496 --> 00:01:24.257
On select vehicles, you may even be able
to link your driver memory setting to your
00:01:24.257 --> 00:01:25.984
personal code on the keypad.
00:01:25.984 --> 00:01:29.393
Whatever five-digit code you
programmed as code number one,
00:01:29.393 --> 00:01:31.397
remember, the one set to one, two?
00:01:31.397 --> 00:01:35.251
Will be linked to the memory settings
that are stored in the memory one button.
00:01:35.251 --> 00:01:40.401
So, when you enter that five digit code,
the memory one position will be recalled.
00:01:40.401 --> 00:01:44.677
Whatever five-digit code you programmed
as code number two, the one set on 3 4,
00:01:44.677 --> 00:01:48.666
will be linked to the memory setting that
are stored in the memory two button.
00:01:48.666 --> 00:01:51.916
And if you have a third,
you can store it on 5-6.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q_seg5.mp4

The colored guidelines,

Your vehicle also has fresh air mode.
00:02:32.130 --> 00:02:36.276
To select it, select the panel air

00:02:36.276 --> 00:02:40.610
dial to the coolest setting, select a fan
speed, press the A/C button to turn it
00:02:40.610 --> 00:02:44.400
off, and make sure that the recirculation
light is not illuminated.
00:02:45.760 --> 00:02:46.700
Any questions?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:00:15.740 --> 00:00:19.560
First press the lock button on your
key fob to lock all the doors.
00:00:20.620 --> 00:00:24.120
Then press the remote start button,
the one with the 2x icon two times.
00:00:24.120 --> 00:00:29.300
Your outside lights will flash twice and
then your car will start.
00:00:30.490 --> 00:00:31.340
For some vehicles,
00:00:31.340 --> 00:00:35.225
a light on your your remote will also let
you know if your car has started or not.
00:00:35.225 --> 00:00:37.235
Pretty convenient, right?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg2.mp4
question: How will I know if the car started?

video_name: Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo
video_trans:
00:00:23.690 --> 00:00:29.339
To use line lock, using the five-way
switch scroll down to Track Apps.
00:00:29.339 --> 00:00:31.210
And select Line Lock from the menu.
00:00:31.210 --> 00:00:33.860
There are two steps to using Line Lock.
00:00:33.860 --> 00:00:36.660
This step verifies the driver and
car are ready.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:38.670
Simply follow the prompts on the screen.
00:00:38.670 --> 00:00:41.130
If you're unable to select Line Lock,
00:00:41.130 --> 00:00:43.570
check to be sure you're driving
under 25 miles an hour,
00:00:43.570 --> 00:00:49.060
the vehicle is on a level surface, and
you're not in another driving mode.
00:00:49.060 --> 00:00:54.370
To engage, firmly press and hold the
brakes, press OK on the steering wheel,
00:00:54.370 --> 00:00:57.980
remove your foot from the brake pedal,
and hit the accelerator.
00:00:57.980 --> 00:01:02.422
A 15 second countdown timer will
show the remaining time left before
00:01:02.422 --> 00:01:03.785
Line Lock shuts off.
00:01:03.785 --> 00:01:06.480
[MUSIC]
00:01:06.480 --> 00:01:10.670
You can always manually cancel it
by pressing the OK button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo_seg2.mp4
question: how many steps involved in line lock?

To deactivate,
press the button again one time.

The indicator light will turn off and

video_trans:
00:00:34.790 --> 00:00:38.840
Touching the Sound tile allows you to
adjust certain sound settings, like treble
00:00:38.840 --> 00:00:44.330
and bass, midrange, fade and balance,
and speed adaptive volume control,
00:00:44.330 --> 00:00:48.070
which increases or decreases
the volume based on your driving speed.
00:00:48.070 --> 00:00:51.000
To reset sound levels back to

00:00:51.000 --> 00:00:54.500
just press the Reset All button, here.

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:15.680 --> 00:00:19.000
The trailer brake controller
automatically applies the trailer brakes
00:00:19.000 --> 00:00:21.610
when the tow vehicles brakes are pressed.
00:00:21.610 --> 00:00:24.760
The TBC control is located
on your center console.
00:00:24.760 --> 00:00:29.360
It has a manual control lever that sends
independent power to the trailer's brakes,
00:00:29.360 --> 00:00:31.170
and a plus and minus button.
00:00:31.170 --> 00:00:33.490
Pressing either of them
adjusts how much or
00:00:33.490 --> 00:00:36.940
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:36.940 --> 00:00:38.990
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:38.990 --> 00:00:41.670
lower the gain setting continuously.
00:00:41.670 --> 00:00:42.760
Still with me?
00:00:42.760 --> 00:00:43.880
Okay, then let's move on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg2.mp4
question: How do you use the trailer brake system?

video_name: One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk
video_trans:
00:00:56.930 --> 00:01:00.210
Keep in mind, if you continuously open and
close your windows in a short period of
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:04.370
time, it may cause your window
to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:04.370 --> 00:01:08.270
Also, if you press the window switch
quickly from the first to second position,
00:01:08.270 --> 00:01:11.180
it can cause your window
to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:11.180 --> 00:01:14.977
If this happens, release the switch,
wait a moment, then press it again.
00:01:14.977 --> 00:01:18.983
And remember, touching the switch at
all while the window is opening or
00:01:18.983 --> 00:01:20.270
closing will stop it.
00:01:21.640 --> 00:01:22.260
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk_seg6.mp4
question: What are the different ways my window can become disabled?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.360
Here's how it works.
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.500
Auto Start Stop automatically turns on
at startup unless you decided to turn it
00:00:18.500 --> 00:00:22.840
off using the on off button located
on the center console, here.
00:00:22.840 --> 00:00:25.570
You'll know it's activated when
you see the start-stop icon
00:00:25.570 --> 00:00:28.180
illuminated in your instrument cluster.
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:29.590
When you put your foot on the brake and
00:00:29.590 --> 00:00:33.690
come to a full stop, like at a red light,
your engine shuts off.
00:00:33.690 --> 00:00:35.580
You might not even notice it, but
00:00:35.580 --> 00:00:38.800
a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know the engine is off.
00:00:38.800 --> 00:00:39.580
But don't worry.
00:00:39.580 --> 00:00:44.100
Your climate control settings, radio,
and head lamps will function normally.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.870
And when you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.710
your car automatically restarts,
without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg2.mp4
question: Where on my dashboard does it indicate that the automatic start feature is on?

video_name: SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q
video_trans:
00:00:54.032 --> 00:00:56.484
If you want to change the factory
code to something that's easier for
00:00:56.484 --> 00:00:57.849
you to remember, you can do that too.
00:00:57.849 --> 00:00:58.848
[MUSIC]
00:00:58.848 --> 00:01:03.598
Just enter the factory code, press 1 2,
then enter your new code and
00:01:03.598 --> 00:01:07.478
your personal code will be
saved to position number one.
00:01:07.478 --> 00:01:10.699
If you're going to program
more than one code,
00:01:10.699 --> 00:01:14.725
press 1 2 after you entered
your first new code to save it,
00:01:14.725 --> 00:01:19.496
then enter a second personal code and
press3 4 to save it, and so on.

And here are a few other tips
you might be interested in.
00:01:39.270 --> 00:01:41.689
To cool down your car
quickly while in auto mode,
00:01:41.689 --> 00:01:44.525

to the desired setting.
00:01:44.525 --> 00:01:45.986
Or press the MAX A/C button,
00:01:45.986 --> 00:01:49.500

the fan speed to the highest setting.

Of course, if you'd rather not
use the Brake Coach feature,
00:01:02.980 --> 00:01:05.170
you can disable it using
the five-way control.
00:01:05.170 --> 00:01:12.317
Going back to your Settings menu,

video_name: Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0
video_trans:
00:00:42.260 --> 00:00:43.540
And one more thing.
00:00:43.540 --> 00:00:46.130
To help protect against fuel theft,
splashing, or
00:00:46.130 --> 00:00:49.770
water getting in the tank, the capless
fuel filler is tamper resistant.
00:00:49.770 --> 00:00:53.241
And the self closing spring-loaded flaps
help keep fuel from sloshing out and
00:00:53.241 --> 00:00:56.145
water from leaking in when it rains or
when you wash your vehicle.
00:00:56.145 --> 00:00:57.706

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:54.590 --> 00:00:59.120
Once adaptive cruise is on, it uses radar
to constantly scan for slower vehicles in
00:00:59.120 --> 00:01:03.100
front of you and automatically adjust
your speed to maintain the gap.
00:01:03.100 --> 00:01:04.630
You may notice that on occasion,
00:01:04.630 --> 00:01:07.600
you go slower than you
initially set your cruise for.
00:01:07.600 --> 00:01:10.540
But don't worry,
the system is still working.
00:01:10.540 --> 00:01:13.850
Once traffic is cleared,
you'll return to the speed you set.

video_name: Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.277
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.277 --> 00:00:06.654
Did you know that dirty glass or wiper
blades are one of the major reasons for
00:00:06.654 --> 00:00:09.020
streaks and
smears on your windshield when wiping?
00:00:10.170 --> 00:00:12.640
If this happens,
lift your wiper blades up and
  
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:16.680
clean the entire windshield glass,
as well as the rubber blades.
00:00:16.680 --> 00:00:19.270
Be sure to clean the windshield
using a neutral detergent
00:00:19.270 --> 00:00:23.030
such as Motorcraft Premium
Windshield Washer Concentrate or
00:00:23.030 --> 00:00:26.960
Motorcraft Ultra-Clear Spray
Glass Cleaner, and a soft cloth.
00:00:26.960 --> 00:00:28.090
Then rinse with clear water.
00:00:29.330 --> 00:00:32.405
In extreme cases,
you may need to use a mild abrasive,
00:00:32.405 --> 00:00:36.480
non-chlorinated cleaner, and
wash the wiper blades using a sponge or
00:00:36.480 --> 00:00:40.860
soft cloth and rubbing alcohol, or
Premium Windshield Washer Fluid.
00:00:40.860 --> 00:00:45.060
If your wipers continue to smear your
windshield, you may need to replace them.
00:00:45.060 --> 00:00:45.920
Any questions?
00:00:45.920 --> 00:00:48.075
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.075 --> 00:00:58.075
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM_seg1.mp4
question: How can the windshield be cleaned to remove dust or dirt?

video_name: Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc
video_trans:
00:01:06.820 --> 00:01:08.680
If you have the available power seats,
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.510
using the switch located on the side of
the seat you can move the seats forward or
00:01:12.510 --> 00:01:15.320
backward by sliding it forward or
backward.
00:01:15.330 --> 00:01:18.970
To raise the seat bottom,
move the switch up or down.
00:01:20.160 --> 00:01:24.050
And to tilt, just lift the front of
the switch to tilt backward and
00:01:24.050 --> 00:01:25.500
press down to tilt forward.
00:01:25.500 --> 00:01:29.406
To set the firmest of the lumbar
support using the lumbar button,
00:01:29.406 --> 00:01:35.654
here, press the front of it to increase
the firmness and the back to decrease it.
00:01:35.654 --> 00:01:36.635
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc_seg5.mp4
question: Can the firmness of lumbar support be adjusted?

is active anytime you put your vehicle in
00:00:22.440 --> 00:00:25.160

above five miles per hour.

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
00:00:46.760 --> 00:00:49.690
To put the seats back into their
original upright position,
00:00:49.690 --> 00:00:53.640
unfasten the prop rod and
stow it back into the slot in the floor.
00:00:53.640 --> 00:00:57.700
Then pull the entire seat down and
press it into its locked position.
00:00:57.700 --> 00:00:59.410
You'll hear it click into place.
00:00:59.410 --> 00:01:03.220
Finally, pull up on the shorter strap
closest to the seat back side, and
00:01:03.220 --> 00:01:04.600
flip the seat back up.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg2.mp4

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:00:57.560 --> 00:01:01.980
To fold the seats flat, pull up on the
same handle you used to recline the seat,
00:01:01.980 --> 00:01:05.570
and push the seat back all
the way forward until it's flat.

00:00:35.018 --> 00:00:38.295

at least two seconds.
00:00:38.295 --> 00:00:41.124
To stop your windows from closing,
00:00:41.124 --> 00:00:45.151

And just so you know,
00:00:46.241 --> 00:00:49.940
the bounce back function is also active

00:00:49.940 --> 00:00:53.655

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:02:09.570 --> 00:02:13.270
You may also notice that the charge
cord has multiple LED indicators
00:02:13.270 --> 00:02:17.580
to indicate that charging is in progress
or if any problems have occurred.
00:02:17.580 --> 00:02:21.340
When plugged into an AC outlet,
and you see a solid green light,
00:02:21.340 --> 00:02:24.080
power is available, but
vehicle charging has not begun.
00:02:25.470 --> 00:02:27.770
A flashing green light means
the vehicle is charging.
00:02:28.960 --> 00:02:32.270
If you see a flashing
solid red triangle LED,
00:02:32.270 --> 00:02:37.290
a ground fault circuit interrupter fault
or charge cord fault has been detected.
00:02:37.290 --> 00:02:41.610
However, if at any time you see a flashing
amber LED light in the shape of an outlet
00:02:41.610 --> 00:02:46.020
plug, that means high temperature
at the AC plug has been detected.
00:02:46.020 --> 00:02:48.610
Have the outlet checked by
a qualified electrician and
00:02:48.610 --> 00:02:50.839
make sure the AC plug fits
firmly into the outlet.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg7.mp4
question: What does a flashing red LED mean?

Language: en

00:00:16.000 --> 00:00:18.850

with the energy currently available.
00:00:22.210 --> 00:00:25.240

With gasoline ranges shown in white and
electric range in blue.

video_trans:
00:00:58.335 --> 00:01:04.330
To turn Autolock on or off, press the door
unlock button, then the door lock button.
00:01:04.330 --> 00:01:06.658
The horn will chirp once
if Autolock was turned off.
00:01:06.658 --> 00:01:13.142
Or twice, [NOISE] one short chirp, and
one long chirp if Autolock was turned on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM_seg4.mp4
question: How will you know is auto-lock is turned on?

video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:00:26.970 --> 00:00:27.820
Don't worry.
00:00:27.820 --> 00:00:29.450
If you'd rather choose when to lock or
00:00:29.450 --> 00:00:33.910
unlock your doors, you can turn off
either or both features at any time.
00:00:33.910 --> 00:00:36.740
First, you'll need to
access programming mode.
00:00:36.740 --> 00:00:37.316
Here's how.
00:00:37.316 --> 00:00:41.015
[MUSIC]
00:00:41.015 --> 00:00:45.980
Turn the car on,
press the car unlock button three times.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:50.945
Turn the car off, press the unlock
button three more times and
00:00:50.945 --> 00:00:52.895
turn the car on again.
00:00:52.895 --> 00:00:56.185
You'll hear a chirp to let you know
you've entered the programming mode.
00:00:56.185 --> 00:00:57.435
Still with me?
00:00:57.435 --> 00:00:58.335
Good.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM_seg3.mp4
question: How do I access the programing mode for the door locks?

video_trans:
00:01:21.630 --> 00:01:24.440
To adjust the display screen brightness,
in other words,
00:01:24.440 --> 00:01:27.530
your touchscreen, touch the Display tile.
00:01:27.530 --> 00:01:32.120
From here, you can adjust the brightness,
change the mode to Auto,
00:01:32.120 --> 00:01:35.000
Day, Night or Off.
00:01:35.000 --> 00:01:39.500
If you've chosen Off, just touch your
screen anywhere to bring it back.
00:01:39.500 --> 00:01:41.680
You can also turn Auto Dim on,
00:01:41.680 --> 00:01:45.930
which allows the display screen to dim
when you adjust the interior lighting.
