To help avoid injury,
the box step has a slow release
00:00:24.100 --> 00:00:27.220
that prevents the step from
springing out too quickly.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Box Side Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dcsLsT9KpiU_seg2.mp4
question: how do you extend the step?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:30.320 --> 00:01:34.050
In fact, there are four different
gaps that you can choose from.
00:01:34.050 --> 00:01:38.140
One bar, or the sportiest setting,
gets you the smallest gap.
00:01:38.140 --> 00:01:40.720
Two bars, which is the default gap.
00:01:40.720 --> 00:01:45.680
Three bars, or four, which is the comfort
setting and gives you the biggest gap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg7.mp4
question: What mode gives you the smallest gap?

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:00:41.960 --> 00:00:43.760
If you turn the trailer to the right,
00:00:43.760 --> 00:00:47.240
you'll see the right side of your
vehicle and trailer and vice versa.
00:00:47.240 --> 00:00:51.480
You can switch views manually at
any time by using the arrow keys.
00:00:51.480 --> 00:00:57.820
Either full driver, partial driver, 50-50,
partial passenger or full passenger.
00:00:58.990 --> 00:01:01.740
Pressing the Camera icon takes
you to Normal Rear View,
00:01:01.740 --> 00:01:05.160
which allows you to see your trailer hitch
or what is directly behind your truck.
00:01:06.850 --> 00:01:10.340
Pressing the Plus button zooms in,
pressing the Return or
00:01:10.340 --> 00:01:14.610
Back button takes you back to
the 360 degree camera system.
00:01:14.610 --> 00:01:16.650
And Auto returns you to
Automatic View Mode.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA_seg3.mp4
question: How do you zoom in on the trailer views?

video_name: Electric Parking Brake Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Qrl3w8RBP6Q
video_trans:
00:00:28.647 --> 00:00:32.229
Your brakes also have something
called a Drive Away Release.
00:00:32.229 --> 00:00:36.990
Once you've closed the door, buckled in,
turned on the ignition, shifted into
00:00:36.990 --> 00:00:41.971
gear and pressed the accelerator, your
parking brake will automatically release.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Parking Brake Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Qrl3w8RBP6Q_seg4.mp4
question: What are the actions required to activate the drive away release?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:14.355 --> 00:00:17.840
Let's start with BLIS or
Blind Spot Information System.
00:00:17.840 --> 00:00:19.930
Any time you put your vehicle in drive and
00:00:19.930 --> 00:00:23.140
you are going faster than six
miles per hour BLIS will turn on.
00:00:23.140 --> 00:00:27.410
After that it's always active when
your vehicle is drive or neutral.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg2.mp4
question: What is the use of  BLIS?

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:00:41.765 --> 00:00:45.610
Okay, now let's talk about how
to replace the 12-volt battery.
00:00:45.610 --> 00:00:48.657
It's located inside the cabin,
under the driver's seat.
00:00:48.657 --> 00:00:52.470
First, you'll need to move
the driver's seat all the way back.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:56.351
Next, open the two plastic screw covers
on each side of the front of the seat,
00:00:56.351 --> 00:01:00.729
by inserting your finger into the tabs and
pulling them open, they'll swing inward.
00:01:00.729 --> 00:01:06.481
Now remove the two rail stop bolts
using a T-40 type Torx bit, here.
00:01:06.481 --> 00:01:10.071
With the arm rests folded up,
slide the seat all the way forward.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg3.mp4
question: How can the 12-volt battery be accessed?

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:12.168 --> 00:00:15.280
The customer placed trailer
camera prep kit can be mounted to
00:00:15.280 --> 00:00:16.530
the rear of a trailer.
00:00:16.530 --> 00:00:20.820
And provides added driver convenience
when backing up with an attached trailer.
00:00:20.820 --> 00:00:25.660
The kit includes a camera, wiring harness,
mounting bracket, and mounting parts.
00:00:25.660 --> 00:00:30.100
To use the camera requires the available
Sync 3 system, and either the available
00:00:30.100 --> 00:00:35.700
ultimate trailer tow camera system, or
rear center high mounted stop lamp camera.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs_seg2.mp4
question: What four items are included with the trailer mounted prep kit?

video_name: Electric Parking Brake Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Qrl3w8RBP6Q
video_trans:
00:00:21.325 --> 00:00:25.154
To release it make sure your
foot is on the brake, and
00:00:25.154 --> 00:00:28.647
the ignition is on,
then push the switch down.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Parking Brake Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Qrl3w8RBP6Q_seg3.mp4
question: Where are my parking brake releases on my car?

video_name: Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs
video_trans:
00:00:45.570 --> 00:00:48.950
There are a few things that you may
need to know to prevent damaging them.
00:00:48.950 --> 00:00:51.430
Before you put a jack
underneath your vehicle,
00:00:51.430 --> 00:00:54.790
you'll need to ensure that the power
running boards are turned off.
00:00:54.790 --> 00:00:58.400
Also, when using a jack,
be sure to check your owner's manual for
00:00:58.400 --> 00:01:00.440
proper mounting locations.
00:01:00.440 --> 00:01:04.510
And when using a hoist lift be sure to
place the lift arms under the frame rails
00:01:04.510 --> 00:01:09.130
at all times to avoid damage to the under
body and running board components.
00:01:09.130 --> 00:01:10.250
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs_seg4.mp4
question: Where and how should I place the jack?

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:
00:00:57.110 --> 00:01:01.446
Compared to a four or five speed,
the six speed SelectShift transmission,
00:01:01.446 --> 00:01:06.121
gives you greater acceleration from a dead
stop, in first and second gear, while
00:01:06.121 --> 00:01:10.486
higher gears give you better efficiency
with lower RPMs at highway speeds.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc_seg5.mp4
question: What does six gears do for acceleration speed?

video_name: 60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.348 --> 00:00:05.553
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.553 --> 00:00:07.440
Can these seat backs be folded down?
00:00:09.560 --> 00:00:11.150
>> Can I fold down just one side?
00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:15.320
>> Did you know that you
can fold down one or
00:00:15.320 --> 00:00:17.780
both of the rear seat
backs in your vehicle?
00:00:17.780 --> 00:00:21.680
And that's helpful when carrying
longer items like skis or golf bags.
00:00:21.680 --> 00:00:23.740
Here's how to do it.
00:00:23.740 --> 00:00:27.110
Find the release on top of the seat
back you want to fold down.
00:00:27.110 --> 00:00:31.715
Then, just push or pull up to release
the seat back and fold it down.
00:00:31.715 --> 00:00:35.235
Do the same thing on the other side
if you want to fold them both down.
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:38.175
You'll get a full pass through
from the trunk that way.
00:00:38.175 --> 00:00:42.601
And for your convenience, the 2013 Fusion
Hybrid battery has been moved to the floor
00:00:42.601 --> 00:00:45.349
of the trunk, so
it won't block the pass through.
00:00:45.349 --> 00:00:47.900
And there's a clip that holds
your safety belts in place, so
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.305
they won't get caught behind
when folding your seat back.
00:00:51.305 --> 00:00:52.395
Any questions?
00:00:52.395 --> 00:00:53.862
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:53.862 --> 00:00:54.529
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4_seg1.mp4
question: How do you fold the seat backs down?

video_name: Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek
video_trans:
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:31.890
Here, you can change the mode to alert
00:00:31.890 --> 00:00:34.440
which will vibrate your steering
wheel if you start to drift.
00:00:36.040 --> 00:00:39.990
Aid, which uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer the car back
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:40.886
into the target lane.
00:00:40.886 --> 00:00:44.480
Or Alert + Aid which gives
you both sets of cues.
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.870
Unlike when you're in the alert mode,
in the combined mode,
00:00:48.870 --> 00:00:52.520
you won't feel the alert vibration
until you're further out of your lane.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek_seg3.mp4
question: What does the Alert mode do?

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:00:33.340 --> 00:00:35.100
If a collision risk with the vehicle or
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:38.790
a pedestrian is detected,
it provides a warning to the driver.
00:00:38.790 --> 00:00:42.480
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield.
00:00:42.480 --> 00:00:43.580
A warning chime will sound.
00:00:43.580 --> 00:00:47.420
And a warning message will appear
in your information list this way.
00:00:47.420 --> 00:00:50.640
If you do not reactive and continue
to get closer to the pedestrians or
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:55.440
other vehicles after the alert, the system
precharges the brakes and if needed,
00:00:55.440 --> 00:01:00.050
can automatically apply full braking force
which may help produce the survorarity or
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:02.570
even eliminate certain frontal collisions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg3.mp4
question: What happens if the car continues to get closer to the object after the alert?

video_name: Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0
video_trans:
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:39.740
If equipped with a diesel engine,
the lower door is available for
00:00:39.740 --> 00:00:42.260
adding diesel exhaust fluid only.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Refueling _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vM-EW2gDMn0_seg2.mp4
question: What must be done to close the fuel door if equipped with diesel engine?

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:01:38.526 --> 00:01:39.932
To remove the battery cover,
00:01:39.932 --> 00:01:44.100
first remove the small panel that
covers the negative battery cable.
00:01:44.100 --> 00:01:47.050
Once the panel is off, you'll need
to loosen the nuts on the negative
00:01:47.050 --> 00:01:49.680
pull clamps and
remove the cable from the battery.
00:01:49.680 --> 00:01:52.608
Next, unsnap the tab in the front, here.
00:01:52.608 --> 00:01:55.984
Then, slide the lid forward until
the two additional front-side tabs
00:01:55.984 --> 00:01:57.830
come unattached.
00:01:57.830 --> 00:02:01.028
Now, lift and pull the cover to remove it.
00:02:01.028 --> 00:02:03.426
Then, loosen the nuts on
the positive pull clamps and
00:02:03.426 --> 00:02:05.580
remove the clamps from the battery.
00:02:05.580 --> 00:02:09.139
Be sure to use the lift handles
provided when removing the batteries,
00:02:09.139 --> 00:02:10.539
since they are very heavy.
00:02:10.539 --> 00:02:14.739
You may have a single battery. To replace
it with the cover panel off, loosen and
00:02:14.739 --> 00:02:17.060
remove the negative pull clamp.
00:02:17.060 --> 00:02:20.798
Then rotate the battery and
remove the positive pull clamp.
00:02:20.798 --> 00:02:24.062
To install the new battery,
just follow the same directions, but
00:02:24.062 --> 00:02:25.180
in the reverse order.
00:02:26.520 --> 00:02:30.043
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg5.mp4
question: what is the first step to remove battery cover?

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:02:22.810 --> 00:02:27.370
Keep in mind you can also run a Vehicle
Health Report using voice commands.
00:02:27.370 --> 00:02:29.470
Just use the voice button
on your steering wheel and
00:02:29.470 --> 00:02:32.898
say Vehicle Health, it's that simple.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg7.mp4
question: How do I run a Vehicle Health Report using voice prompts?

video_name: F-150 Box Side Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dcsLsT9KpiU
video_trans:
00:00:14.850 --> 00:00:17.220
To extend the step from
its stowed position,
00:00:17.220 --> 00:00:19.820
simply press down on the release
with your foot here.
00:00:20.840 --> 00:00:24.100
To help avoid injury,
the box step has a slow release
00:00:24.100 --> 00:00:27.220
that prevents the step from
springing out too quickly.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Box Side Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dcsLsT9KpiU_seg2.mp4
question: Why does the box step have a slow release?

video_name: Drive vs. Sport Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7I38idrdK2E
video_trans:
00:00:44.220 --> 00:00:46.456
Okay, now let's talk about SelectShift.
00:00:46.456 --> 00:00:47.911
[MUSIC]
00:00:47.911 --> 00:00:52.109
To use it,
move your gear shift to the S position.
00:00:52.109 --> 00:00:55.615
And press the plus-minus buttons on
the the side of the gear shift to
00:00:55.615 --> 00:00:56.425
select gears.
00:00:56.425 --> 00:01:00.255
Press plus to upshift and
minus to downshift.
00:01:00.255 --> 00:01:03.488
Keep in mind your engine will rev
at various speeds depending on
00:01:03.488 --> 00:01:05.080
what gear you've shifted to.
00:01:05.080 --> 00:01:07.638
If your engine RPM is too high or too low,
00:01:07.638 --> 00:01:11.408
your vehicle will automatically
make some shifts for you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Drive vs. Sport Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7I38idrdK2E_seg3.mp4
question: How gear is shifted in automatic vehicle?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:01:51.770 --> 00:01:52.390
Settings and
00:01:52.390 --> 00:01:56.100
Advanced Settings which allows you to
configure certain things like lighting,
00:01:56.100 --> 00:02:00.810
locks and wipers, remote start, climate
controls, and let's you create a MyKey.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk_seg7.mp4

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.183 --> 00:00:07.223
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.223 --> 00:00:10.453
The second row seats in your
Transit Connect wagon can be folded up or
00:00:10.453 --> 00:00:12.770
even removed for extra cargo space.
00:00:12.770 --> 00:00:14.480
Let me show you how to do it.
00:00:14.480 --> 00:00:16.400
To fold the second row seats forward,
00:00:16.400 --> 00:00:18.450
first push down the head
restraints like this.
00:00:19.530 --> 00:00:23.830
Now, find the strap located on the side
of the seat back closest to the door,
00:00:23.830 --> 00:00:26.260
here, and
pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:27.670 --> 00:00:32.380
Next, find the longer strap located in the
center of the backside of the seat back.
00:00:32.380 --> 00:00:35.610
Pull up to unlock it,
then lift the entire seat up to tumble it.
00:00:36.980 --> 00:00:39.820
Now, secure the seat by
locating the prop rod
00:00:39.820 --> 00:00:42.470
directly below the seat inside the floor.
00:00:42.470 --> 00:00:45.530
Lift it out and snap it onto
the prop rod latch, like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg1.mp4
question: Can the second row seats be removed?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:01:53.105 --> 00:01:57.020
If your vehicle includes the blind
spot information system BLIS,
00:01:57.020 --> 00:01:59.970
the system first prompts you to
set up your trailer BLIS feature.
00:02:00.980 --> 00:02:03.920
Next, a message appears in
the information display,
00:02:03.920 --> 00:02:06.570
asking if you want to
Add Trailer Reverse Guidance.
00:02:06.570 --> 00:02:07.350
Select Yes.
00:02:08.360 --> 00:02:12.620
A prompt will direct you to straighten the
trailer if necessary, to continue set up.
00:02:12.620 --> 00:02:15.790
You'll then get another message directing
you to use the quick start guide
00:02:15.790 --> 00:02:16.359
to proceed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg3.mp4
question: What does the BLIS feature do?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:02:03.200 --> 00:02:07.270
Replay allows you to listen to up to 44
minutes of previously cast contents from
00:02:07.270 --> 00:02:08.000
the current channel.
00:02:09.280 --> 00:02:13.060
The system will begin storing
content once a channel is selected.
00:02:13.060 --> 00:02:16.570
To replay a song,
just tape the seek back button once and
00:02:16.570 --> 00:02:18.700
it will jump back to the prior song.
00:02:18.700 --> 00:02:20.290
To jump multiple songs or
00:02:20.290 --> 00:02:24.960
listen to content farther back,
tap the seek back button multiple times.
00:02:24.960 --> 00:02:28.640
To return to real time content,
touch the Replay button again and
00:02:28.640 --> 00:02:31.040
it will bring you back to live audio.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg7.mp4
question: When does the system begin storing content?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:01:15.390 --> 00:01:16.460
When connecting a trailer,
00:01:16.460 --> 00:01:19.840
you can follow a connection checklist
to ensure nothing's been missed.
00:01:19.840 --> 00:01:23.850
To do so, from the towing menu,
scroll down to Connection Checklist,
00:01:23.850 --> 00:01:28.290
then choose type of trailer,
Conventional, Fifth Wheel or Gooseneck.
00:01:28.290 --> 00:01:30.980
And it will walk you through
the connection process to remind you of
00:01:30.980 --> 00:01:32.620
the necessary steps.
00:01:32.620 --> 00:01:33.660
Press OK to confirm.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg5.mp4
question: Where is the connection checklist located?

video_name: Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI
video_trans:
00:00:16.330 --> 00:00:18.660
If your vehicle is equipped
with a manual transmission,
00:00:18.660 --> 00:00:22.950
be sure your vehicle is at a complete stop
before attempting to shift into reverse.
00:00:22.950 --> 00:00:26.670
Now, press the clutch pedal all
the way to the floor to disengage it.
00:00:26.670 --> 00:00:31.110
Then use your fingers to pull up on the
collar located below the gear shift knob,
00:00:31.110 --> 00:00:35.105
and move the gear shift lever all
the way to the left, then forward.
00:00:35.105 --> 00:00:39.315
Remember, the gear shift can only be moved
to reverse by raising the lock-out ring.
00:00:39.315 --> 00:00:42.525
It protects the transmission from
accidentally engaging reverse when you're
00:00:42.525 --> 00:00:44.679
intending to shift into first.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI_seg2.mp4
question: What is the reverse lock system for?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.983
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.983 --> 00:00:06.923
Your vehicle may have several
climate control features that help
00:00:06.923 --> 00:00:10.020
make controlling the inside
temperature simple.
00:00:10.020 --> 00:00:11.300
Let me explain.

video_trans:
00:00:26.460 --> 00:00:29.570
To lock your doors, simply press
the sensor on the door handle for
00:00:29.570 --> 00:00:30.890
about a half a second.
00:00:30.890 --> 00:00:33.470
It'll have ridges or
a square sensor like this.
00:00:34.530 --> 00:00:36.300
When you hear them click,
you'll know they're locked.
00:00:37.450 --> 00:00:41.090
Or you can press the lock/unlock
button on the inside door panel
00:00:41.090 --> 00:00:44.280
before closing the door and
it will automatically lock.

video_name: One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk
video_trans:
00:00:56.930 --> 00:01:00.210
Keep in mind, if you continuously open and
close your windows in a short period of
00:01:00.210 --> 00:01:04.370
time, it may cause your window
to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:04.370 --> 00:01:08.270
Also, if you press the window switch
quickly from the first to second position,
00:01:08.270 --> 00:01:11.180
it can cause your window
to be temporarily disabled.
00:01:11.180 --> 00:01:14.977
If this happens, release the switch,
wait a moment, then press it again.
00:01:14.977 --> 00:01:18.983
And remember, touching the switch at
all while the window is opening or
00:01:18.983 --> 00:01:20.270
closing will stop it.
00:01:21.640 --> 00:01:22.260
Any questions?

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:00:33.340 --> 00:00:35.100
If a collision risk with the vehicle or
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:38.790
a pedestrian is detected,
it provides a warning to the driver.
00:00:38.790 --> 00:00:42.480
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield.
00:00:42.480 --> 00:00:43.580
A warning chime will sound.
00:00:43.580 --> 00:00:47.420
And a warning message will appear
in your information list this way.
00:00:47.420 --> 00:00:50.640
If you do not reactive and continue
to get closer to the pedestrians or
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:55.440
other vehicles after the alert, the system
precharges the brakes and if needed,
00:00:55.440 --> 00:01:00.050
can automatically apply full braking force
which may help produce the survorarity or
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:02.570
even eliminate certain frontal collisions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg3.mp4
question: how does the system eliminate severity?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:15.650 --> 00:00:19.640
Adaptive cruise control maintains
a pre-set gap by adjusting the vehicle's
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:22.250
speed so you don't need to
constantly use your brake and
00:00:22.250 --> 00:00:25.340
accelerator to adjust with
the speed of traffic.

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:01:06.450 --> 00:01:10.310
If at any time the battery in your remote
dies or the signal is interrupted,
00:01:10.310 --> 00:01:14.320
you can use the removable key
inside to unlock the driver's door.
00:01:14.320 --> 00:01:16.110
Just press the button and
slide the key out.
00:01:17.180 --> 00:01:19.920
Next, insert the key into the slot located
00:01:19.920 --> 00:01:22.440
underneath the rear of
the driver's door handle and
00:01:22.440 --> 00:01:26.320
push up until you feel the internal
tab flex and unlock the plastic bezel.
00:01:27.520 --> 00:01:30.560
Slide the bezel back to
completely remove it.
00:01:30.560 --> 00:01:35.220
When you do, you'll be able to access
the key cylinder and unlock your door.
00:01:35.220 --> 00:01:36.350
To replace the bezel,
00:01:36.350 --> 00:01:39.410
slide it forward until you feel
it snap into the locked position.
00:01:40.650 --> 00:01:44.537
Once you're in, there's a pocket in the
center console made just for the key fob.
00:01:44.537 --> 00:01:46.680
It'll allow you to start your car.
00:01:46.680 --> 00:01:49.860
Place the key fob in the slot
with the button's facing up and
00:01:49.860 --> 00:01:52.810
the unlock button towards
the front of the vehicle.
00:01:52.810 --> 00:01:56.695
Keep in mind, because the key is
programmed to your car, if you lose it,
00:01:56.695 --> 00:01:59.050
you'll need to contact your dealer for
a replacement.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c_seg6.mp4
question: what to do if the battery in the key dies?

video_name: SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.405 --> 00:00:03.973
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.980 --> 00:00:07.180
Did you know that your vehicle may be
equipped with a feature
00:00:07.180 --> 00:00:11.520
that allows you to stay connected and control certain
features remotely, like unlock and
00:00:11.540 --> 00:00:14.900
lock your doors as well as
remote start your vehicle?
00:00:14.920 --> 00:00:19.208
All you need is the available
Sync Connect, a compatible smartphone, and
00:00:19.208 --> 00:00:20.170
Ford Pass.
00:00:20.170 --> 00:00:21.520
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:21.520 --> 00:00:25.340
The first thing you'll need to do is
download FordPass from the App Store or
00:00:25.340 --> 00:00:28.500
Google Play and
accept the terms and conditions.
00:00:28.500 --> 00:00:33.491
If you already have a Ford owner account,
you can log in using your username and
00:00:33.491 --> 00:00:34.350
password.
00:00:34.350 --> 00:00:38.920
If not, you can create an account via the
FordPass app with some basic information
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:40.400
and a four digit PIN.
00:00:40.400 --> 00:00:43.820
You'll then need to add your
sync connect equipped vehicle.
00:00:43.820 --> 00:00:45.710
Go to the My Vehicles card.
00:00:45.710 --> 00:00:47.600
Click on Add Vehicle.
00:00:47.600 --> 00:00:50.610
To add a second vehicle hit the + button.
00:00:50.610 --> 00:00:55.500
Next, scan the VIN bar code by selecting
the Use Camera tab and point your
00:00:55.500 --> 00:00:59.920
phone's camera to the VIN label located
on your vehicle's driver door sill.
00:00:59.920 --> 00:01:02.530
You'll get a scanned successfully screen.
00:01:02.530 --> 00:01:05.570
Next, assign a vehicle nickname,
then, hit Finish.
00:01:06.590 --> 00:01:10.360
Next, you'll see this screen directing
you to activate SYNC Connect by
00:01:10.360 --> 00:01:13.200
touching the Activate SYNC Connect button.
00:01:13.200 --> 00:01:16.170
After a few minutes,
go to your vehicle and start it.
00:01:16.170 --> 00:01:19.630
You will then see this pop up
on the SYNC 3 touchscreen.
00:01:19.630 --> 00:01:20.800
Touch Allow to continue.
00:01:21.880 --> 00:01:25.843
Keep in mind, if you do not touch Allow
in the pop-up within 10 start-ups,
00:01:25.843 --> 00:01:28.306
you will not gain access
to remote features, and
00:01:28.306 --> 00:01:30.608
will need to reactivate
from the beginning.
00:01:30.608 --> 00:01:31.873
[MUSIC]
00:01:31.873 --> 00:01:36.091
Once you do, after a short period of time,
all remote features can be
00:01:36.091 --> 00:01:40.188
accessed from your smartphones
FordPass Vehicle Controls card.
00:01:40.188 --> 00:01:41.265
Any questions?
00:01:41.265 --> 00:01:44.705
Go to owner.ford.com or FordPass.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s_seg1.mp4
question: What is the VIN barcode, and where can it be found?

video_name: Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.277
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.277 --> 00:00:06.654
Did you know that dirty glass or wiper
blades are one of the major reasons for
00:00:06.654 --> 00:00:09.020
streaks and
smears on your windshield when wiping?
00:00:10.170 --> 00:00:12.640
If this happens,
lift your wiper blades up and
  
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:16.680
clean the entire windshield glass,
as well as the rubber blades.
00:00:16.680 --> 00:00:19.270
Be sure to clean the windshield
using a neutral detergent
00:00:19.270 --> 00:00:23.030
such as Motorcraft Premium
Windshield Washer Concentrate or
00:00:23.030 --> 00:00:26.960
Motorcraft Ultra-Clear Spray
Glass Cleaner, and a soft cloth.
00:00:26.960 --> 00:00:28.090
Then rinse with clear water.
00:00:29.330 --> 00:00:32.405
In extreme cases,
you may need to use a mild abrasive,
00:00:32.405 --> 00:00:36.480
non-chlorinated cleaner, and
wash the wiper blades using a sponge or
00:00:36.480 --> 00:00:40.860
soft cloth and rubbing alcohol, or
Premium Windshield Washer Fluid.
00:00:40.860 --> 00:00:45.060
If your wipers continue to smear your
windshield, you may need to replace them.
00:00:45.060 --> 00:00:45.920
Any questions?
00:00:45.920 --> 00:00:48.075
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.075 --> 00:00:58.075
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM_seg1.mp4
question: What is the structure of the wiper plates?
